tlk.string: Carver
Bethany
It used to be we never got visitors to the Wilds, but now it seems they arrive in hordes!
I don't know what you are, but I won't let you harm us!
Come no closer!
Let me? If I wished you harm, I daresay you could not stop me.
I don't know what we would have done if you hadn't arrived.
Thank you for saving us.
I do! You would have perished. You still may.
Impressive. Where'd you learn how to turn into a dragon?
Nice trick.
Perhaps I am a dragon.
If so, count yourself lucky. The smell of burning darkspawn does nothing for the appetite.
If you wish to flee the darkspawn, you should know you are heading in the wrong direction.
Wait! You can't just leave us here!
So you're just going to leave us here?
Can I not?
I spotted a most curious sight: a mighty ogre, vanquished! Who could perform such a feat?
But now my curiosity is sated, and you are safe... for the moment. Is that not enough?
We can get to Kirkwall on our own.
We're fine.
Is it fate or chance? I can never decide.
It appears fortune smiles on us both today. I may be able to help you yet.
Perhaps you do not, but it turns out I need you.
There is always a catch. Life is a catch! I suggest you catch it while you can!
Maybe we shouldn't trust her. I don't even know what she is.
Should we even trust her? We don't even know what she is!
I know what she is. The Witch of the Wilds.
Some call me that. Also Flemeth. Asha'bellanar. An old hag who talks too much!
Does it matter? I offer you this: I will get your group past the horde in exchange for a simple delivery to a place not far out of your way. Would you do this for a Witch of the Wilds?
Should we trust her?
What do the rest of you think?
What is a Witch of the Wilds, exactly?
Witch of the Wilds?
How much trouble will this delivery be, exactly?
What will we be facing?
You would go through all that trouble to have something delivered?
Why not go yourself?
I have to reach Kirkwall first.
I can't guarantee delivery.
We don't have much choice.
Agreed.
Roast a few more darkspawn, I'll do anything you want!
We could use more fire.
We won't be able to get through the darkspawn on our own.
We need to get out of here.
They are everywhere or soon will be. Where is it you plan to run to, hmm?
We need to get to Kirkwall—in the Free Marches.
You could show me that trick of yours. That looks useful.
I want to be a dragon.
Laughs
I daresay it is! Such a clever tongue for a mage!
If only a clever tongue was all one needed!
Tell me, clever child: how do you intend to outrun the Blight?
Wesley is injured. We'll never escape the darkspawn.
If you need to, leave me behind.
No! I said I would drag you out if I had to, and I meant it!
A Chasind legend. Witches that steal children.
Bah! As if I had nothing better to do!
You're an apostate?
Yes. Just like you.
Then you're an apostate.
As it so happens.
Yes, we have so much in common!
About as much trouble as my saving your lives not five minutes ago.
We didn't ask you for anything.
We would have been fine.
Of course. My mistake!
That's a lot to ask without telling us what this involves.
We need to know details.
It's nothing more dangerous than one so capable can handle.
Good point.
You got me there.
If you knew my daughter, you'd know how seldom I hear that.
I have... an appointment to keep.
It is far more convenient this way. Happily, you're not without your own needs.
But you will do it.
We never do.
There is a clan of Dalish elves near the city of Kirkwall. Deliver this amulet to their Keeper, Marethari.
Sadly, my charity is at an end.
Do as she asks with it and any debt between us is paid in full.
Before I take you anywhere, however, there is another matter...
No! Leave him alone!
What has been done to your man is within his blood already.
You lie!
She's right, Aveline. I can feel the corruption inside me.
What are you talking about?
What corruption?
From the darkspawn. All that blood. I knew... when it happened.
There must be something we can do.
We have to help him!
The only cure I know of is to become a Grey Warden.
And they all died at Ostagar.
Not all, but the last are now beyond your reach.
Aveline. Listen to me.
You can't ask me this! I won't!
Please. The corruption is a slow death. I can't...
He's your husband, Aveline. I can't decide his fate.
It's up to you.
Whatever you're going to do, do it. We can't wait.
Put him out of his misery.
And they all died at Ostagar.
This corruption is the permanent sort, I take it?
Sounds bad.
Not long now, if I am any judge.
We can't afford that kind of liability.
Leave him.
No!
Be strong, my love.
Thank you.
Without an end, there can be no peace.
It gets no easier. Your struggles have only just begun.
I'm sorry, Aveline. This has to be done.
I'll do it.
They're almost on top of us, Brother.
They're almost on top of us, Brother.
They're almost on top of us, Sister.
They're almost on top of us, Sister.
We will have to fight them sooner or later.
Then we make our stand here. Prepare yourself.
We can't keep this up forever.
We can't keep this up forever.
We'll take the bastards down with us.
Then we fight.
We'll make it through this—together.
I'm right beside you.
Perhaps we'll be lucky and they'll run out of darkspawn.
Neither can they.
Here they come. Shall I give them a taste of my blade?
All yours, Brother.
Do it.
Here they come. Shall I deal with them?
Allow me.
I'll deal with them.
All yours, Sister.
Do it.
What is that?
What is that?
There's no end to them...
There's no end to them...
Well, well, what have we here?
The Blight had been unleashed on Ferelden.
The battle was a disaster.
Unopposed, the horde marched on the village of Lothering.
The Champion's family barely escaped in time...
Bullshit. That's not what really happened!
Does that not match the story you've heard, Seeker?
You'll need to hear the whole story.
Your king will not miss you, hmm?
So far... simply to flee the darkspawn.
We will have to fight them sooner or later.
Lothering is gone, and Ferelden may soon follow. We have to go.
Our home was just destroyed.
King Cailan was betrayed. There's nothing for me here.
He is dead.
I'm sure he'll miss his life more.
He has no opinion.
Our home is gone, but I don't imagine you care.
We have nowhere else.
Any better suggestions? I hear the Deep Roads are vacant now.
How far do you recommend?
Laughs Oh, you I like!
Our home is gone, and we have nowhere else to go.
We have family there.
I see.
Hurtled into the chaos, you fight... and the world will shake before you.
Select a follower:
Didn't I say we don't need you?
I already told you no.
And we should accept your help? We don't even know what you are.
How can we trust you?
Anything you could do for us would be appreciated.
We could use the help.
There must be a catch.
Just like that?
At least we're alive. That's no small feat.
Look on the bright side.
I know how much Lothering meant to you, but we have to move.
I'm sorry, Mother.
We have to get out of here while we still can.
We're wasting time.
We're going to Kirkwall—in the Free Marches.
That woman is an apostate. The Order dictates...
I'm watching you, templar.
Just keep him back.
Outside Lothering
Lowtown
Lowtown
Lowtown
Lowtown (Night)
Lowtown (Night)
Lowtown (Night)
Hightown
Hightown
Hightown
Hightown (Night)
Hightown (Night)
Hightown (Night)
Gamlen's House
Abandoned House
Merrill's Home
Hawke Estate
Hawke Estate
Danarius's Manor
Sobs
The Bone Pit
The Bone Pit
The Bone Pit
Sundermount
Sundermount
Sundermount
The Wounded Coast
The Wounded Coast
The Wounded Coast
And why not?
Kirkwall? My, but that is quite the voyage you plan.
The wrath of the templars is terrible, indeed.
He's gentle for a mage-hunter.
How bad is that wound?
Can he keep up? We have to go.
I was traveling to Denerim on business for the Order, but I had to turn south when I heard of Ostagar.
And I you. Terms I am sure we both expected.
Hightown (Night)
Lowtown (Night)
More so their wives. But as long as there is a greater danger, you and I have an accord.
I think my sword arm's a loss, even with healing.
DuPuis Estate
Bartrand's Estate
The Blooming Rose
The Blooming Rose
The Blooming Rose
There are men who struggle against destiny, and yet achieve only an early grave.
There are men who flee destiny, only to have it swallow them whole.
And there are men who embrace destiny. They look it in the eye and do not show their fear.
When their moment comes, they seize it.
These are the ones that change the world forever.
Can you feel it approach?
Change comes to the world, upon powerful steeds.
War and Death are their names.
I have watched it race across fields of black.
I have felt its breath upon my neck.
You cannot evade it. You cannot deceive it.
You must rise up.
Claim your destiny... or be claimed by it.
Bone Pit Mines
Wounded Coast Approach
Runaways' Cavern
The Hanged Man
The Hanged Man
The Hanged Man
The Hanged Man
The Hanged Man
The Hanged Man
Woodrow's Warehouse
So long as you know I stand with Bethany, templar.
Keep him away from my sister.
My duty is clear, but that... is for another day. If we are granted that opportunity.
Secret Meeting Place
Well, the Maker has a sense of humor. Darkspawn, and now a templar. I thought they all abandoned Lothering.
Dark Foundry
Lost-End Foundry
Dark Foundry
Gallows Courtyard
Gallows Courtyard
Gallows Courtyard
Gallows Courtyard
Gallows Courtyard
Templar Hall
Templar Hall
Gallows Prison

The Deep Roads
The nice templar has been convinced to postpone his hunt for illegal mages. So let's not dwell upon it, shall we.
Primeval Ruins
Ancient Crypt
The Deep Roads
The Deep Roads
Pride's End
Vimmark Mountain Pass
Outside Kirkwall
Holding Caves
Outside Kirkwall
Then... we're trapped! The Wilds are to the south! That's no way out!
There they are!
You soulless bastards!
Maker, give me strength!
Carver, wake up! The battle's over! We're fine!
Bethany, wake up! The battle's over! We're fine!
I'm sorry, Mistress. Your daughter is gone.
No! These things will not take Bethany!
Bethany risked her life to save us.
She died bravely.
I don't want a hero! I want my daughter!
If you fall apart now, you endanger us all.
Pull yourself together!
Don't lecture me! This is your fault!
Maybe we should grieve when we're safe?
This is no time to mourn.
Don't speak to me of grief! This is your fault!
How could you let her charge off like that? Oh, my poor little girl. My sweetheart.
Abandoned Slaver Den
Sanctuary
Ser Varnell's Refuge
Arlan's Hideaway
The Killer's Lair
I'm not running straight into the horde. We go south.
We have no choice. The darkspawn have us fenced in. We go south.
If the options are south or die, I'll take my chances with south.
I'll open the gate. Let's move!
Holy Maker, there's more of them! Let's move!
If we stand here weeping, the darkspawn will take the rest of us, too.
Ashes we were, and ashes we become. Maker, give this young woman a place at your side. Let us take comfort in the peace she has found in eternity.
Our lives are more valuable to her than our prayers. Let's go.
That's the best we can give.
I will never forget you, Bethany.
Leave her. The darkspawn are gaining by the minute.
We've wasted enough time.
Flames! We're too late.
The witch kept her word and got them to Gwaren, where they took ship.
Two weeks they spent in that dark hold, packed in with the fearful and the desperate.
And then they saw it: Kirkwall, the City of Chains.
Long ago, it was part of the Imperium, slaves coming from far and wide to work the quarries.
Now it's a free city. But I use the word loosely.
Sail through those black cliffs and you'll see what the slaves of old saw: the Gallows, welcoming you.
Ha! We have enough poor of our own in the Free Marches. We don't need you refugees piling up here like a middens heap!
I heard someone call this fortress the Gallows. Is it a prison?
What is this place?
Why aren't we being allowed into the city?
What will happen to us?
Used to be, back in the Imperial days. They kept slaves here until the rebellion.
Now the templars run it and use it to lock up their mages. Guess not much has changed.
Are mages imprisoned here?
They lock up the mages?
Well, no more so than anywhere else. It's a Circle of Magi now.
Magic is to serve man, not rule him, and mages are better locked up where they don't hurt anyone.
If it were up to me, I'd bar the gates and let you find somewhere else to beg.
So Knight-Commander Meredith wants us to sort you all out. Most of you are getting right back on your ships, though.
That's a templar title. Why would a city guardsman answer to the templars?
Knight-Commander Meredith?
We don't answer to her... but she's the power in Kirkwall.
Don't know what would happen if the viscount went against something she wanted...
But he's sure never taken that chance.

I always wanted to try this!
I've got a cantrip with your name on it!
I can finish this!
I need help with this one!
Someone give me a hand here!
Over here!
Help me with this!
Stay together! Don't get separated!
Everyone regroup!
Head over there!
Maybe something else...
Ooh. That didn't work like I thought.
I hope we have more of these.
I'm stuck!
What the— I can't move!
Well, this is just peachy...
I can't keep casting forever, you know!
What, do you think I'm made of mana?
Sighs That's all I got.
Help! Somebody? Anybody?
I can't take much more...
Oh, this doesn't look good...
Ugh, this potion smells like fish!
Ooh! I feel better now!
I got one!
Ha! That'll teach you!
There's probably a lesson here about the dangers of magic.
This isn't working!
I think we need to try something else!
I can't hit that.
I work magic, not miracles.
There's more of them!
I think they called for help.
Maker's breath! More!
Watch out!
Here we go!
They're trying to kill us!
Ugh. Thanks. Things looked bad there.
My whole life flashed before my eyes... I need to get out more.
Let's not do that again.
That'll leave a mark.
That's too far away.
What kind of man is this Meeran?
Tell me about this mercenary.
He's a hired sword. What do you expect him to be like?
I wouldn't bring him home for dinner or anything, but he's got a decent reputation. I wouldn't have asked him if I thought he'd cross you.
How dangerous is this smuggler's work?
Tell me about this smuggler.
Well, it won't be pretty working for her. She's a pretty small fish compared to some of the other thieves' guilds around here.
But she's tough, she's fair and she never deals in slaves or flesh.
What do you think about this, Bethany?
Bethany?
We've come this far. I don't care who we work for, as long as it means we don't have to go back.
Let's find them and see what they have to say.
I'll go talk to them.
I owe you one.
You are officially my favorite person.
If it didn't hurt to breathe right now, I'd hug you.
Aveline's down!
Anders! Help is on its way!
Merrill!
Someone help Varric!
My brother! Oh, you're going to regret that.
They got Fenris!
Isabela's hurt!
Nobody picks on my friends and gets away with it!
You'll be sorry you did that!
That's where their ship landed with all the rest.
Thus began the Champion's first year in Kirkwall.
Word arrived from across the sea that the Hero of Ferelden had defeated the Blight.
But Lothering was destroyed. Kirkwall was the Champion's home now.
It was a busy year in the city. That's when the Qunari landed.
A great storm caught their ship and left hundreds of warriors stranded in the city, waiting to return home.
That’s also when the trouble began with the mages.
The templars had become very powerful under Knight-Commander Meredith.
But most importantly, that's when I first met the Champion.
Are you afraid to fight a little girl?
Show me what you've got!
Bet you can't hit me!
I've got you covered!
Don't worry, I'll help!
Nothing to worry about...
You want in, talk to Captain Ewald. I'm just here to keep you refuse from climbing the walls.
We're not animals you can just corral!
We've no intention of keeping anyone here, serah. You're all going back where you came from.
My men and I fought against the Blight. We're heroes!
Deserters, you mean. It doesn't matter. Kirkwall has no more room for anyone.
What do you want? Money? I can pay you.
All the gold in Thedas won't make the city any larger.
Don't give us that shit! Where are we supposed to go?
I don't know, serah, but there's nothing for you here.
Outside Lothering
Aveline
Flemeth
No admittance. Orders of the viscount.
You're wasting your time; there's nothing here for you.
Just take your things and get back on the ship.
Guardsman Wright
Captain Ewald
Gamlen
City Guardsman
Merchant Cavril
Mother
Refugee
Refugee
Varric
Wesley
Cassandra
What if Uncle Gamlen's not waiting for us? What if he didn't get Mother's letter? Oh Maker... this isn't helping...
How will we find anyone in this place?
Be ready for anything. I'm sure there's more trouble to come.
Don't look back! Just keep going!
Leandra! Damn, girl, the years haven't been kind to you.
Let me say up front, I wasn't expecting this. The Blight, your husband dead... I'd, ah, figured you'd pretty much be Fereldan for life.
Oh, Gamlen. We came too late. My poor Carver didn't make it, Andraste guide him.
Oh, Gamlen, we came too late. My darling Bethany didn't make it, Andraste guide her.
Oh, Maker save me. Leandra, don't drop this on me here. I don't even know if I can help you get in.
There are other ways to get into a city.
Then I'll get us in.
I'm more concerned about Mother. Can you get her in, at least?
What about Mother?
Would it help if I said you were my favorite uncle?
What if I ask nicely?
No. We stay together!
It'd make me feel better, but that's about it.
I was hoping to grease some palms, but the knight-commander's been cracking down. We're gonna need more grease.
Not quite. I know some people who might help... if you're not too delicate about the company you keep.
Do we need to stay in Kirkwall? Let's go to another city.
Why don't we just leave?
What do you mean exactly, Gamlen?
Sounds suspicious.
We don't have any choice, do we? I need to get my family into Kirkwall.
We can't stay here.
Let's hear it, Uncle. What do you have in mind?
Sounds like fun.
CUTSCENE: Lots of darkspawn arrive. A high dragon appears, burning the darkspawn and landing. The dragon changes into Flemeth.
CUTSCENE: Telling about the battle of Ostagar and how the player ended up being just outside Lothering with his family, trying to escape.
CUTSCENE: Tells how the player traveled the sea to Kirkwall, ending up in the Gallows with many refugees.

CUTSCENE: Prologue ends. Act 1 intro: summary of the player's first year in Kirkwall - mentions the Qunari arriving and some tension between mages and templars. The players works for either mercenaries or criminals.
Don't worry, I'll keep an eye out for trouble.
Get your breath while you can.
Take point. I'll be rear guard.
Keep sharp!
I'll keep watch if you need to stop for a moment.
Stay close.
So much destruction...
Stop squirming, Wesley. You'll make it worse.
We need to find your uncle. With any luck, he's received my letter.
I'm not sure we can survive much more of this.
I never intended to stay so long, but this has become home.
Maker save us, we've lost it all. Everything your father and I built...
The Destruction of Lothering
Blessed Andraste, guide our fallen to the Maker's side.
Such destruction. Maker forgive us. This should have been prevented.
I can't believe the darkspawn have reached this far so quickly.
Look out!
Maker, watch over them. Keep them safe.
Keep your distance! Their blood is poison!
Can we keep going? I don't want to be a standing target.
Bethany
Carver
Find a way past the darkspawn horde.
What would you like to do?
Jump to Flemeth's fake rescue
Jump to Flemeth's fake rescue
Exit
Exit
CUTSCENE: Lothering is shown burning, far away.
That was the worst nap I have ever had.
Clearly, I need to work on dodging.
Can we not do that again?
That was harder than I thought.
I don't think I can help you with that.
Don't look at me! I can't do that.
I think we're out of luck.
Ouch! Can we stop for a minute?
I know we're in a hurry... but I don't feel so good.
Anybody have some bandages? I better take care of this.
I think it's over.
Whew! We made it!
You know, that was almost fun.
Let's do this again some time.
Jump to real blightlands
Jump to real blightlands
That's enough out of you!
I'll make this quick!
You'll have to be faster than that!
Someone want to give me a hand with this?
Anyone feel like jumping in on this?
First person to help me out here is my new best friend!
All right, I might be out of my league here...
Fall in over here!
Nobody wander off!
Get into position!
Sorry about this, sweetheart.
I hope this works...
Does this stuff have side effects?
Just give me a second, here.
Oh, for the love of— These are my new boots!
I'm... huh, I'm stuck.
Sodding... I can't move!
Can we wrap this up... sooner rather than later?
I think my arm is going to fall off.
Much more of this, and all I'll be able to do is bullshit them!
This isn't going so well...
I'm not going to make it...
I... think I need a rescue here.
That was a beauty of a shot!
Better luck in the next life!
Bianca, you minx! That was beautiful!
Nothing I'm doing seems to work!
Bianca's not doing much here.
I'm good, but I'm not that good.
You don't want me to aim for something... I don't know, less impossible?
That's a bit far, don't you think?
Oh, look, they brought their friends!
We've got more on the way!
More of them! Great, I was starting to get lonely.
Why is it nobody ever seems happy to see us?
Bianca's locked and loaded!
Grab something sharp and pointy! We've got company!
Remind me to buy you a drink later.
Thanks! That was a little too close for my taste.
I owe you one.
I'm fine... Where's Bianca?
I knew I wasn't dead! There would've been more women around...
I'll try to repay you by not doing that again. Deal?
Thanks. I 'm not ready to go just yet.
Holy mother of green cheeses! How'd they take that woman down?
They got Whatshisname, the mage? Damnation!
Blast it! Daisy got herself knocked out!
The tame elf is down!
Don't die on me, Rivaini! You still owe me a pint!
We're losing people!
We need a healer out here, fast!
You blighted, ball-less, whelp; you want a piece of me?
Come here and give Bianca a kiss!
Dance with me, precious. I'll show you a thing or two.
Nothing to worry about.
Never fear, Varric is here.
I'm practically there.
Think I need to stop for a second.
Blast! I got hit worse than I thought.
I can't keep going like this.
Maker's breath, Hawke! You do get results, don't you?
Remind me never to get on our bad side. Seems to be... unhealthy.
There's a lesson to be learned here: Messing with us is suicidal.
Ugh, I think I got blood on my coat.
Let's not do that again. I'm not ready to meet my ancestors.
Thank the Maker! I'm too good-looking to die this young.
Bianca? You okay? Oh, I'm sorry baby.
Dear Varric, please learn to parry. Love, your innards. Ouch.
That's not really my thing.
You want me to do what? I don't think so.
Not likely.
The horde approaches. So we face them here.
Aaah, and here we are!
A witch!
It's all right, Fenris. She means us no harm.
Calm yourself. We know this one.
Friend of yours?
You speak the word as if it is cheap coin, meant for spending.
You don't know me.
Oh, I know your type.
Andaran atish'an, Asha'bellanar.
One of the people, I see, so young and bright. Do you know who I am, beyond that title?
I know only a little.
Then stand. The people bend their knee too quickly.
So refreshing to see someone who keeps their end of a bargain. I half-expected my amulet to end up in a merchant's pocket!
You were inside that amulet the entire time?
I carried you here?
I agreed to deliver the amulet, though you could have told me you were inside it.
We made a deal.
No one wanted to buy it. Maybe because it had a witch inside?
I couldn't sell it.
Just a piece. A small piece, but it was all I needed.
A bit of security, should the inevitable occur. And if I know my Morrigan, it already has.
Is that someone I should know?
Who is Morrigan?
She's a girl who thinks she knows what is what better than I, or anyone.
And why not? I raised her to be as she is! I cannot expect her to be less!
I'm not sure whether she's your daughter or your enemy.
Neither is she.
I don't understand. Are you some kind of vision?
Are you real?
Laughs
Must I be in only one place? Bodies are such limiting things.
I am but a fragment cast adrift from the whole. A bit of flotsam to cling to in the storm!
A fragment?
What do you mean?
You do not need to understand, child.
Know only that you may have saved my life, just as I once saved yours. An even trade, I think.
Why did you need me to bring you here?
Why not come yourself?
Because I had an appointment to keep!
And because I did not want to be followed. You smuggled me here quite nicely.
You should have told me what I would face.
I don't like being tricked.
Did I trick you? I asked you to bring the amulet, and you did.
If I thought it such an easy task, I might have asked anyone. But you have succeeded where others would not.
You have plans, I take it?
So what now?
Destiny awaits us both, dear girl. We have much to do.
Destiny awaits us both, dear boy. We have much to do.
But before I go, a word of advice?
We stand upon the precipice of change. The world fears the inevitable plummet into the abyss.
Watch for that moment... and when it comes, do not hesitate to leap.
It is only when you fall that you learn whether you can fly.
Stop speaking in riddles!
That was meaningless.
You're welcome.
What should I do?
What do you mean?
Do as I do. Become a dragon!
You could never be a dragon.
Cheap advice from a dragon.
Must be nice to have wings.
We all have our challenges.
Are we going to regret bringing her here?
We're going to regret bringing her here.
Regret is something I know well.
Take care not to cling to it, to hold it so close that it poisons your soul.
When the time comes for your regrets, remember me.
As for you, child, step carefully. No path is darker than when your eyes are shut.
Ma serannas, Asha'bellanar.
Now the time has come for me to leave. You have my thanks... and my sympathy.
What do you think, Fenris?
You are no simple witch.
Figured that out yourself, did you?
I have seen powerful mages, spirits, and abominations. But you are none of those things. What are you?
Such a curious lad. The chains are broken, but are you truly free?
You see a great deal.
I am a fly in the ointment. I am a whisper in the shadows. I am also an old, old woman. More than that you need not know.
What do you think, Anders?
What are you? A spirit? An abomination? This is no magic I've ever seen!
And you would know of spirits and abominations.
I'm a mage. Of course I know of such things.
Of course!
But we have nowhere else to go!
Go back to Ferelden. Kirkwall isn't going to take you.
We didn't come this far just to be turned back! Let us in!
But we can't afford passage back to Ferelden!
You should've thought of that before you came here.
Find Gamlen Amell or some other way into Kirkwall.
Speak to Captain Ewald in the Gallows Courtyard.

Hold on, Sunshine, I'm coming!
Hang on, Junior, help's on the way!
Athenril has agreed to provide a way into Kirkwall.
Meeran has agreed to provide a way into Kirkwall.
Jump to Gallows, Lowtown.

The village burned, and many innocents were slaughtered.
Who are you? Please, can you get me out of here? I just want to go home.
Tell me where he is.
Where is this Kelder?
He let me go and I tried to get out, but then those... things, they started coming out of the walls.
How did you escape your dastardly kidnapper? Kick to the groin? Sand in the eyes? Rock to the head?
You escaped?
I don't see any injuries, are you all right?
Are you hurt?
He hit me, told me I was nothing. I begged him to stop hurting me.
Darkspawn poured out of the Wilds, clashing against the army at the ruins of Ostagar.
King Cailan died on the field with his men, betrayed by his most trusted general.
Letters for the Player
She is a child, and does not understand. Her pity is admirable, but misplaced.
Don't you see? He didn't mean to hurt me! He told me! There are demons, they make him to do these horrible things!
Someone's left a surprise here for us.
Watch where you step!
Now, that's just rude. What are they trying to do, ruin my boots?
Everyone stay still and try not to make any loud noises...
Piece of cake.
We're good to go.
I love doing that.
Easy as pie.
Want me to take a look at that?
Don't suppose I could give that a shot?
You know, I might be able to give you a hand with that.
Mind if I try my hand at that?
Wait! That looks... sketchy.
Uh oh... this could be trouble.
I don't like the looks of this.
Be really careful where you step.
That wasn't so hard.
I could've done that blindfolded.
All done!
Was that what you had in mind?
Maybe I can help.
Leave that to me.
Mind if I give that a try?
This looks more like my specialty.
I thought I heard him calling for me. I almost went back to him. I didn't want to be eaten! But Kelder... he was...
You saved her! My little girl, I didn't dare hope...
Did you find that monster? Is he dead?
We could bring him back as the undead and then kill him again.
He can't get much deader.
I didn't believe an elf could ever get justice in Kirkwall. I speak for all of us when I say that we are in your debt, serah.
This is all I have, but nothing compared to what you've given me. Come, Lia, we best bring your mother this joyous news.
I feel just as bad for those knife-ears as the next man, but ignoring the magistrate's direct orders? That's madness.
So you've found me. Going to finish Martin off properly this time, are you?
Hey! Who are you?
My, you're jumpy! Look at you, cowering in a corner. What happened to the fearless, dashing raider I used to know?
I'm not a raider anymore, Isabela. I'm just an honest merchant now.
I'll take care of it.
I'll help.
Find another hireling.
I'm not getting involved.
Fair enough. You know where to find me if you reconsider.
It's your cargo—you look for it.
Can't you do this yourself?
Are the raiders a big problem around here?
You mentioned raiders.
He won't harm Lia, or anyone else, ever again.
You don't need to worry.
No, that's all right. I'd rather he stay dead.
I did your dirty work. Now I want some coin for it.
Do I get a reward?
Got your payment right here. Just waiting on the good news.
Changed your mind about helping me?
There are always raiders on the seas, just like there are always bandits on the roads.
But they've been much more active of late. Like vultures, taking advantage of the Blight.
You'll need to look around the docks. The crates bear the seal of the Orlesian port authority, so you'll know it when you see it.
Please, Martin. You wouldn't know honest if I tied you up and spanked you with it.
You tie him up, I'll go find some honesty.
Sounds like a plan.
He may have stopped being a raider, but he's still a low-life sea rat.
You've got it wrong, Martin. Isabela sent me.
Isabela said you needed help.
You used to be a raider. What happened?
Why leave the raiders?
Those raiders are still looking for me. I'm not going to draw their attention.
They've got some big plan for Kirkwall, or so I've heard. If they're not a problem now, they will be soon.
I'll find your cargo, Martin. You have my word.
You can count on me.
You're assuming I know what an Orlesian port authority seal looks like.
Will I?
Just make sure you have my reward.
As long as I get paid.
Yes, I was a raider. Back then it was just smuggling and petty thievery.
The coin will be here.
Isabela's told me all about you, Martin.
Drop the act.
So he's not an honest merchant?
Not so honest, then?
Javaris
Sighs Isabela. I thought I told you to be discreet.
You're smuggling poison. I thought you were trying to change your ways.
Still not interested.
No.

Go to the Wounded Coast to kill the Tal-Vashoth bandits camped there.

So she made her name, settling her debts with the mercenaries.

So she remained, paying off her debt. Made a name for herself in the underworld.
No!
Hubert
The Tal-Vashoth are attacking travelers on the Wounded Coast.
Tell Javaris that the Tal-Vashoth are dead. Go to the Qunari Compound by the Docks at day.
The Arishok was impressed by the deaths of the Tal-Vashoth, but Javaris got nothing.
Bad luck—and judgment—brought us together here before the attack.
Apostate, keep your distance.
The 'spawn are clear in their intent, but a mage is always unknown. The Order dictates...
You going to buy me a drink to celebrate our victory?
I don't know if that's wise.
You drink the swill here?
Buy yourself a drink.
Well, if you're going to be that way...
Oh! Before I forget: You still looking for work? Because I have a friend who needs some help.
It sounds like your son is in trouble. Is there anything I can do?
Can I help?
Magic can be a fearful gift. Your son deserves the best aid learning how to manage it.
He ought to have his own life, out from the shackles of the Circle. Everyone should.
We'll find him before the templars. Don't trust them to have your son's best interests at heart.
The boy sounds one breath away from becoming an abomination. Let's get to him, fast.
My husband, Wesley, was a templar. They're not all fanatics to be feared.
Don't coddle this boy. If he is a mage, he's dangerous and belongs in the Circle.
Thank you. It has been a lonely time, hiding. It's almost a relief to finally confront this openly.
Wesley.
The Order dictates...
Dear, they saved us. The Maker understands.
Of course.
We will be fine. We all will.
It's an acquired taste.
Is this a friend, or a friend?
A friend?
I never let him steer my ship, if that's what you're asking. From what I hear, he doesn't have good control of his rudder.
His name's Martin. He has a room right here in the Hanged Man. Tell him I sent you.
And listen... he's in trouble with some raiders. Used to be one, and they didn't like that he tried to leave.
Whatever he's asking, it's probably going to be dangerous. Watch your back.
A friend of yours is a friend of mine. What can I do?
Always willing to help.
He didn't say, and I didn't ask, but I'm sure you're up to it.
Does it pay? I've no time for favors.
I'm not a charity.
He might pay, he might not—I didn't ask. If you're not interested, don't talk to him.
Just some friendly advice from Isabela to you, yes?
Now, you going to leave me to my drinking or what?
Wise girl.
Thank you, Wesley.
Then you will have mine. As always.
I'm looking for some cargo.
You're in luck! Cargo all around. Take your pick.
They don't pay you to be funny.
Shut up.
I could use your assistance.
Can you help me?
A laborer with a smart mouth! You hardly ever see those.
How unique!
What do you want?
I'm looking for crates sealed by the Orlesian port authority.
Haven't seen any. Sorry.
Talk to the harbor master.
I'll bet he's got information about your cargo. He's in his office.
Hey! If you're done wagging your tongue, can we get those sacks off the docks?
Right. Coming.
Shipping manifest?
I'm looking for cargo bearing the seal of the Orlesian port authority.
I have an inquiry.
Speak sense, man!
What?
Isabela
I wish you luck finding the lad.
Templars handle our own business.
I did not realize his name was known so widely.
Don't lie to me. I can see you're holding something back.
Tell me right now.
I just said as much. And I hardly think someone like you is best suited to such a delicate task.
Aveline, don't you think this matter concerns the whole city?
The city guard might help.
It does. And you templars are spread thin to begin with.
True. Sadly, there are more mages fleeing than we can easily keep up with.
Do you know anything about an Antivan merchant named Vincento?
Do you know Vincento?
Vincento? That's curious—we just received a missive from the hermandades in Antiva. A thief named Vincento fled their lands and is believed to be in Kirkwall.
I will not forget the kindness you've shown me.
You have your money! What more do you want?
Well, at least you don't have to worry about the templars finding out anymore.
I'll keep your secret.
It'd be unfortunate if the templars learned that you lied about her. A few gold might prevent that.
Pay me, or I'll expose you.
Arishok
What? But he is human. They did not even wish me to raise him among them.
He may never forgive me for sending him there, but I'd rather him alive and furious than dead and buried.
As I said, I have little money, but this is a Dalish ring that has been in my family for generations. Please accept it with my thanks.
Every moment Feynriel is gone, I worry what has become of him.
Then let's not waste any more time.
Ugh. Aden, deal with this!
I think I lost it.
Not today.
Well, then you can't bring your goods in.
The shipping manifest—for your ship. Have to know what cargo's coming through Kirkwall.
Viscount's rules, not mine.
I need information, and you're going to give it to me.
Rules don't concern me.
Heh. Ol' Vincento said someone might come sniffing around.
I'm looking for a retired templar named Samson.
Are you Samson?
Huh. Retired. Sounds better than burned-out husk of a templar begging coins in the chokedamp.
Did you meet the boy?
Did Feynriel come to you?
Afraid so. Blighter was dead broke, though, not a silver on him. I help one mageling for free and I'll never get paid again.
You don't cooperate, and the templars will know you're helping rogue mages.
Tell me what you know.
Rogue... is that what you should be called, just for wanting to live like a person, not a beast?
I pointed him to a ship captain I know. Reiner. Sometimes he'll take on runaways. Took another apostate last week—girl I sent him.
Might have gone wrong, though. I heard rumors he took the both of them captive instead.
Reiner's not the patient type. I'd hurry if you want to reach that lad before the templars.
Get a hold of her!
No need to get tetchy. Talk to Aden. He'll answer your questions.

Olivia's Letter to Thrask

Father,
I know the sacrifices you've made to conceal my secret, but I am a child no longer. I cannot burden you my whole life, lest my secret destroy us both. I must live my own life as a woman... and as a mage. It is oddly freeing to write the word.
Farewell, Father. I hope one day you make peace between what you have been taught and what you have seen.
All my love, Olivia
What do you want?
Great! Just wonderful.
You're under arrest, Vincento. Come with us.
Son? I have never had that privilege, serah. My poor wife, she is back in Antiva, and cannot see me often with my travels.
You've got an elf-blood bastard running around and I know you know where to find him.
Don't lie to me.
H-Hold off, all right? Yesterday was the first I met the boy.
Perhaps you can set his mind at ease...
Bethany?
We're not templars, serah. Feynriel has nothing to fear from us.
I know you're scared for him.
Maldición! You're a mage! I suppose you'd be kind, then, to a boy who resists being taken in by templars?
The boy's in over his head, so I sent him to the only man I know who doesn't despise mages. A former templar named Samson.
You're a wanted man, Vincento.
I've got bad news.
Blighters! Who? Did they follow me from Antiva? Perhaps Rivain will be beyond their reach...
You abandoned your son at birth. If you regret this at all, help me save him now.
Make up for your neglect.
There's no man in Kirkwall who is friend to an elf-blood mageling. A smile won't buy my trust.
Perhaps he does need more help than I could give him.
The Bone Pit
Why, look here, boys. Volunteers! Clap 'em in irons, and let's see what the Tevinters will pay for them.
Andraste's great flaming ass! How did you do that?
Make him talk.
Fenris...
I can do that.
The boy you bought from Captain Reiner. Where is he?
Give me Feynriel!
Answer my questions, and I won't trouble you about this little operation.
I just want to talk.
You die now, there won't be any trouble at all.

This is the sort of venture that can make a man for life! I'm not about to take any chances hiring random humans.

I don't need to step.

If there is another place he can harness his gifts, I cannot blame him for wishing to go there.
Keeper trains him, keeps him safe from demons, no one gets locked up. Sounds like a winning plan.

Because no Dalish mage ever went astray.
His own mother says he's plagued by demons. Do you really want him loose?
You deserve a chance at freedom.
Do what you think is best.

Go to the Circle.
I apologize on Liam's behalf. He is a very, very busy man.
I'm Aden, the harbor master's assistant. I understand you're looking for Orlesian cargo.
I've seen the crates, but can't remember where. Such a shame.
Get to the point.
What do you want?
You're wasting my time!
No sense in talking to you.
Now, don't be pessimistic.
The clink of gold coin often jogs my memory.
Is this enough to help you remember?
This might help.
Ah! It's coming back to me. The cargo is in Alton Woodrow's warehouse, by the dock.
I'm glad we could help each other out.
I'm not paying for this.
This is ridiculous.
Then I am deeply sorry I could not be of more assistance. Good day.
They say your life flashes in front of your eyes before you die.
Fear will help you remember.
Any helpful flashes yet?
Ah! Er, I think the cargo is in Alton Woodrow's warehouse, not too far from here.
Maker's breath!
This expedition can open doors for us in this city. We have to go with you.
We want this job.
We've fought and killed darkspawn. How many of your hired men can say the same?
We have experience.
I'll buy you a drink before we head into the Deep Roads. Everyone wins!
Get to know us, Bartrand.
There's a memory in this head waiting to be unlocked.
This is private property.
What are you guarding?
What's in there?
There's someone coming. Tell the others.
Let's see what's behind that door.
Can I go in?
Who owns this warehouse?
Whose private property?

Fire!
Imported goods.
Master Woodrow, I suppose. It's rented storage space.
No visitors allowed.
I must have taken a wrong turn.
I should go.
What?
Don't you hear the screaming? Are you deaf?
I don't hear anything...
Shit. A fire could destroy the loot. We have to check!
But...
Come on!
Be off with you then.
You're in my way.
Time to die.
We're under attack!
I said, this is private property.

You won't be able to protect your son from the templars alone.
You're in over your head.
Please, Ser Thrask! He won't go to the Circle willingly, but it's the only place...
Madam, we'll do our best to find your son, but I cannot guarantee his safety if he continues to resist templar jurisdiction.
He's just a boy!
He's an apostate.
You... you heard all of that and still you would help? An apostate? Oh, thank you...
I have done all I can to protect him.
I am Arianni. My boy, Feynriel... he's all I have, all my family. When I learned he had magic, I could not bear to send him to the Circle.
But his connection to the Fade... it gives him nightmares, dreams of demons, speaking in his mind. I would rather lose him to the Circle than to himself.
What kind of dreams is he having?
Tell me about the nightmares.
Did your son run away?
Where is Feynriel now?
I promise, you will see your son again.
I will bring Feynriel back.
What exactly do you need me to do?
Where do I start?
Abominations are always so awkward at family reunions.
That is a problem...
That is why I turned to the Circle. They are the only ones that can protect a mage from his own powers.
He learned I had contacted Ser Thrask. He felt I... betrayed his trust.
He thinks he can live free of the Circle, but I am afraid without proper training, he'll kill himself.
Tell me the whole story.
What exactly happened?
Those look like Dalish tattoos. Why do you live in the city?
Are you Dalish?
I learned years ago that my son likely had magical talent. But we could not bear the thought of him locked in the Gallows... so we hid.
When the nightmares began, Feynriel still refused to contact the Circle.
But I... I truly think they are the only people who might save his life.
I was born to the Dalish, but came to Kirkwall for a time and... dallied with a human merchant. Vincento.
When I found I was with child, neither Vincento nor my tribe wished the burden of an elf-blooded human infant.
I raised Feynriel myself, here in the alienage.
You're looking for a quick way out of the slums, right? You and every other Fereldan in this dump.
Find another meal ticket.
Then you have given me the greatest blessing of Maker or man.
Just find him, please. Bring him somewhere safe.
No! Please, you must find him before... before the demons finish their work. He must be brought to safety.
I don't know where Feynriel has gone, but there are two places you might start your search.
Ser Thrask has been looking for him. If you speak to him in the Gallows, he'll be able to tell you what ground he's already covered.
And Feynriel's father, Vincento, recently returned from Antiva. He's a merchant in the Lowtown Bazaar. Feynriel might have sought him out.
Tell me about this templar.
What is Thrask like?
I believe he's a good man. He doesn't hate mages, but sees what it took me too long to realize—even the best-intentioned mages are at the mercy of their sleeping minds.
There are other templars who are much less sympathetic.
You and Feynriel's father are not married?
Tell me about Vincento.
Vincento had no desire for a wife or an elf-blooded child. I haven't seen him since the day I told him.
I have written, though, to keep him informed about his child. Feynriel wanted to meet him.
I will not leave you fearful for a moment longer than necessary.
I'll go right now.
I'll ask around, but no guarantees.
Don't hold your breath.
Perhaps you know Arianni from when she was with the Dalish?
We don't all know each other. There are a lot of clans, you know.
Perhaps your friend knew him in the alienage?
Not every elf lives in one of your cages, templar.
Are you a friend of his?
Have you met him? What is he like?
Tell me about Feynriel.
From his mother's description, he sounds much like any youngster we bring to the Circle—frightened of his gift, resentful at losing his freedom, convinced he is the one exception to our laws.
Hardly someone you would wish the power to murder people with his mind.
I have passed their request for aid to Captain Jeven of the city guard.
No young boy should have to face down demons alone.
I want to help Feynriel.
An untrained mage cannot be set loose on innocent people.
Feynriel is a menace.
It is surprising what sympathies mages evoke. I always expect people to be more wary of their powers than touched by their struggles.
They always think of us as the enemy, but it is the mages themselves who are protected most by the Circle and its rituals.
Sighs If we do not find Feynriel soon, it will not matter. Either he will be taken by the demons or by less mystical predators.
And I have said more than enough on the topic. This is a templar matter and we will be handling it.

There is a templar—former templar—by the name of Samson. He left the Order due to... philosophical differences. He has been known to help mages flee Kirkwall.
If Feynriel went to him, Samson wouldn't tell me. He stays out of sight by day, but I have seen him at night, near the entrance to Darktown.
Thrask's Journal

In Search of Feynriel
Day 1: Visited the Dalish. Hoped to find boy with mother's kin. No luck.
Day 3: Checked healers' homes and the guardsmen's prisons. Nothing.
Day 4: Spoke to Samson. He seemed to be hiding something. I think he may know more of the boy than he admitted. I am stationing two templars at the entrance to the Undercity to watch him to see if the boy shows up.
Day 5: Beginning interviews with alienage elves.
Speak to the Arishok in the Qunari Compound by the Docks.
Go to the Coterie in Darktown to find where Javaris has gone.
Javaris has fled the city. Follow him using the tunnels that lead from Darktown to Smuggler's Cut.

Hrmph. Hardly a difference.
You belong in the Circle of Magi.
She's right.
I can't believe her! My whole life, it was all, I'll love you and protect you. Then I have some bad dreams and it's, off to the templars!
Well, I'm not going. I was trying to get to the Dalish. They won't be afraid of my magic.
I'm here to help you, Feynriel.
Maybe there's another way.
Why? You don't even know me.
I am you.
I'm a mage.
I've spent my whole life protecting my sister from exactly what you fear.
My sister's a mage.
Locking mages up over an accident of birth is unjust.
It's not about you.
Well, my birth was certainly an accident.
If I weren't half human, we'd be living with the Dalish. I'd be trained by a Keeper, not hustled into the Gallows like a bad secret.
That's where I was trying to go. See if they would take me in. I'm as much Dalish as human.
You should take credit for those rules.
Good rules!
I guess you are.
You know, you're the first mage I've met. Most are locked up like lepers.
Would... is there any chance you'd help me reach the Dalish?
Was your mother right? Are you plagued by demons already?
What about your nightmares?
I can't say for sure. I have... dreams.
There are voices in the dreams. They ask me to come, to give shape to the Void around them.
But the Dalish Keeper is wise. If anyone can help, she can.
Eh, at least if you go nuts out with the elves, you won't be killing any of us.
Do what you think is best.
Enough discussion. You want the elves, then go fast, before the templars find you.
Do what you think is best.
Th-thank you! I did not... in my wildest dreams, I could not have foreseen this.
Thank the Creators you were the one my mother hired to find me. I will forever be in your debt, friend.
Sorry, friend, but it's time to get familiar with the Gallows.
Go to the Circle.
I was hired to bring you to the Circle, and that's where you're going.
Go to the Circle.
I saw what you did to those Tevinters.
I cannot hope to fight you.
Fine! Go get your blood money, tell my mother she won. But she'll be the only one I don't miss when they lock me away.
Has the Keeper been able to help with your magic?
How are the nightmares?
Sadly, his is not a problem we've encountered before. I'm studying our ancient writings, but it is a slow process.
His human blood makes it difficult to train him.
You know, when I lived in Kirkwall, I felt like everyone could tell by my face I was an elf.
Now I understand how easily I passed. It's harder here.
Getting sick of all the elves?
Are you sorry you came?
It's better than the Circle, but... we haven't made as much progress as I hoped.
I'm busy right now.
No time to talk.
Very well.
Still, we appreciate you bringing him here, friend. We would not see a son of our tribe suffer alone. Please accept this as our thanks.
If I don't get better soon, I shall be made Tranquil.

I'll keep your secret.

Pay me, or I'll expose you.
You monster!

Goodbye.

The Bone Pit's hazardous at best. And if the dragons return...

It should be fine.

I accept.

Have any war stories?

It seems risky. I would not like to be stuck in the Fade.

What can a dreamer do?
A dreamer?

I have no desire to explore the Fade, but if you need me I will go.

Let us begin.

The treasure we found in the Deep Roads made us a fortune.
The Champion moved up in the world. Literally. Bought a mansion in Hightown.
Everyone knew who he was now. Even the viscount was taking notice.
Everyone knew who she was now. Even the viscount was taking notice.
The Grey Wardens left Kirkwall. It was months before we learned Carver survived.
The Grey Wardens left Kirkwall. It was months before we learned Bethany survived.
Carver joined the templars, just as he said he would. He didn't turn in the Champion, at least.

I felt responsible for Bethany's death. She was a good girl, and met a bad end.
Three years later, the Qunari still hadn't left.
They were becoming a problem. But how does one ask a hundred angry giants to just leave?
The Qunari insisted they were waiting for their ship. But some of us knew better...
Champion of Kirkwall, that was the reward. A fine title.
Every noble at the Keep owed the Champion their lives.
He wasn't just a hero; he was now the most important person in the city.
She wasn't just a hero; she was now the most important person in the city.
Except for Knight-Commander Meredith, of course. With the viscount dead, she stepped in to keep order.
Things quickly got out of hand.
The more she squeezed the mages, the more they resisted. The more they resisted, the tighter she squeezed.
After three years of that, it all came crashing down.
Dreamers are unique for their ability to enter the Fade at will, without the aid of lyrium.
In the Fade, they can shape dreams and even affect the world beyond the Veil.
Tevinter somniari used to enter the minds of sleepers and slay them in their dreams.
Why are they so rare?
First to survive?
Dreamers have great power in the Fade. They attract demons.
Luckily, most prove too frail of mind to survive a demon's possession. A dreamer-abomination would be near unstoppable.
What exactly are we going to do here?
Tell me about the ritual.
Just send me into the Fade.
Let's start the ritual.
The elves of the Dales were experts in the somniari arts. They could even help those with no power enter the Fade.
I have done my best to recreate the ritual.
We will use Feynriel's childhood home as a focus to draw him back through the Veil.
I told you he was amazing!
I told you her courage was legendary!
We will live. If that is not reward enough, perhaps you will accept the tome where I found this ritual.
It should prove valuable to your own studies of magic.
It should bring a fair price from the mages of the Circle.
Now, Arianni, please excuse us. We must prepare.
Oh, of course.
There is more I must tell you that is not for her ears.
Dreamers have the power to control the Beyond, what humans call the Fade. Feynriel is the first in two ages to survive.

The Beyond?
They are the same. By either name, the Fade is the realm of spirits, Thedas's heart, while the mortal realm is its strong arm.
The demons who live there covet the bodies of mortals and seek to possess them.
Only mages ever touch the Fade in a waking state. Others see it in dreams.
Is Feynriel in danger?
About her son?
Indeed. And the danger may not come from what you think.
You're really not my type.
You just want me alone.
This is a serious matter.
I want to get this over with.
Make it quick.
Feynriel cannot become an abomination. The destruction he would cause is unimaginable.
If you cannot save him from the demons, you must kill him yourself.
A death in the Fade will make him what your Circle calls Tranquil. He will be no threat after.

This will not stand in my way.

I'm sure we'll be free and clear before we know it.
So what's a year?

Carver?

Tell me, how did your family escape Lothering? Almost everyone who hadn't fled...
My brother. If he wasn't with us, I don't think we'd be here.
My older sister. If she wasn't with us, I don't think we'd be here.
But you seem quite skilled as well.
I'm not my brother.
I'm not my sister.
Are you a demon?
What are you?
That is the term humans give us. We existed first, though, so that seems slightly unfair.
I trust you're here for the mage, Feynriel? Two of the most powerful demons in this realm are vying for control of him.
Sadly, I'm no warrior. I couldn't stand up to them. But if I did, I'd only want the boy's power to secure my position in the Fade.
Don't listen to him. Sloth demons prey on your trust!
I'd be no threat to your world.
So if I help you possess Feynriel, you won't attack Kirkwall?
What are you offering?
We are drawn to the mortal realm to merge with a living soul. Once I've done so, what need will I have for your people?
I merely want power against my own kind.
Bring me Feynriel, and I will grant anything you ask: power, magic, money, the strength of ten men!
This is a monster. It asks you to sacrifice an innocent to its ambition!
Ignore this tiresome little spirit. I ask only what it has already taken, a willing merger with a human host.
What sort of creatures are menacing Feynriel?
Tell me about the demons.
There is a demon of desire, called Caress. She ensnares him in dreams of bliss from which he will not emerge.
The other is a creature of pride, known as Wryme. It offers Feynriel the power to control his life and world.
What would it take to defeat these demons?
How can I save him?
They each weave an illusion for Feynriel. You must help him reject it.
But be cautious—shatter the dream too quickly, and his mind will break. He must reach the realization on his own.
Is there still time to save him?
How is Feynriel now?
He suffers under the demons' assault. Every time they strain his connection to the mortal world, his mind breaks a little further.
The pain of it shakes this entire realm.
Give me the reflexes of a wildcat, and I will take your deal.
I want agility.
Give me the strength to fight untiring and I will take your deal.
I want strength.
Give me the power to channel the Fade and I will take your deal.
I want magic.
Signed and sealed!
Be cautious. Demons don't always keep their promises.
You would deal with a demon.
And another falls prey to temptation.
Use those doors to enter the other parts of Feynriel's nightmare. You will take on the form of something he dreams.
Gently guide him out of temptation—if you disrupt him too quickly, his mind will snap.
Bring him to me, and power beyond dreams will be yours.
Don't fight me on this.
Back off, Anders!
Offered and Lost
Talk to Seneschal Bran in the Viscount's Keep for more information on the missing Qunari entourage.
My kind and this have been opposed since the beginning of time.
This is a creature of complacency! Of injustice! I cannot let you treat with it!
I will hear no more of this, demon!
Anders is right.
Ah, right. Fabulous powers, yours if you deliver me the dreamer. Are we agreed?
That's it, Feynriel. Hard on the downstroke, then lift. Good!
I'll have you scribing all my letters soon. If I'd known you were such a bright lad, I'd have brought you into the business years ago.
Does that mean I can come with you to Antiva, Father? Mother said maybe this summer... Right, Mother?
Go to the chantry to find out if the grand cleric was involved in the Qunari disappearance.
You decided to enlist Lilley's gang to protect the Bone Pit from the Coterie. Return to Hubert and give him the news.
Listened to Seldrek's deal, but didn't agree
Turned down the Coterie
Deal made with Seldrek
Sister Emeline
Mine Massacre
Go to Ser Varnell's daytime rally near Darktown to confirm Petrice's suspicions.
Go to the Bone Pit to assess the situation for Hubert.
See to the workers who are sheltered in the mines.
Don't listen, Son. She's always been ashamed of you.
She wanted you gone so she could go back to the Dalish. I'm the one who loves you.
But... why can't I remember you?
This is a trick, Feynriel. He wants something from you.
He doesn't love you.
It's not your father, Feynriel. You're trapped in the Fade by a demon.
It's a demon.
Thank you, Mother!
Oh, Father, won't it be wonderful? Will we be going by land or sea? I've always wanted to see the Hundred Pillars.
We'll see anything you like.
And you're sure your family won't mind that I'm half elf?
They'll love you as much as I do.
If he loves you so much, why didn't he come back for you before?
He doesn't love you.
Why...? That's right! I spent my whole childhood waiting for you.
Your mother never allowed—
My mother loves me! She showed me the letters she wrote you. You never wrote back.
And it was Mother who taught me to write, not you! I've never met you before! Who are you?
That's not your father, Feynriel. It's a demon. And I'm definitely not your mother.
Snap out of it!
A demon? No! No, I want this.
Then remember this is who took away the...
...only thing you ever wanted!
I know how long you've wanted a father.
I'm happy for you.
Yes. My whole life...
Where have you been my whole life? Why do I feel like I love you, but I know I've never met you before?
That's ridiculous. Your mother and I had our differences, but I always loved you.
No! You're making me think things... What are you?
Don't... question...
Aaah!
You! You turned him against me.
Bethany, I beg you! Don't go! Don't do this!
I'll be fine, Mother, I promise. This will work out for the best, you'll see.
Are you sure about this, big brother? I hope you're not just trying to protect me.
We'll be fine without you. Stay in Kirkwall.
I don't need you.
We can't both go into the Deep Roads. It's too dangerous.
Mother's right.
Trust me, this is no picnic. I'd stay if I could.
You don't want to go.
Fair enough. I hope you're right.
Carver, I beg you! Don't go! Don't do this!
Don't worry about me so. I can take care of myself, you'll see.
Oh, thank the Maker!
What? Now you're just being daft. You need me down there!
So I get left behind to mind the chickens? I see how it is.
Personal drama over with? Then let's get underway.
So are you ready? It's a long trek. If you have any business you need to wrap up here, you'd better do it now.
I'm ready. Let's get started.
Let's go.
We've chosen one of the hidden entrances. The Deep Roads there will be nice and virginal, ready for a good deflowering.
Now, before we... wait. Who invited the old woman?
I'm sorry to interrupt, ser dwarf, but I need to speak with my children.
I just want to know one thing: are you planning on taking Bethany with you?
Mother... I'll be fine. I want to go.
I just want to know one thing: are you planning on taking Carver with you?
I'm going. It'll be fine.
It's not fine! You can't both go! What if something were to happen to you?
Well, you're not going to be able to take everyone, anyhow. You'll need to decide.
I need some time.
I'm not ready.
Then I'll make sure we have all the supplies we need. Don't take all year.
Still looking for our Deep Roads entrance. Any progress, partner?
Found your mystical horde of coin yet, human?
I do have your coin, in fact.
Yes.
Now we just need a decent entrance into the Deep Roads.
These might be just what we need.
I have maps.
Varric mentioned it. We have an idea.
We're looking into that.
Aren't there plenty of entrances into the Deep Roads out there?
You don't know of one?
None that haven't already been explored. I've no interest in trying to pluck a bare duck.
If you can find a way in, then we can leave sooner. Until then, I have to keep looking.
You'll get your coin.
Not yet.
Then how about you tell me when that happens? Until then, you're not much of a partner.
Varric! Where did you get off to? And what are you planning?
Bartrand! So suspicious! I have, in fact, brought us our future partner!
You again? What now?
I spoke to Varric about becoming a partner.
Look, if we're going to be partners...
Now is that any way to talk to your business partner?
Partner? Bloody Varric.
If you see that sodding bastard, bring him here. I want to hear exactly what he's promised, right from his lying mouth.
You're not coming with us, and that's final!
Return to Hubert in Hightown's market by day.
Control of the Bone Pit was handed to the miners to settle a labor dispute.
Control of the Bone Pit was wrested from Hubert to settle a labor dispute.
There's been a collapse—the way forward is blocked.
What? Is there some way around?
Not that I've been able to find. The side passages are too dangerous.
Useless! What am I paying you blighters for?
Screams
Set camp!
You rejected Lilley's offer of protecting the the Bone Pit from the Coterie. Return to Hubert and give him the news.
Leave now and I will not pursue you.
I don't want to fight.
You can't honestly believe that will happen.
Complete accident. I was trying to help. Honest.
Oops.
And now you're going to die.
You're a monster!
Take away my pets, and I'll take away yours. How loyal are these friends you drag into the Fade?
Would your pirate queen stay if the open water beckoned?
What do you say, sweetheart? A two-mast brigantine, square-main topsail... A hundred well-built lads to answer your every whim.
Ooh.
This is a demon, Isabela. Don't let it tempt you.
Don't fall for it.
Well, if it wasn't a demon, I wouldn't think it could grant wishes!
Should I turn around now to let you stab me in the back? Or would you rather it be a surprise?
I can't beat that.
You are just the sweetest!
Think about siding with that demon, and you're dead.
Don't turn on me.
You'll have to catch me first.
The Siren's Call Two awaits in Kirkwall Harbor. I'll be under the furs in the captain's quarters.
I like big boats, I cannot lie.
You have cost me a dreamer, but at least you will provide me a death!
What would your noble knight do to reclaim what she lost?
You spent your whole life trying to be the chevalier your father wanted. The one thing you chose for yourself, and the darkspawn took him.
Wesley?
I've been waiting for you, love. All your doubts started when we met this apostate.
Come back to me, love. Everything went wrong when we met this family of apostates.
Kill him, and everything we lost will be restored.
Kill her, and everything we lost will be restored.
This isn't Wesley, Aveline.
Don't trust him.
The Fade is the only place where your failure can be erased.
This is a demon in Wesley's skin. How can you fall for this?
You believe this?
It is not the form she wants. It is redemption.
You make one move, I'll take your bloody head off.
Don't turn on me.
Is that how a friend would speak to you?
I failed you, Wesley. I failed myself. If that moment could be changed...
Ha! You want me, come through her!
Problems, Brother?
Sodding Deep Roads! Who knows how long it'll take to clear the path?
Shall we not try to find a way around, instead? Seems like the logical choice.
You think I'm an idiot, Varric? The scouts say the side passages are too dangerous!
I'll deal with whatever we find if it means not sitting here.
I can handle danger.
We need to do something. Sitting out here in the open is just as dangerous.
Don't give up now.
See? This is why you bring someone like me along.
Good thing I'm no scout.
We'll take a look. If we come running back, screaming, you'll know staying put was the right decision.
Fine, fine! Find a way around. Just do it quickly!
Er... I hate to add to your burdens, my friends, but I fear I must.
I fear my boy, Sandal, wandered off. He's somewhere in those passages, right now!
I beg you, keep an eye out for him. He just... doesn't understand danger like he should.
If he's alive, we'll find him.
We'll look for him.
We need to search the side passages. We'll bring him back, if we can.
We'll look for him.
We'll bring him back in one piece. Or maybe two. Hard to say, really.
We'll look for him.
Poor Sandal. I can't believe he's done this!
You knew the risk when you brought him here.
He's on his own.
We have to think of the expedition first. I'm sorry.
He's on his own.
Don't worry, I'm sure he's fine! What could happen?
He's on his own.
Then I need to find him myself!
Wonderful. Let's find a way around before the entire expedition runs off one by one.
Like any beast, remove the fangs and it is lost.
Bodahn better start keeping that boy on a short leash.
Sighs At least you found Bodahn.
And now Bodahn's disappeared, too. Great! Anyone else you'd like to drive off into the Deep Roads?
Find Bodahn's boy, if you can. I have to get these blighters digging.
My people, I present to you... our hope.
His features may mark him as human, but in his heart beats the blood of the Dales!
He came to us to learn his heritage, to release the power from a lineage as ancient as our race.
He is now a prisoner of the Circle, but through us, he shall find freedom!
I... I don't know what to say...
This is a trick.
Say no.
That's not the Keeper, Feynriel. Demons can take on other forms.
She's a demon.
Your power could restore the elves to their former glory.
This is your birthright.
The Wounded Coast Cave
The Cave on the Wounded Coast
The viscount is relieved that the matter is closed, but the Arishok and Mother Petrice may have more to add.
First Enchanter? You're not going to tell me my magic makes me dangerous?
He is First Enchanter, child, but also an elf.
You have a gift we feared lost. As a dreamer, you can tap the power of the Fade and the spirits within, as we all once did.
You will change the course of history, Feynriel.
Embrace it.
N-no, all my nightmares do is wake me up screaming. What power is that?
A dreamer's mind shapes the Fade. Open yourself to the spirits, and you can bring that control to the mortal realm.
Spirits? You mean demons!
This is what the Circle warns of... the temptation.
Weren't you... Keeper Marethari warned me of this!
You're not the Keeper! Mother's people have no Circle, but they don't consort with demons.
You! Why did you interfere?
With my power joined to his, Feynriel would have changed the world!
You found him! I can't believe it, you found him!
Hello!
I owe you a great debt. I will repay it somehow—I swear my life on it!
Help me! Aaah!
I am such a fool! How could running off like that have helped the boy?
You should have known better.
No argument here.
You were only thinking of your son's safety.
It's understandable.
Brave, but not all that smart.
This isn't helping.
Thank you. If... if you find Sandal out there, I pray you do the same for him.
I do hope nothing has happened to the boy. The thought that he's out there, wandering...

Hello.
I don't believe it. Are you responsible for all this?
Did you kill these darkspawn?
Are you injured? How did you do this?
Are you all right?
I'd really like to know how you managed to kill all of them.
Good job!
Boom.
Smart boy.
Say thank you to the nice man for saving your life, Sandal.
Say thank you to the nice lady for saving your life, Sandal.
Thank you.
Enchantment?
My boy's quite good at it. Does any of your equipment require enchanting?
Let's see what he can do.
Yes.
Yay!
Not right now.
No.
Aww.
Ah, here we go. This goes right where we want it to.
Let's go back and tell Bartrand. He'll be so pleased.
Bartrand! We found a way around your damned cave-in!
It's about time! Let's move out!
Holy shit.
I thought... an abandoned thaig, something old, but... what is this?
How did you even know it was here?
Make camp here! We need to look around.
Merrill
Fenris

Serah FirstName/> Hawke,
Please come speak to me—and only me—in my keep. It is a matter of the utmost privacy and urgency, and I can trust it to no one else.
Viscount Dumar
Martin
I think that's all of them.
For the moment.
Yes. You're right.
We should have run sooner! Why did we wait so long?
Why are you looking at us? We've been running since Ostagar!
Why are you looking at me? I've been running since Ostagar!
Are you two insane? If we stand around, we'll die!
Enough!
Listen, you two. The darkspawn could be on us any minute.
We need to get out of here.
Not to interrupt, but the Blight's not going to wait while we stand here pointing fingers.
Speaking of running...
Please! Listen to your brother.
Please! Listen to your sister.
Then let's go. Lead on.
Wait! Where are we going?
Away from the darkspawn. Where else?
And then where? We can't just wander aimlessly!
We stay alive. That's the only thing we need to worry about right now.
First things first.
Wherever we go, what's important is that we don't separate.
We have to stay together.
So long as we wander aimlessly away from the horde, I'm happy.
Why not?
We can go to Kirkwall.
What? Why would we go there?
I know that, but we still have family there—and an estate.
Sighs Then we need to get to Gwaren and take ship.
If we survive that long. I'll just be happy to get out of here.
Mother told me the Dalish are honorable! Why would the Keeper lie?
Why would she entrust her people to a human?
You are one of us, Feynriel. Your magic will restore our greatness.
But I-I can't even control my magic. The Circle says I have power, but no gift for using it.
But... you told me this magic was outlawed for a reason. Even the Dalish don't practice it anymore.
That's a demon, Feynriel. It wants to trick you.
That's not the Keeper.
Could the elves trust you with the power to shape reality?
It is too dangerous.
I—
Could you trust yourself?
He lies! The first enchanter is a pawn of the templars.
No! Silence, demon!
Don't listen to him! The first enchanter is trying to keep you from realizing your greatness.
Trying to keep me from temptation... from demons! What are you?
Trying to keep me from temptation, just like you were. You're not the Keeper!
Begone, fiend!

The boy only wants his freedom, not your power.
It wasn't what he wanted.
Those who are free to choose, always want power. You think your friends are different?
Have you ever seen an abomination? They are ug-ly.
Not worth it.
You put such stock in appearances? Perhaps that is why your friends' loyalty only goes skin-deep.
There can be no honest deal with a demon.
Only as your slave.
No? You think I will lie, then, when I offer your friends what Feynriel turned down?
You think this elf, with her innocent face, would turn down a demon's offer? She didn't before.
How about it? Would you take what I offered the boy? Scion of the Dalish, savior of elvenkind?
Can you... do that?
I am the greatest of my kind! Whatever tricks your little pet has taught you will pale in comparison.
Demons always turn on you in the end.
Don't trust it, Merrill.
All right, when he puts it that way.
Convincing argument...
Do it and you're a dead woman.
Don't dare turn on me.
I... cannot put you ahead of the fate of my people.
You took my dreamer, now you'll take his place!
You think this slave would choose you over his freedom?

Bone Pit

Go to the Viscount’s Keep to speak with him about an urgent personal matter.
Interesting...
Cast your eyes elsewhere, demon. I won my freedom from the magisters long ago.
But you fear them still. They have left their marks on your body and your mind.
With my aid, you could be free forever. You could have power enough to challenge any who would chain you.
If you accept, you are no better than the magistrates.
Don't listen, Fenris.
But... to face them as an equal? I...
How transparent can you get?
That's heavy-handed.
Turn on me, Fenris, and you'll regret it.
Don't you dare.
And thus you resort to threats? I have faced far worse than you.
What... would you want from me?
A moment of your time, nothing more.
You think this dwarf would turn down an opportunity to seize a power unknown to his kind?
What do you say, storyteller? It's chafed, has it not, making your brother the hero of your own tale?
A hero? Bartrand betrayed us!
And came away with the treasure of the ages.
With my aid, you would have emerged with the glory, not tarnished silver and flesh wounds.
Varric, you're a better man than Bartrand ever was.
Don't listen to this.
That's what you've got? Join me, and you too can be a back-stabbing bastard?
That's your best offer?
Don't even think about turning on me, little man.
Back off, Varric.

I'm sorry.

I like enchantment.

How did you end up here?

Pity how the hero met her end. For such a woman to die as she slew the great Archdemon... a tragic—if heroic—tale!
I hear that the hero is married to the king, now. Fancy that! A Grey Warden queen!
I hear that the hero is married to the queen, now. Fancy that! A Grey Warden ruling Ferelden!
The Hero of Ferelden is a fine man. After all his accomplishments, may he find even greater success.
The Hero of Ferelden is a fine woman. After all her accomplishments, may she find even greater success.
Ah, but surely my past is hardly of interest to the likes of you!
Let's see what you have.
I wish to buy something.

Enchanting.
Enchantment!

Goodbye.

Unfortunately, they escaped on the journey. With their phylacteries burned, it has been nearly impossible to track them.
What's a phylactery?
Phylacteries?
When a mage joins the Circle, the first enchanter takes a sample of his blood.
It is used as a focus to track the mage should he escape.
Ser Karras is a knight-lieutenant of the templars, a great crony of Meredith.
Should he find apostates hiding from pursuit, Meredith will consider him justified in murdering the lot of them.

Meredith?
You have clearly not been in Kirkwall long...
Meredith is knight-commander. She has changed the rules for mages in Kirkwall. They are less free than elsewhere.
Though I daresay she has created as much dissent as obedience.
Thank you. Your compassion does you credit.
They were not our charges. They were en route to Kirkwall from Starkhaven when they escaped.

What about you men here?
They won't go in after him. They're stalling, trying to give the murdering bastard a chance to get away.
Oy now, elf. Like we said before, you're bleeding mad if you think we'll be going against the magistrate's orders.

How does this go unnoticed?
We're nothing to them. Even if this murderer does finally go before the courts, the magistrate won't take our word over his.
This murderer cannot be allowed to walk free.
All right, I'll help you.
