Are you the Grey Warden?
I want to know about the Deep Roads.
I'm just here for information.
The Deep Roads? Then you don't seek my services?
Did the Wardens send you to bring me back?
I'm not going. Those bastards made me get rid of my cat.
I've always heard that joining the Wardens is for life.
Can people leave the Wardens?
That's only partly true.
The hopelessly tainted by the darkspawn and plagued by nightmares about the Archdemon parts don't go away.
But it turns out if you hide well, you don't have to wear the uniform or go to the parties.
So you came to Kirkwall just to escape the Wardens?
What are you doing here?
You say that like it's a small thing.
Yes, I'm here because there's no Warden outpost, no darkspawn, and a whole host of refugees to blend in with.
And some reasons of my own.
I'm part of an expedition into the Deep Roads. Any information you have could save people's lives.
I want your help.
I will die a happy man if I never think about the blighted Deep Roads again.
I'm part of an expedition to the Deep Roads, and I'll pay to find an entrance.
Let me buy your information.
Hrmph. If I wanted money, I've been going about it all wrong.
I need to know how to get into the Deep Roads. You can tell me willingly or not.
Tell me or else.
Don't threaten me, little girl.
Don't threaten me, boy.
You can't imagine what I've come through to get here. I'm not interested...
Although... a favor for a favor. Does that sound like a fair deal? You help me, I'll help you?
Help my expedition reach the Deep Roads, and I'll do whatever you need.
Yes.
You don't ask for my terms? What if I were asking for the knight-commander's head on a spike?
Is that what you ask?
You decide.
Let's be more specific. I don't do anything involving children or animals.
What's the favor?
We'll get to the Deep Roads ourselves.
Forget it.
I have a Warden map of the depths in this area. But there's a price.
I came to Kirkwall to aid a friend. A mage. A prisoner in the wretched Gallows.
The templars learned of my plans to free him. Help me bring him safely past them, and you shall have your maps.
Tell me about your friend.
Who is this mage?
His name is Karl Thekla. He was sent here from Ferelden when Kirkwall's Circle required new talent.
His last letter said the knight-commander was turning the Circle into a prison.
Mages are locked in their cells, refused appearances at court, made Tranquil for the slightest crimes. I told him I would come.
You want to make your friend an apostate?
Help him escape the Circle?
That's such a weighted term.
Yes, Andraste said magic should serve man, not rule him. But I've yet to find a mage who wants to rule anything.
It goes against no will of the Maker for mages to live as free as other men.
What do the templars know of your plans?
How did the templars find out?
I don't know. I had been exchanging notes with Karl through a maidservant in the Gallows.
Then the letters stopped coming.
How do you plan to break him out of the Gallows?
What is your plan?
I'm hoping it won't come to that.
I sent Karl a message to meet me in the chantry tonight. Maker willing, he'll be there, alone.
But if there are templars with him, I swear, I'll free him from them. Whatever the cost.
I would help any mage in such circumstances, map or no.
I help all my fellow mages.
Now you're just trying to get on my good side.
I welcome your aid. I have already sent word for Karl to meet me in the chantry tonight.
Join us there, and we'll ensure that no matter who is with him, we all walk away free.
You've convinced me. What's your plan?
I will help.
Oh, that's all? I might just take my chances with the darkspawn.
You want me to fight templars?
If we fight the templars, it is because they decide that anyone who befriends a mage deserves death without questioning.
I will not make this deal sight-unseen.
Show me the maps.
It's all right here. But you don't see one page until Karl is free.
These are my terms. If you want my aid with your expedition, meet me in the chantry tonight.
I have sent word to Karl to be there. Maker willing, we will all leave free men.
That wasn't normal magic you just did, was it?
So, let me guess. This is the part where you tell me you're an abomination?
You're wrong. But not far wrong.
Talk. What happened to you in the chantry?
I... this is hard to explain. When I was in Amaranthine, I met a spirit of Justice who was trapped outside the Fade.
We became friends. And he recognized the injustice that mages in Thedas face every day.
And that's... different than a demon?
A spirit of justice?
Just as demons prey on the deadly sins of mankind, there are good spirits who embody our virtues.
Spirits of compassion, fortitude... justice.
They are the Maker's first children, and they have all but given up on us.
This spirit sounds like a useful friend to have.
You are fortunate.
He was far better to me than I have been to him.
So, I wasn't so far off with that abomination thing?
And now your eyes glow...
What does this have to do with your eyes glowing?
Are you saying what I think?
Just say whatever you have to say.
Spit it out.
To live outside the Fade, he needed a host. I offered to help him...
We were going to work together, bring justice to every child ever ripped away from his mother to be sent to the Circle.
But... I guess I had too much anger. Once he was inside me, he... changed.
So, you have this spirit of justice living in your head?
Let me get this straight...
It's not like that. He's gone now. He's part of me.
It's not like we can... have a conversation. I feel his thoughts as my own.
Not even the greatest scholar could tell you where I end and he begins.
This is obviously difficult for you.
I'm sorry.
I thought I was helping my friend. He would have... died, I guess. If that even means anything.
And he wanted to help me. He knew what mages have suffered.
That really didn't look like a happy, benevolent spirit from where I was standing.
He didn't look too friendly.
Since when is justice happy? Justice is righteous. Justice is hard.
So he's a demon now?
Changed to what?
No! He is a spirit whose only purpose is to see the innocent saved and the guilty punished.
But my anger... when I see templars now, things that have always outraged me, but I could never do anything about...
He comes out. And he is no longer my friend Justice. He is a force of vengeance. And he has no grasp of mercy.
Can Justice ever be separated from you?
Can you undo this?
I don't think so. The only way a spirit has ever been separated from a living host is by its death.
The curse is of my own making. All I can do now is hope to control it.
Can you bring him out at will?
Can you control it?
No. He comes only when I've lost all power over myself.
It's a madness, a frenzy. I only find out after what I might have done.
Is there anything I can do for you?
I wish I could help.
You're the first one I've ever told this. Thank you for not running away.
So, that explains your whole sexy tortured look.
I like men with dark pasts.
Perhaps I should check a looking glass more often.
I've rarely met a man who says such things so openly. But you're obviously a rare man.
I had not thought to ever find a woman who would look past what I just said.
I thought I was done with the Grey Wardens, but if you have any need of me... I will be waiting here.
I just need your Grey Warden expertise, not a diatribe on your strange personal habits.
I need that Deep Roads map.
Here. These are all the documents I have for this area.
I can understand if you would rather me not join you personally.
I cannot control my need for vengeance. I would ask no one to take on the danger of traveling with me.
Mages are humans... and elves... just like the rest of us.
You're wrong.
Many might go their whole lives thinking that.
But if even one in ten falls to the lure of blood magic, they could destroy this world.
But I will not preach. Thank you for your service. I will relieve Keran of his commission now, pending investigation.
You take a grave risk in trusting me.
Do you hear that? I think it's music.
And get every last hour of work out of us before we were eaten!
You men will have a safe environment and steady pay from now on.
Up-jumped bloody dog-lord.
I apologize.

Correct.

It appears we're unscathed.
Don't worry. We do this sort of thing often.

My name is Fenris. These men were Imperial bounty hunters seeking to recover a magister's lost property, namely myself.
They were trying to lure me into the open. Crude as their methods were, I could not face them alone.
Thankfully, Anso chose wisely.

So there's no job?
That seems like a lot of effort to find one slave.

I don't appreciate being lied to.
You used me.

Where is that singing coming from? You hear it, right, Hawke?

Andraste's words were that magic must not rule over man.

You're getting angry.

Keep your personal issues to yourself. Our relationship is strictly professional.
Don't do it again.
Understood.
Well. Under that scruffy exterior, I think you've got a bit of a soft heart, yourself.
Am I making you uncomfortable?
Am I making you uncomfortable?
No.

I can take care of myself.

I knew it! I knew it would be here!
I thought I was done for.
I'm not sure about attacking templars. I might rather take my chances with the darkspawn.
You want me to fight templars?
So, he's a nice spirit?
Those sodding darkspawn jumped me out of nowhere. Nearly took my arm off!
My apologies. You save my life, and I don't even introduce myself. I'm Iwan.
You're the man who abandoned his brothers to die at the hands of the darkspawn.
I know who you are.
Bah! I didn't abandon them. Merin was already lost to the darkspawn. And leaving Emrys behind was safer for the both of us!
After what Emrys told me, I wasn't sure I'd find you in time.
Good to see you still live.
When I get saved from being eaten, the first thing I worry about is proper etiquette.
Yes, how disrespectful.
The training of a merchant's son, I guess. I take it you met my brother?
Sighs You were right. We shouldn't have let Castillon go. I should've known better.
I can't believe I'm even admitting this to you.
Admitting you were wrong is the first step to changing.
I'm glad you are.
Say another sappy thing like that, and I'm going to hit you.
You were right to be upset with me for letting Castillon go.
I'm so going to enjoy this.
I told you so!
Fine. It's deserved.
You're bad at apologizing.
Is that all you have to say?
I'm not apologizing! I'm... ugh! All right, I am apologizing. I'm sorry I let him go. I really am.
What's worse, you've been right all along. I am selfish.
I'm glad we got rid of Castillon. I... I'm proud that we did.
He had a nice ship, but it was just a ship. Knowing he's gone is... I can't describe it.
We've done something special for the people he wronged. I don't know if it's justice, but it certainly is satisfying.
You've grown over the years. I've seen it.
You've come a long way.
I have? Are you saying I'm getting fat? I am reaching that age, aren't I? Is it my ass?

Chuckles
What have you done with Isabela?
Who are you?

Took you long enough to come to your senses.
Finally, she gets it.
I've done lousy things to people. I thought ignoring the consequences of my actions would make them go away.
I thought it made me free. I was wrong, wasn't I?
This is a huge step forward. I'm proud of you.
I'm glad you realize that.
Oh, stop it! This is your fault, you know.
If I made a list of the things you were wrong about, they'd stretch from here to Tevinter.
That and more.
I'm glad you have a sense of humor about it, at least.
You weren't free. You were just a coward.
Dead wrong.
I should be angry, but I'm not. I deserve that.
You've always assumed I'm a stronger person than I really am. Even now I don't know if I can be that person.

Sighs I must be losing my mind.

I thought you didn't want to talk.
Wait a minute. I don't smell alcohol on your breath. Will wonders never cease?
Oh, shush! I... I've been thinking.
That was a while ago. I've... I've had time to think.
Something on your mind?
Emrys is still alive? Good. That's good.
I am... grateful for your timely arrival, but I'm sure Emrys needs your help more. The fool still believes Merin can be saved.
I'll only be a little longer, I'm sure. Then I can catch up and help you retrieve Merin's body.
You just lost your brother. Why are you out here instead of with Emrys?
You don't seem too upset.
Your love for your siblings is heartwarming.
What lucky brothers you have.
Emrys said you were after a weapon. I'm here to make sure it doesn't fall into the wrong hands.
Where's the sword?
It's a dwarven artifact! It should be in dwarven hands!
How incredibly noble of you. The ancestors would be proud.
There has to be other treasure here you can hock. Leave me to mine!
I can't just leave you alone. The darkspawn will be back in larger numbers.
You'll die down here.
You're only alive because I wanted information on the weapon. But if you won't help me...
I'm taking the sword.
I don't think you're in any position to make demands...
Are you telling me what to do?

You sacrificed your family for wealth. Pathetic.
Coward.
You'd... kill me?
The man who told me about the sword sold me a control rod for a golem that protects it.
Varric will settle on a price with you.
Varric, negotiate.
I could just say you were dead when I found you.
I could kill you for it.
That stupid plate was the whole city of Orzammar to him.
You inherited the family businesses, didn't you?
Don't you deal with them now?
Everything makes you thirsty. Don't try to blame that on the Dwarven Merchant Guild, Varric.
You always need a drink.
So when do I get the grand tour?
Of the ship?
Haven't you already—oh, you mean my ship.

Everyone makes mistakes.
You know what they say about men like that, don't you?
I haven't seen any shackles. You're just making things up.
He doesn't have shackles.
Oh. But... I had this joke lined up.
You're no fun.
Cheating?
Hey, I gave her back her things. You saw me.
We're only a year apart. But that was time enough for Leandra to get our parents wrapped firmly around her little finger.
They showed her off at every opportunity—the beauty, the scholar, the light of their lives.
As far as they were concerned, they should have stopped there.
This was a bid for attention?
Well, it's not like I stood at the side of the wharf and hurled it over.
I tried to invest it. Got some good tips on trade in Qunari cheeses.
And, you know, a man's got needs. I'm not denying I spent more on myself than I should've. But I figured it'd all work out.
So the best way to make Daddy love you was to steal his money?
You tried? Really?
Don't make excuses.
You're pathetic.
Maker, what a mess. I want to make things better for Mother, but some of what Gamlen says... I'm having a hard time hating him.
Playing caretaker for someone else's life, stuck in their shadow... that's no way to live.
Here we go again.
Something you need to say?
And there it is.
Look, if you want to join the fight over who lost the most, fine. But I never lived here.
Mother even gave me her old key to try and stir something. But I didn't know Grandfather. Finding his will doesn't matter to me.
Uncle's a chatty drunk. He was up to his neck and signed everything over. That's who has the estate.
You want a connection, this is where we'll find it.
Let's make it matter to you.
The once mighty Amells? A bunch of slavers are squatting on that dusty glory.
What have you heard?
Apparently the most extensive wine cellar in Kirkwall is now a slave highway from the Undercity. That's the family legacy.
She tried her best to give us what we need. I think she's due the same.
We owe it to Mother to try.
Oh, I see her side: Gamlen's definitely an ass. But it's not like we can just ask slavers to give back that life.
That sounds like an arrangement that needs to change.
Well, that can't continue.
And what if it does? We still aren't important enough to actually live in the place.
I don't know about you, but that makes me a little angry.
No one will miss slavers.
I think we need to pay them a visit and look for Mother's missing paperwork.
The will could still be there.
We agree at last.
So forgetting everything else, what would you do with slavers?
Only one thing their kind deserves.
We agree at last.
All right, Sister. If the key works, we'll clear the estate from the Undercity up.
I don't know if any of this will help, but I do feel like hitting someone.
I'm sure they will be right neighborly about letting us poke around.
We'll give them the chance, sure.
Baby steps, Carver.
Your mother's busy writing to the viscount. If you want more touching family stories, go to her.
Don't butter me up, sweetie.
Don't try to butter me up, lad.
I changed their filthy sheets and wiped their chins through two bouts of the cholera and the last word Father said was Leandra.
I'm not looking for love.
But at least I got the money.
Incriminating Documents
An Errant Letter
Take the letter that was recovered from the transformed mage to the templar, Thrask, in the Gallows.
Thrask received the letter about his daughter being an abomination. This letter proved quite useful in blackmailing the templar.
Thrask received the letter about his daughter being an abomination. To his relief, this information will remain undisclosed.
All right, Brother. If the key works, we'll clear the estate from the Undercity up.
What's this about, Hawke?
I can't believe you found it! This sounds exactly like the sort of fake thing I'd make up about you.
Go away! I don't want to talk.
Th-this bite... it's festering. I can feel it rot.
Why would the Maker create so many darkspawn?
Well, off we go, I guess. Maker watch over us.
I would've come if you asked, but thank you for letting me stay here.
I could live happily without ever seeing a darkspawn again.
I guess you're leaving for the Deep Roads soon.
Be careful. I don't want to lose you like we lost Carver.
What do you think that Seeker wanted? I didn't get the feeling she was done here.
The people we're meeting... I'm not sure who's worse, the apostates or the templars.
I wish I didn't need either of them.
I wonder if Mother has received an audience with the viscount yet.
We're not running away again. We're coming home.
It almost looks like my new ship! I know a perfect spot for it in the captain's cabins.
This belongs to whoever is responsible for House Tethras. That's you now.
It's a reminder.
I figured you'd want it. It's an heirloom of your family's, isn't it?
It belongs to your House.
I'm sure you need a seal, what with all the guild paperwork you do now.
I figured you'd need it.
It was already yours. I'm just returning it to you.
It's nothing.
I'm just glad I found it.
You're welcome.
When you tell people, mention that I got it from the belly of a dragon.
Feel free to embellish this.
You! This is all your fault!
You and that blighter, Varric Tethras!
I don't even know who you are.
Have we met?
Yevhen. Member in good standing of the Dwarven Merchants Guild.
Whatever you think I did, I can fix it.
I can help you.
Keep on insulting me and my friends, and you'll lose that wagging tongue, little man.
Shut your mouth.
Typical. Exactly the boneheaded bravado they're drawn to.
You'll have to be more specific. A lot of things are my fault.
Please clarify.
My sons are lost in the Deep Roads because of stories about you! Your sodding glory and treasure!
Your sons made an expedition into the Deep Roads? Did anyone go with them?
Tell me what happened.
They went alone, the fools. Just my three boys against every darkspawn in the Deep Roads.
I found this when we were at the estate. I thought you should have it.
I think this is a picture of Mother. She looks like you.
I don't care much about old family stuff. But I thought you might want this.
Where did you get that? Was it at the estate? Let me see!
Is it— I think this is Mother's betrothal portrait, from when she was supposed to marry the Comte. Look! You can see the ring.
You like it?
You seem excited.
I love it!
My whole life, Mother's always been so sad and worried. All because of my cursed magic.
I always wished there was some way to take that burden off her.
I suppose it would have been a bit awkward to take it with her.
No wonder she left it behind.
She was much happier with Father.
Father was a better man.
I know she loved Father. I guess... I just wonder if she'd have been happier if he hadn't been a mage. If I wasn't a mage.
I know that made it hard for Mother.
It's nice to have a reminder of a time when she still knew how to smile.
What about the other one? Merin?
Tell me about Merin.
Sounds like you're none too fond of Iwan, Dera.
Tell me about Iwan.
Chasing Isabela
Hello, Lord Carver.
We're still a long way from cowing templars with our titles, Brother.
We're still a long way from cowing templars with our titles, Sister.
Follow Isabela's trail.
Follow Isabela's trail to Lowtown.
Follow Isabela's trail to the Docks.
Why don't you go pick up something at the market? You could use some air!
What? Hey!
Still brooding? You're nobility. Knock it off.
Thinking of life in Hightown?
Is there something you would do differently, Brother?
Not happy with our progress?
You could slap on a smile for a few days. For her sake.
Be happy for Mother.
We took a big step with this. You should respect that.
Your attitude stinks.
Don't you dare blame her! We both know this was Iwan's doing!
Don't you dare blame him! We both know this was Iwan's doing!
You figured it'd work out?
Rescue Isabela from the warehouse.
It's not up to me. We're on pace to recover an old name for an old woman.
She's not interested in what I think. She wants to provide for us, and you're making sure it happens.
He's always been such a greedy thing. Even as a boy.
Stop talking about my son like that!
Tell me about Emrys.
What is Emrys like?
Iwan is Yevhen's middle son. The whole thing was his idea. Emrys and Merin were just following his lead.
It's strange, living here again. My childhood home, now owned by my child.
It's not something I could have imagined when I was a little girl staring out this window.
I'm still grateful you used your money from the expedition to buy back the estate. I feel like an Amell again.
I'm going to make the name Hawke one to be proud of in this city.
You're a Hawke.
I don't doubt it. Your father would have said that with that exact look, too.
I just wish we could all be together as a family one more time.
Just don't go all pompous on me, all right?
Don't start putting on airs.
I promise. If there's one thing I learned in Ferelden, it's that good people can be born in a hut as easily as a palace.
Honestly, after so many years as a peasant's wife, it feels strange to have nothing to do.
But I can't spend the rest of my life mourning Bethany and Carver. They're gone and I can't bring them back.
It's been three years. Move on already.
Not this again...
You have so many new duties to keep you busy. And I'm just sitting idle.
But I am doing better.
I visited Bethany at the Circle and she seems happy enough.
I visited Carver with the templars and he's so proud of his new knighthood.
I just... to lose Bethany and Carver, both of them, so close together. It's been hard. But I'm trying.
I guess I just need to start finding you a suitable wife.
I guess I just need to start picking you out a suitable husband.
... and then Hawke tore the door clean off its hinges, walked into the room, and... I guess we'll finish this later.
Right, right, the glorious Amells, a noble lineage dating to the Third Blight. You know what that means?
Seven hundred years of people sitting around saying, wow, look how great we used to be.
Mother didn't even want that life back until we got dumped here. And you only care because we're under templar scrutiny.
If you want to keep your job, shut your mouth, woman!
Your boys are grown men. It was their own decision!
What exactly were they trying to do?
That requires an explanation.
Sounds familiar.
The Reinhardts' second daughter is very interested in meeting you.
Seneschal Bran has a son about your age...
He's the oldest, but Iwan's been bossing him around since he learned to talk. Man's near thirty and has no backbone whatsoever.
His mother's death hit him hard, but he shouldn't be looking to his brothers for guidance.
Merin's a dear sweet lad. Raised him myself since the day his mum died.
Isabela's Trail
They will know. Whether they will deign to acknowledge it, I have no idea.
They never learn, do they?
I fail to see the point of throwing their lives away.
Another twenty steps, another batch of deaths.
What a waste.
We have important things to do. Why do they insist on interrupting?
You're apparently quite the inspiration.
Hard to teach some people.
Is there an end to the people who hate you?
They certainly don't leave us much choice.
I hate that people like that make this necessary.
I don't know if I like being this much of a target.
I guess some people just can't let the past go.
Senseless. Every time.
What was the point of throwing away their lives like that?
And stay dead! Maker, the idiocy.
It'll take a census to tally the dead when we're done.
Take a step, kill. Repeat, repeat, repeat.
Should have licked their wounds and stayed home.
How many times does this happen before people start to realize it's not a good idea?
That's what you get. Right there: dead.
The hate you inspire is unfortunate.
So many enemies. Do they ever rest?
How many times do we have to do this before people learn?
More? I thought we were pretty thorough the first time around.
A pointless way to end their lives.
Your death toll is approaching natural disaster.
Can you imagine how sore you'd be if it was your job to bury all these idiots?
Who keeps hiring these discount thugs? Quality investments pay off, people.
These little surprises are getting old.
We had a short-lived drinking game based how many enemies you have. It killed a man.
Nobody seems to like you. Do you get used to that?
That was just sad. People need to let go. At least sometimes.
How long does this go on? Someone has to know this is pointless.
Is it normal for people to come back like this? I don't know what's normal.
It's unfortunate that they make this necessary.
I'll just call that bunch enemies and footnote it later.
More? You're not exactly the most popular person in town.
I didn't even get their names that time.
How many people do you have on your tail?
I'm getting too old for this shit.
Hawke, about Junior... Maker, I'm sorry. Bartrand will pay for this, I swear.
Poor Sunshine... Bartrand will pay for her death, I promise you.
And when we're done, I don't know. I guess we'll sit around thinking about how great we used to be?
I thought coming to the surface meant I would never have to face losing my sons to the darkspawn.
Hopefully we can save your sons before their idiocy gets them killed.
I'll do it.
I'm not risking the Deep Roads for your foolish children.
I can't help you.
They murdered my friend! Where is the concern for that?
You have my gratitude. I hope you encountered no great difficulties on my son's behalf.
There were complications, but I was privileged to keep your son from harm.
It was my honor.
No problems to speak of, aside from the crowd that tried to kill us.
Just a few dozen deaths.
We were heavily outnumbered, but I prevailed.
We survived.
I am yours.
Tell me, and it is done.
I enjoy following you.
Always a pleasure.
I remain at your side.
Yes, my friend?
Whatever you need, I am ready to assist.
What is it?
I stand ready.
Hawke.
I cannot imagine what it must be like to lose your family.
Anything I could say would be insufficient. I'm sorry.
I would not wish your sister's end on anyone. Accept my condolences.
Your brother seemed a fine young man. I am sorry for his loss.
The mansion would be a better place to talk.
I'd like to speak with you, but not here. My mansion is more appropriate.
We can talk at the mansion, if you like.
We can talk more back at the city.
Now is not the time to chat. Perhaps back in Kirkwall.
I would be glad to speak with you, but not here.
I am rather conspicuous here.
The trappings change, but power here is the same as power anywhere.
They will not want me in this place. Let us not linger.
Sour ale, vomit, and the smell of desperation.
Slavery or no, flesh is always for sale.
I didn't think this city could smell any worse. Evidently I was wrong.
This place is known, even in Tevinter.
Many slaves died here. Their cries linger in the stones.
The Wounded Coast? Appropriate.
Sure, I'll look. How many darkspawn could have come back in three years, anyway?
I'll do it.
I'll do everything in my power to bring your sons home.
I'll do it.
Thank you, messere. Those boys are my life.
No, thanks. The Deep Roads and I don't get along.
I can't help you.
I'm sorry, but your sons chose this risk. You must trust they can make it out themselves.
I can't help you.
Then you condemn my sons to death.
Please, messere! It was your trail they followed. If you change your mind, there may still be time to find them.
The second child act is getting pretty stale, Brother.
No one is holding you back.
Very well, Carver. What's your plan?
Fine. What would you do?
I'd look forward, make something new. Stop paying debts for old men.
And if I had to go backward, I'm not looking for ancient names. I'd fix what's important. What went wrong.
We wouldn't need to if you'd done it right. Lothering was our home, not this place. We could have stood our ground.
You could have stopped that ogre from killing Bethany.
You own as much of that as I do!
You share the blame for that!
You're right.
I agree.
You hating everything I do is really losing its charm.
You're being an ass.
I was told the Winters had involved themselves. Was there no way to avoid an incident?
2a) The Talvashoth Cave
2a) The Talvashoth Cave
Why don't we go to the tavern and get a drink? We should chat.
Let's head to the Hanged Man. We should talk, and I'd rather do it where I know who's spying on us.
When we get back to Kirkwall, let's stop by the Hanged Man.
I haven't met that many Dalish, and already I'm not crazy about them.
Something about this whole... creepy ancient magic thing makes me nervous.
Oh hey, nature. I've heard about this. Thought it was just a rumor.
This outdoors thing is growing on me. Like a tumor.
I am getting truly sick of looking at stalagmites. Or are they stalactites? Shit, I don't know.
Andraste's ass, dwarves actually live down here? On purpose? What in blazes for?
I will not be sorry to see daylight again.
Just like always, no cause is too small for you to stick your nose in. I have this under control.
Nothing's changed between us after all these years?
Still angry, Carver?
I've seen a lot, Brother. Our little squabble, it doesn't matter.
Your tone says otherwise, Warden.
It's been years, Carver. We can't be civil?
I'm glad you're doing well.
I almost died in your shadow. I don't appreciate you showing up to take my thunder.
You know, the average person saves a life, they might expect some gratitude.
A little thanks, maybe?
I've seen too much of the world to be impressed by this.
It's just kind of sad.
What is?
That your world has stayed so small.
If my shadow made it down here, you brought it.
I'm a Warden because of you. I blamed you for a long time, but... you saved more than my life. I am so much more than I was.
This is what I was meant to be, and I won't thank you by doing nothing while you start a war.
And Mother said I was the stubborn one.
In war, victory, Champion. Wherever you're bound.
I never claimed to be head of the family.
Neither did I, but someone had to save your ass!
All right.
I'm here if you need me, but I must find my own way.
Try it from this side, always running after you. Or taking care of Mother while you mark your territory.
What?
I'd change all of that if I could. But we don't have that option. And you know it.
You will not use her against me like that! She deserves better!
Not another word!
Then you should have given better.
I gave everything! Question me, Mother, yourself, but not that!
Feel better getting that off your chest?
Are you done?
I... I suppose.
Good. Because I keep every death with me. If you want that weight, be sure you're ready to take it.
I think we're done.
Well, good talk.
I'd rather not talk with so many people around. Maybe back at my place... such as it is?
This isn't a good place to talk. When you can, let's go to my clinic.
Not now. What I have to say requires privacy. Perhaps back at my clinic.
My words are for your ears only. Speak to me in my clinic.
I would like to talk. But not here. When you have time, let's return to my clinic.
Please. Let's not get into anything here. We can talk in private at my clinic.
I've been thinking, and we have much to discuss. But only where no other ears are listening.
This isn't the place for conversation. We can talk back in the city.
It's too dangerous here to stop and chat. Wait until we're in the city.
We must stay alert out here. We can talk in Kirkwall.
Let's not lose our focus. We can talk back in Kirkwall.
This isn't the place for a long heart-to-heart. Let's get back to civilization.
We have more important things to do than chat. Wait until we're back in Kirkwall.
Sure, make light. Why take anything seriously? You're the eldest, you lead by default.
I don't see you taking the reins.
Besides, we both know what happens when someone leaves dear brother's protection.
I'm sure Bethany would appreciate that you're keeping good humor.
Fun's fun, but you're taking this little pissing match too far.
Not amusing.
Poor you. Too busy hiding in my shadow to escape from it.
You give me a lot to laugh at.
What, you don't like someone making a joke out of everything you are?
I am not a joke!
No, you're a lazy brat with a chip on your shoulder!
He's the one who liked the stories best. He wanted to be a hero, though, not just rich. He craved adventure.
Adventure will get a dwarf killed. That boy needs to settle down and learn a trade. Play it safe.
I don't like the idea of some templar Seeker tracking you. Be cautious.
I get so furious when mages try to oppose templars by turning to demons.
There is no better way to ensure we will never be free.
I can't believe you sent that boy Feynriel to the Circle. You know what will become of him there.
You showed the boy Feynriel great mercy. He will live better among the Dalish than anywhere in Kirkwall.
That Thrask seemed like a decent man. For a templar.
I am so sorry about your sister. She seemed a fine girl. She deserved a better end.
I'm sorry about your brother. He was a bit prickly, but he would have grown into a fine man. He deserved better.
Your sister will come to terms with the Wardens.
If she survived the Joining, she has the strength to do all they will ask of her.
I think your brother will like the Wardens. He'll get to be rude and be a hero.
From what I saw of him, I suspect he'll enjoy both.
Your mother... I'm so sorry. I can't believe any mage would do such a thing.
I have tried to avoid the Fade since Justice... It's disturbing when he takes over.
It is still a thrill to turn and see you beside me.
Don't start needling me now. We're busy.
I miss my cat.
When should I do that? When I'm following you around, or when I'm caring for Mother while you tame mighty Kirkwall?
Besides, we both know what happens when someone leaves dear sister's protection.
What do you want to do?

I thought you might like this.
I don't see the humor in digging up Bethany so you can hide behind her, too.
Please help me find them. Don't let my boys die down there.
That's enough, Carver.
I'm with you, Brother. For now.
I'm with you, Sister. For now.
I brought you something. It's shiny and subversive. I thought you'd like it.
I found something. You're more likely to make use of it than me.
You got me a gift? I hardly think I've done anything to deserve that.
I don't understand. You got me a gift? Is there some... Free Marches holiday I'm not aware of?
Is it a... that's a Tevinter Chantry amulet! Do you want me to get executed?
It's sacrilege to wear those in any land under the Divine.
The Divine condemned their chantry because it freed mages from the Circle.
The Tevinters freed mages.
I thought you might sympathize.
Here I thought you fight for mages' rights, whoever's bad side that puts you on.
Are you afraid of sacrilege?
It's a symbol of mage freedom. If you don't like it, don't take it.
Do you want it or not?
No. I like it. You just... surprised me. I wouldn't know where to get something like that around here.
Maker... I think he's ignoring me now.
Hey! Is my coin not good enough for you?
Here, I got you something.
Why?
Don't give me that look. Be grateful for five minutes.
Just read the letters.
I never have affairs with my crew. Once they see you naked with your ass in the air, they think they don't have to take orders.
I—oh, look! It's Hawke!
Isabela! My dusky goddess!
You have buried yourself in the flesh of my heart, like a worm in a red, red apple.
You heart-worm, you!
Oh, look, my friend is here. Excuse me.
But I haven't gotten to the part where I invite you to feast upon my tender white flesh!
That's all right. I think I'll manage.
Speaking of romance...

Birthright
Office Key
Speak with Mother about her argument with Gamlen.
Find Grandfather Amell's will. Go to Darktown and break into the cellars of the old family estate.
Door
I like it. Maybe not on the outside of my clothes—I'm not that eager to face the hangman's noose—but I appreciate the thought.
I've never really thought about what life would be like in the Tevinter Chantry.
In the Circle, they make it sound like the Void itself. The Black Divine, stalking Thedas, making it unsafe for kittens and virgins.
Mages have been free in Tevinter forever. It hasn't fallen yet.
That's propaganda.
Well, they did invade the Black City in their hubris and unleash darkspawn on us all, right?
That's kind of the Circle's whole rationale. But I think that has more to do with being a magister than a mage.
Those kittens and virgins will just have to find a nice strong mage to protect them.
They'll be all right.
Laughs From what I hear about the Tevinters, that's the last thing they'd want.
The virgins, anyway. I've never heard about any horrific... kitten rituals.
I appreciate the gift. Perhaps one day I can return one as meaningful.
I don't support the Tevinter Chantry. I just thought you'd like the amulet.
I'm not trying to convert you.
Well, I do. Thank you.
I will never truly feel at home as long as we are living with Gamlen.
Retrieve the will from the family vault.
Confront Gamlen with his father's will.
You saved Merin. I don't think I'll ever be able to repay you.
Oh Merin, you poor boy...
Iwan... he's not with you. I had hoped...
Father, I told you it would be too late.
He tried to kill Merin and Emrys, and you're sad he didn't make it?
His betrayal isn't lost on me, Dera. But he'll always be my son.
You've given me back two of my boys, messere. I'm in your debt. Please, take this as thanks.
Not much room in the barracks, but there's nowhere I'd rather be.
Your wife is missing? I can try to find her if you like.
Is there something I can do?
You should pay someone else. Like me. I like being paid.
Pay me instead.
I intend to claim the reward for finding your wife.
I'm interested in the bounty.
You are going to look for Ninette? Finally, someone who looks competent.
Her family is getting suspicious. They think I might have... done something to her.
Why would her family think you did something to her?
Her family is suspicious?
They think I married her for her inheritance. And they know we've been fighting.
Do you think Ninette might be in trouble?
Is Ninette in danger?
Bah. She's just trying to show me I'm tied to her purse-strings.
How long has your wife been gone?
When did you last see Ninette?
About a month. I wasn't worried at first. She's run off before.
Ninette is uncontrollable, you see. She comes and goes as she pleases.
You're more concerned what her family thinks than what happened to her?
Don't you want her back?
So you'd leave her to die just to spite me?
If you reconsider, talk to Jethann at the Blooming Rose. Yes, Ninette visited whores.
Are you one of Yevhen's sons?
Mistress Hawke? Please help me!
Master Hawke? Please help me!
My brother... Merin... Iwan locked him in with the darkspawn!
He sealed the door... left me here and bolted for that passage. He's gone mad! All he cares about is that damned sword.
Is your brother insane or just cruel?
Do you think he's truly mad?
This is getting just a little too familiar, isn't it?
We should take that sword. This Iwan does not deserve it.
Maybe we should look for this sword. Sounds like you missed the best thing in here.
Please! I don't want my brother to be eaten by these monsters.
Another greedy dwarf. You think he took lessons from Bartrand?
How typical.
Wandering the Deep Roads by himself won't get him coin, it'll get him killed.
Your brother is an idiot.
We should try to save Merin. Poor lad deserves better than dying down here.
Well, Hawke? Which will it be—Merin or the sword?
We'll save your brother. Right? We're going to save him?
Go tell your father what happened. I'll do what I can for your brother.
I'll save Merin.
I'll do my best. Go back to your father, and I'll find you when I'm done.
I'll save Merin.
Get back to the surface. Looks like I have a date with the darkspawn.
I'll save Merin.
He's on the other side of that wall. You need to find a way to reach him.
Forget your brother. I want that sword.
I want the weapon.
Merin is certainly dead already. I'm going to stop Iwan from getting that sword.
I want the weapon.
Sorry, but my friend Sandal would never forgive me if I left here without a new sword for him to enchant.
I want the weapon.
You're going to let Merin die for your greed? You're as bad as Iwan!
Chest
You should talk to Jethann at the Blooming Rose.
I didn't know she visited whores. Until Jethann sent a letter. To our house! He even sent her flowers once. Lilies—her favorite.
I don't care about the sword. Please! Save my brother!
Ninette is going to ruin me.
I should've married a nice Free Marcher girl.
Bah! Women are more trouble than they're worth.
I'll try my best to find Ninette and bring her home.
I can help.
Merin became suspicious... and then Iwan sealed him in. Please! You can save him, right?
Even back home, what could I be? The lone blade in a house of mages? If I excelled, it brought too much attention.
By the Stone, I thought I was done for. Wait, you... you're Master Hawke! I can't believe it's you!
You know, I never realized what the dwarves in Orzammar are up against. They fight these monsters every day of their lives.
I don't think I can sit by and let my people die while I enjoy the easy life of a merchant. Not anymore.
I had no idea the Deep Roads would be like this. That the darkspawn would just be... everywhere.
Come find us when you return. I'm sure Father will want to thank you for saving me.
That was a waste, huh? Could have found my fortune if Bethany was going to die on your watch anyway.
What're you having? Edwina! Let's get a couple of drinks here!
Today's my rest day, but I'll make an exception for you.
Jethann? Have you seen Ninette lately?
Ninette? Not for several weeks, which is a shame. I enjoy her company.
I hear she finally left her worthless husband. Good for her. I just wish she'd said goodbye.
Did she tell you she left her husband?
You think she left Ghyslain?
No, I just hope that's what she did.
Ghyslain only wants her for her family's wealth.
Ninette's a jewel. Elegant, worldly, just the perfect level of depraved. Ghyslain doesn't deserve her.
Ghyslain knew about you and Ninette. Did he talk to you?
Has Ghyslain spoken to you?
We ended on a tense note last time. Take it as you will.
A peace offering.
I'm not holding you back with generosity. Just have a look.
Don't get suspicious.
We have something to talk about, but we'll do it back at the house.
I'm not stopping to talk out here. We'll get into it back at the house in Kirkwall.
If you have a plan, get to it.
I'm here, right behind you.
By all means, lead on.
I don't have to make shit up about you. The truth is much more entertaining. Not to mention incriminating.
The man is incapable of talking.
He came here, yelled at me, called me a dirty knife-ear—among other things—and accused me of corrupting his wife!
We had him thrown out.
Do you think Ninette has come to harm?
Could Ninette be in trouble?
I hope not! Everyone loves Ninette. Sometimes twice a night. Chuckles
Ghyslain's the only one who might hurt her. And he doesn't have the balls for it.
Do you have any idea where she might be?
Do you know anything else?
Were you hoping Ninette would leave Ghyslain for you?
You seem fond of Ninette.
So you don't actually know anything.
This was a waste of time.
Back to Gamlen's. It's not so bad when he's not here. Which is never.
What did you let them do? What did they do to me?
It's like I'm cold inside. Straight through. And I can hear... something.
Just get me down there, and I'll make sure we clean up.
Let's not waste time with more petty work. We have the money for the Deep Roads.
We're in it now. This all part of your plan?
Sure. Go. Make the family proud. I'll stay here, as ordered.
I can't see why a templar would be interested in anyone who isn't a mage.
Any chance Ninette's an apostate?
You sure she isn't a mage?
Anyway, if Ninette was a mage, I think Emeric would have said so.
Perhaps Emeric knows something we don't.
That was a great help.
Someone else Ninette spent special alone time with, perhaps?
Was Emeric Ninette's lover?
Maybe he has something useful to say.
I'll find Emeric.
Emeric said he'd continue his investigation in Darktown. You could see if he's still there.
And if you find Ninette, tell her to drop by and see me sometime.
I'm not spreading rumors. I'm just telling you which way the wind is blowing.
You're older than I thought you'd be. Ninette seems to go for the young, pointy-eared sorts.
I hear you were asking about Ninette de Carrac's whereabouts.
Just the person I was looking for. I need to speak with you about Ninette.
Doesn't the Circle use phylacteries to keep track of its mages?
Can't you track Mharen down?
We followed her phylactery to a foundry, but found nothing.
I had heard of sympathizers smuggling mages through Darktown, so came here hoping to pick up the trail.
But no trace of Mharen. And, as you've seen, asking the locals hasn't made me very popular.
People don't just disappear. Perhaps they were murdered or kidnapped.
Could they be dead?
We found no bodies, no ransom notes. Those women just vanished.
Can I assist your investigation?
Can I help at all?
Don't you hate it when something goes missing? I lose things all the time.
I hate trying to find things.
I don't like the sound of this.
This is suspicious.
Neither do I, serah, but I cannot carry on.
Here. Take my findings. Perhaps you can make more use of them. I'm going back to the Gallows. I'm too old for this.
These are human bones. Sighs Then there is no chance of finding Mharen alive—or any of the others.
I saw someone leaving the scene, but they got away. I'm sorry.
I did what I could.
It was more than I accomplished.
I will bring this to the city guard immediately.
If they're not dead, watch out for a bunch of boneless women flopping through the streets.
Yes, they're probably dead.
This isn't over. I'm going to get the bastard that did this.
The killer won't get away.
Is this Ninette's ring?
Look at the engraving. Forever faithful, forever yours. Sighs Written in happier times.
It was on Ninette's hand, which was cut from her body. She's dead.
On her severed hand.
On her... hand? I see. Well, maybe you should... take this back.
I don't want anything that might link me to her... death. Especially with her family asking questions.
Just know that she will not return.
It doesn't matter.
I'll send the ring to her family. With luck, it will appease them.
Thank you for all your help, serah. Maker watch over you.
We'll pull this off. Just you watch.
I'm with you. Trust in that.
Give them something to scare their grandkids with.
They don't know sacrifice.
The Maker is with us.
I don't know where I fit, but I am with you.
We can't just go back.
The templar who allowed Father to leave Kirkwall. Your namesake.
A templar?
Have we met a templar who isn't a colossal prig?
You're really going to look for a dark side to this?
More whining?
I should just embrace a stranger? How's that better than blindly honoring the Amells?
Father must have felt he was worth honoring.
Ser Maurevar was a good one.
A man who let him look ahead, and a name that would always mean skill thoughtfully applied.
Well, there you go then.
Then it suits you.
I'm sure someone thought far too long about my name. Point is, this was a swordsman.
A man who let him look ahead. It would always mean skill thoughtfully applied.
You're right, this is... it's something. I get it.
I don't know where to take it. But thank you.
For your service that cannot be admitted, I ask that you accept this trinket, and know that I shall respect your name.
Thank you, conscience of the order, Ser Maurevar... Carver.
Carver?
I want to be someone. Like Father wanted. Like I want. This is my chance.
Then let me tell you what really happened.
Reward Offered!

Citizens of Kirkwall:
My dear wife, Ninette, has gone missing! I shall reward the person who returns her safely.
Questions about the bounty or Ninette? Come speak to me in the Hightown Market.
—Ghyslain de Carrac
Why do you listen to this garbage? Do you just love gossip?
What do you get out of this?
I'm sure I can't be the only one mentioned in these rumors. What do they say about you?
Are you in these tales?
You had better not be spreading wild rumors about me.
Watch what you say.
I appreciate you keeping an ear to the ground for me.
That's reassuring.
It fills my heart with joy to know you're not telling people I'm sleeping with an ogre.
You're too kind.
This is, beyond a doubt, the most wretched place I've ever been. The sooner we get back to Kirkwall, the better.
What are we looking for again? Wood? In the wilderness? Sure, that shouldn't be a problem.
I don't know if that stuff we picked up is ironbark, but I bet that alchemist won't either. Let's go back to town.
I've got to say, Hawke, I don't trust any dwarf who'd come out here of his own volition.
If the Deep Roads is what you want, you have the coin to do it.
Captain.
Onions on my collar?
I don't know what you're talking about.
Renegade Templar
De Launcet Mansion
Renegade Templar
Hightown
I've lived all my life in Kirkwall, and until now, I've managed to avoid coming here. Wish I'd kept that up.
You know what I love about the Undercity? Absolutely nothing.
I don't know what the ancient Tevinters used this place for, but I bet it wasn't making people feel at home.
That foolish woman has caused me nothing but embarrassment. She needs to be dragged home.
It's her own doing, gallivanting about with men half her age.
Dog
They believe this is reason enough for me to hurt her. But I swear on Andraste's pyre: I have done nothing.
Hey Moe. I'm sitting on a chair!
Yeah, so what? I'm leaning on a wall.
Yeah, but sitting on a chair leaves my arms free to point at things.
I'm going to go home and cry.
If you can find Ninette, I will gladly pay you.
You don't even care if your wife's alive or dead. I'm not helping you.
You're vile. I won't help you.
I've always kind of liked this place. It's like a building full of sweet old grandmothers.
This place reminds me way too much of the Merchants Guild.
Ah, Hightown. Where the rich go to piss their money away. This really is the best place in Kirkwall.
Keep a hand on your coin, Hawke. There are more cutpurses in Hightown than in the rest of the city combined.
Maybe I should have seen this coming. Iwan has been obsessed with that thing.
Back to the barracks. I never tire of it.
It's different here as captain. Feels like... family.
Still having trouble? I thought you were past all that.
You're not happy as a guard?

Bartrand is my only option.
Bust some teeth, then buy the drinks. It worked here, but guards can be strange like that.
It's pretty here at night. Once the nobles are out of the way, you can really admire the scenery.
This is the best tavern in Kirkwall. It could use some cute dwarven serving girls, but otherwise, it's perfect.
You want a pint while we're here, Hawke? I'll buy.
Despite the name, Lowtown's not so bad. Just... more likely to be destroyed by tidal waves than Hightown.
A lot of people are afraid to come here at night. I don't know why. The thieves will still shoot you in daylight.
Bartrand likes to make me deal with the harbormaster. That man always smells like cod liver oil.
Have I mentioned that dwarves are lousy swimmers? Just... keep that in mind before you talk to any drunk sailors.
You mind stopping by the Hanged Man, Hawke? I think we should talk over a pint.
Story time, Hawke! What do you say we head over to the Hanged Man?
If you've got a minute, Hawke, maybe we could go to the Hanged Man and chat.
When we get back to the city, we should talk. Let's go to the Hanged Man. I'll buy you a drink.
Hawke... no. Let's save this for when we get back. We'll go to the Hanged Man and talk.
By the Stone, I thought I was done for. Wait, you... you're Mistress Hawke! I can't believe it's you!
I've heard the stories, but it's not the same as actually being down here.
Heh, let me try that on the dwarf. Just to see his face.
You have a unique charm, Aveline. I doubt the same would work on the dwarf.
You and your subtle charms.
Trying that on Bartrand would be very funny for a very short period of time.
Tempting, but I doubt Bartrand would respond well.
A tactic with a narrow appeal, certainly.
Sounds like fun. Not for the dwarf, but still.
A person in your position, seems like they might learn some profitable things.
Eavesdrop anything useful?
Iwan is probably dead by now. It's what he deserves.
I doubt it.
Yes, but it gives me no satisfaction to know he dug his own grave.
From what I've heard, he's just as nasty as the darkspawn. Maybe they'll crown him their new king.
I'm sure he'll be fine.
Let's get you out of here before the darkspawn return.
You need to get to safety.
Lately, I don't know. I've been pushed out to some dead patrols. Maybe I stepped on someone's toes.
You know better than to ask that.
One day you'll be frustrated enough to go for it.
We're surrounded by nothing for as far as the eye can see. Why do we keep coming here?
This place gives me the creeps. It's probably the name. They should call it the pie fields. Everyone likes pie.
This is some of the most expensive real estate in Kirkwall. Usually paid for in body parts.
How many servants do you think it takes to clean the rafters in this place?
I couldn't bring back your wife, but here's a ring. It looks pricey.
This ring is all I have to return to you. I'm sorry.
You know, I think the Chant of Light would be more popular if it had more battles in it. Just a hunch.
I don't know how they do it where you're from, Guardswoman, but I decide the patrols, not you and your whims!
You may have been put up for lieutenant in your first year, but I'll have no show-offs in my command! Have I made myself clear?
Report to your post, before I have you and your Fereldan accomplice jailed!
Don't look, but I think that whore's making eyes at you.
Ah... Ninette's wedding ring. Yes.
Where did you find it?
We'll accept your help.
We'll accept your help.
We'll accept your help.
We'll accept your help.
We'll accept your help.
We'll accept your help.

Don't make eye contact with the dwarf merchants here. I've skipped the last five guild meetings.
Let's find Hadriana quickly and be done with it.
You intend to bring us to Hadriana soon, I hope.
Welcome to my home.
I wonder how long I will be allowed to remain here?
I would offer you something to drink, but the kitchen is remarkably bare.
Good. Privacy at last.
I live here, you know.
Then I stand corrected.
And that's just on the good menu.
And you keep a room here?
Not all of us can squat in the lap of luxury. Not without tipping, anyway.
And this is one of the better taverns around here.
Do you like anything?
I like quiet.
It's early, yet.
Excellent point.
I didn't think you'd come!
I'll find something relatively clean for you to sit on.
Grunts They're going to blame me, I just know it.
You took more than I thought you would.
It's not the first time he's made me wonder like this. Something is very wrong.
I don't have time for politics in the guard.
Not my problem.
Then we should check the duty roster, and see who was supposed to take that route.
What have I stepped in this time?
Threaten my friends... not letting that one go, Captain.
Sighs It's better this way. Our marriage has been in shambles for more than a decade.
Can I get you something to eat or drink? I have... water.
I wouldn't even drink the water from this part of the city.
Not even on a dare.
I came here to see you, Merrill. You don't have to fuss over me.
Relax.
It's... cozy. And your furry friends are charming.
Lovely place you have here.
Of course. I can't thank you enough for coming when you did, messere.
Oh! You're here! After what you said, I thought...
I boil it first. A few times, actually. Sometimes, it won't stop twitching.
You're so kind. My first guest, and I'm already a terrible host.
Oh, are the rats back? I thought I found all their holes.
I can't believe Iwan is gone.
Why would it matter which guard killed those bandits?
A lot of yelling for doing him a favor.
We killed a band of highwaymen. What does it matter whose patrol it was?
Well, what a charming fellow.
I don't have to like him, but he could at least listen. Bandits are dead—that's all that should matter.
So let's find out whose toes you actually stepped on.
Well, whose patrol was it?
This is probably a bad time to discuss my bill with him.
So I'm not getting paid.
He'll jail you, I don't doubt that. The rest, though...
What can I say? Why work if you're not working hard?
I don't want to hire you. I'm here about Ninette.
It's not your headache. You've got an expedition to float, I know.
May as well check the roster to see if I'll have time to help you. I'll bet I'm off patrols for a while.
Well, the duty roster will have my next patrol. Sounds like I'll have plenty of time to follow you around.
Beggar
I wanted to thank you for bringing me here, but I'm making a mess of it.
Spare some change?
About your brother... oh, Hawke, I'm so sorry.
What do you say we head to the Hanged Man for a bit?
We should talk. Come on, I'll buy you a drink.
Time for a story, Hawke! What do you say we head over to the Hanged Man for a bit?
When we get back to the city, we should talk.
I've heard the nobles grousing about the commoners moving up. Congratulations, Hawke! You ruined the neighborhood!
If you want a drink, order it from Corff. In three years, Norah has never gotten my order right.
Huh, must be a slow night.
I can see why Ninette liked you. You're feisty.
Chuckles A refreshing change from the pale slug I married.
One of my favorites.
Lowtown never changes. Except for adding a bunch of horned giants, I mean.
You know who I don't want to meet in a Lowtown alley at night? Pretty much anyone.
What is that smell? Why does this place always smell?
This place rivals the Undercity for worst part of Kirkwall.
The roster's not for commoner eyes, friend.
Aveline!
Brennan, that route was yours?
It was. Single patrol. I'd have been dead for sure.
A guard can't handle a few bandits?
Scared?
I don't like surprises. That route had been clear for weeks.
So there was nothing unusual about it at all?
It was routine?
It had been clear for weeks. It didn't get unusual until after we heard about you and Aveline.
A lone guard isn't much of a patrol.
You would have been alone?
Shouldn't need to be. That route was clear for weeks. First noise out of it was your big fight.
The captain reassigned me after he heard what you did, and I passed the satchel to Donnic for his patrol tonight.
The satchel?
Pay and order assignments. Captain has us run deliveries to the outposts during light duty.
It's usually just an updated copy of the roster. The satchel for that night was heavy, though.
Agreggio Pavali. There are six bottles in the cellar.
Danarius used to have me pour it for his guests. My appearance intimidated them, he said, which he enjoyed.
I can't imagine why they would be put off.
I like your appearance.
You say what's on your mind, I'll give you that.
I'll take that as a compliment.
So they were frightened of you?
Intimidated them?
None of his guests were like you.
You were his servant as well as his bodyguard?
He sounds like a terrible man.
I was his slave. I propped up the furniture, when he was so inclined.
Nothing like a bit of fear with your wine.
Quite the host.
That's what Danarius used to say.
It's good I can still take pleasure in the small things.
You've had a difficult life.
This can't be easy.
Is getting back at your master all that matters to you?
You want revenge?
You could have offered me a glass first, you know.
That was a waste.
I owe you for clearing that ambush the other night. Saved me a mess of trouble.
Anyway, thanks again, Aveline. You're a good one.
So the satchel gets heavy the same day we discover an ambush.
Can't any group in this city stand on its own?
I'm saving city guards now?
A messy way to pass information, and Brennan already sent it along.
A setup to deliver the satchel.
I bet there's a perfectly reasonable lie that explains why your captain arranged this.
Your fellows are being set up.
We do just fine, thank you. But if our own captain is putting us in danger...
Another guard is walking into the same trap. I can't let that happen.
Brennan said Donnic... a good man. Donnic... Donnic. I've got his route.
I have to check this, Hawke. These men, they're like you. Like family.
Let's go make sure his quiet patrol stays that way.
I'd be willing to hear it, but not while a guard may be walking into a trap.
You're sure you want to pursue this? This is your superior we're talking about.
This may get you more trouble.
If a guard has been put at risk, a good captain would want to know why.
And if he's not a good captain, I want to know why.
He was supposed to be alone! Get them!
Who... Ave... Aveline? You're a beautiful sight.
Guardsman?
I mean, I was on patrol, and they came out of nowhere. I took a few down but there were too many at once.
The captain said this route was supposed to be quiet.

Laughs
I've wanted to leave my past behind me. But it won't stay there.
Tell me, have you never wanted to return to Ferelden?
I grew up in Ferelden. It will always be my home.
I've thought about it.
I've started a life here.
This is my home now.
I have no home left to return to.
Lothering is gone.
The Blight is over. You could rebuild what you lost. Do you truly not want to?
My mother came from Kirkwall. Our heritage is here.
My family is here.
Even if I wanted to, Kirkwall is my home now.
I have a new life.
Having a place where you can put down roots. I understand.
I have to admit, it's an attractive idea.
Maybe someday.
But not now. I understand.
Still, to have the option... must be gratifying.
I'm glad to be out of Ferelden.
Never.
And that's it? You leave it behind so easily?
I lost my brother to the Blight.
It wasn't easy.
And now he no longer matters to you?
I lost my sister to the Blight.
It wasn't easy.
And now she no longer matters to you?
You survive and you move on. What else do you want?
That's right.
Something different. So should you.
We fled the Blight and did what we could. Would you have done differently?
You wouldn't?
No. That is, in fact, exactly what I have done.
I apologize. Your life is your own, it simply... sounds very familiar.
Do you intend to keep living here?
You're staying in Kirkwall?
You've been on the run a long time, then?
How long since you escaped?
You could track your former master down, I assume.
Where is Danarius now?
You could make a home here.
Don't leave, then. Stay.
If you're looking to start a life, you could stay.
Maybe it's just me, but it sounds like you want to stick around.
I could see myself staying—for the right reasons.
We shall see.
You whine too much.
Are you finished complaining yet?
I am now.
You know, you could stop dwelling on the past.
I could.
Don't you have anything positive to say?
The wine was tasty?
Sounds like a tough situation.
I'm sorry.
I am not made of glass.
I should thank you again for helping me against the hunters.
Had I known Anso would find me a woman so capable, I might have asked him to look sooner.
Had I known Anso would find me a man so capable, I might have asked him to look sooner.
Had I known the result would be meeting someone worthy of respect, I would have opted for Anso's plan sooner.

So to a warehouse now.

And to a warehouse now... to search for crates?

You'll see him again.
You'll see her again.
I did all I could. Nothing to do now but wait.
We'll see.

I hope so.

I'm more afraid of my mother.

If this elf never returned, how do you know the Wardens' cure worked?
How do you know?
I wish there was more I could do.
I'm certain that everything will turn out well.
Oh, she will be so upset! Not that it's your fault! And... I'm not helping, am I?
It's like I'm sitting on my hands. There are dangerous people in this city.
In fact, I might have a job for you. Let me know if you want to do a favor for Kirkwall.
Otherwise, I'm here if you need me. Maker knows I could use more satisfying work.
All right, Aveline. You have something worth doing?
What's the job?
Seems like Kirkwall suits you.
Are you happy here?
Take care, Aveline.
Goodbye.
Watch out for yourself, Hawke.
You must have heard the story: A Dalish Grey Warden led an army against the Archdemon at Denerim. That was him.
She became a great hero. She led an army against the Blight and won. You must have heard the tale.
Of course not! I know my place. I offer a service, that's all.
My patrols may be empty walks in the dark, but there's something big coming up, and I could use you.
An ambush. Probably for a caravan, although I can't find any shipments that match up.
Doesn't matter, though. Highwaymen waiting for someone to rob? I'm putting a stop to it, my district or not.
I'm no guard, Aveline.
You can hire civilians?
Do you have a name or anything else to go on?
Who are we up against?
Seems like you'd want to share this with your fellow guards.
Why not tell the other guards?
Aveline, you've got yourself a partner.
Let's do it.
Not interested in doing someone else's job for them.
Get a guard to do it.
She always liked men in uniform. You could ask him, yourself.
I told you what I know. Sorry it wasn't what you wanted.
Not important. If we show up and they attack, they're bad, simple as that.
I knew I could count on you.
They're hidden up Sundermount. Remote and rough, but we can make good time with a shortcut this side.
And no, you can't run off and do it without me. I trust you, but I have to be there.
You're acting on behalf of the guard.
It won't wait forever, Hawke. This group is out to hurt someone, and I can't let that happen.
So, what can I do for you?
Maker knows I'm none too busy. If there's something you need, I'm with you.
You had something you thought I would be interested in?
About that job.
The ambush, yes. Sundermount, when you're ready. I'll give more when we get there.
You have the details. Highwaymen. I want to clear them before anyone gets hurt.
Still hard at work trying to please adopted Kirkwall?
Anything new?
My clan has heard nothing from him since then.
He died in the battle.
My clan hasn't heard from her since the battle.
She died fighting the Archdemon.
It's not in my district, but I can't let that stop me.
Not very encouraging, I suppose. Forget I mentioned it. Everything will be fine.
If there's anything I can do, like... not talking anymore, I'll do it.
Carver will be missed.
The blight sickness is terrible. At least he didn't suffer.
You did all you could for him.
Bethany was such a sweet girl.
The corruption is a horrible disease. At least she didn't suffer.
You did everything you could for her.
Better not to dwell on it.
I know.
This isn't easy for me. I appreciate that you're trying to help.
Thank you, Merrill.
The hardest part is still coming. I haven't given my mother the news yet.
I still have to tell Mother.
I will, if you sit on your hands. I'll send my alerts, and someone else will lead a patrol.
I just thought you'd like official sanction to cause trouble for once.
You're right.
I wish I could do more.
Elgar'nan! She will be devastated! Er... I'm not helping, am I? Shut up, Merrill.
This city is amazing! Do you know, I saw someone get mugged? Right outside! It was fascinating!
Everything happens here all at once! How does anyone keep it all straight?
People don't pay attention, usually.
By ignoring most of it.
You get used to it eventually.
A lot of practice.
I don't think anyone does. Except Varric. And he's probably full of it.
They don't.
There's only so many of us. Temporary recruits are expected, time to time. As long as they're competent.
You still claim to be competent, right?
I'll wager it's smugglers, though. Like I said, seems like an obvious trap for a caravan.
Someone is jumped outside your door and that's exciting?
Muggings are fascinating?
I can't even imagine how you'd do that.
If not, I suppose you end up like me: walking into walls and signposts, utterly distracted.
Really? Isn't that... sad?
It must be the alienage greeting. Hasn't happened to me yet, though. They must not like me.
You can be... forceful.
My charm, right? I should be able to go where I'm needed.
It's so busy here. So many things just get... lost.
Back again? Sure you're not interested in my many, many services?
I was just passing through.
I'm sure.
I'm sorry to say that Ninette was killed.
Ninette's dead.
Killed? Why would anyone hurt that darling woman?
This is horrible. Thank you for letting me know. Please... please excuse me.
I have coin in my purse and time to spare. Why not?
Perhaps I am.
Have it your way.
Ah... Ghyslain de Carrac's wife. Her disappearance interested me. I tried looking into it.
However, the investigation has been a waste of time.
How could you do that to me? How could you steal a priceless relic of my people?
May the Dread Wolf take you, you worthless hunk of glass!
It won't work! All the years I've wasted on it, and it's still a flaming mirror with no reflection!
I haven't decided. For now it's as good as any other place.
I would return to Seheron if I could, but... there is no life for me there.
Is that where you're from?
Seheron?
So I've been told.
Were you very young when you left, then?
You don't remember?
Perhaps.
Three years, now.
Danarius has a way of finding me—perhaps it is the markings? Whatever the means, it never takes him long to follow.
This is the first time I've given him reason to pause. I suppose there are advantages in numbers.
Haven't you sought help before?
You've been alone?
Hirelings, when I could steal the coin. Never anyone of substance—until you.
Danarius will not give up, however. I await his return.
What if he does give up? What then?
Are you sure?
Then I go to him. I will not live with a wolf at my back.
Sounds like the right idea to me.
Good plan.
If it comes to that. I doubt it will.
You won't let sleeping dogs lie?
Why bother?
No. I am no fool.
I imagine he has returned to Minrathous, though I dare not go near the city while he is alive.
No, it is better to wait for him to leave his fortress. Fight from a fortified position.
I do not expect your help when that day comes, but I would not turn it aside.
I take my debt to you seriously. I want you to know that.
Flatterer.
Talk is cheap.
Is that so?
Maybe I should be thanking Anso.
Maybe you should.
You sound like you're about to ask for a loan.
Well, this mansion does require some upkeep.
Perhaps I'll practice my flattery for your next visit? With any luck I'll become better at it.
Not interested.
Back off.
Let's keep this friendly, shall we?
I'm positive capable is all he was looking for.
Of course. I meant nothing by it.
It turned out well enough.
Happy to help.
It did at that.
I will not keep you longer. Another time, perhaps.
It has been a challenge. Lots of opportunity... if you're the type the locals want.
Hawke... sighs This is awkward.
Listen, Hawke...
Whatever it is, just say it.
Spit it out.
You have no sense for the dramatic.
Whatever it is, I'll hear you out, Varric.
Take your time.

You? At a loss for words? I should mark this day on my calendar.
You're struck speechless?

What did you call me?

That's... kind of you.
If I'm the sick bronto, I guess that makes you the bronto-charmer.
Thanks a lot, Varric.
Enjoy this while it lasts. It might never happen again.
Where does your fascination with tall tales come from?
Why do you tell stories?

You should know by now that I love the sound of my own voice, Hawke.
I try to keep myself out of the public eye.
Of course not! Not wild ones, at least. I only spread those about Daisy.
I like to think I provide a useful service.
Blondie is hardly an ogre! He's too puny.
Don't call Daisy an ogre! You'll make her cry.
If the Rivaini were an ogre... damnation, that'd be one hot ogre.
Don't compare the Tevinter elf to an ogre, Hawke. Ogres have a sense of humor.
See? It's details like this that keep me hanging around with you, Hawke!
Who's in business with who... who's in bed with who.

Feeling homesick?
The templars haven't found you, have they?
Have the templars spotted you?

That's not always bad.

Like you?

It's like a treasure hunt!
...don't come running to me next time you pick up one of these diseases.

And that will, ah, stop the itch?

Sister.
Brother.

That's not always bad.

A bit. But... I'll adjust.
Laughs I think they mostly drop garbage.

What?

I appreciate your assistance.

Three years.

This is his mansion, isn't it? He must know you're here.
Are you sure?
Would you be surprised to learn that it isn't, in fact, his mansion?
It belongs to a Tevinter merchant, one who has evidently given up on the place. Perhaps he is dead. Perhaps Danarius killed him.

Then this is the perfect time to track him down.
Go after him.

Isn't this what you wanted?

Yes, but...
Don't tell me you're going to miss all the attention.
Disappointed?

You take a breath and look around. And start anew.
I don't know how.
Do you really not know?
An odd question.
You weren't always a slave, were you?
Do what you did before.

I shouldn't trouble you with this. My problems are not yours.
You don't know who you were?
You really don't remember?
Fenris was the name Danarius bestowed upon me, his little wolf.
If I once had another name, or a family... then they were taken from me.
But, again, this is not your concern.
Your problems are my problems.
You're my friend.
Unlucky you.
You help me, I help you.
You're my teammate.
I don't need your help.
Let's keep it that way.
That's true.
Then we needn't discuss it further.
We can talk about this, Fenris.
I can help you.
Maybe another time.
I doubt it.
But enough. You have much to keep you busy, I'm certain.
Busy doesn't mean bad.
Busy doesn't mean bad.
They're not like you?
Besides, I can never pass up the opportunity to fill someone's head with garbage.
I pray that Mharen is safe. The templars would like to see her back where she belongs.
Please talk to me if you discover anything. Anything at all.
I hope my notes were useful.
Recognize your mage?
What?

Look what I found.
You might want to see this.
Show some respect!

Inattention is good.
Inattention is good.

We have to report this.

A severed hand, a ring, and a pile of bones.

We're not speaking.

He seems to be fine.

He's not into happiness.
I haven't heard from her.
I don't know.
Our mother checks on her frequently. She seems to be adjusting.
She seems to be fine.
She always did love being constantly watched by large, armed men.
She's having a wonderful time.
More mages. You talk—I'm going to ask the guards about their training.
Hunters.
Stop right there!

He's not a slave!
Die, slaver!
You should have attacked while you had the chance!
I won't let you take him!

Let's work out a deal!

We can negotiate!

Main Plot
Speak to Merrill at her home in Lowtown's alienage.
Finally convinced that she was wrong, Merrill smashed the mirror.
Merrill has given up the idea of saving her people. She intends to complete the mirror for its own sake.
Why trouble yourself over him?
Why so concerned?
I know how hard it is to give up everything and live among strangers.
I thought you and Bethany didn't get along. Why are you worrying over her?
Why so concerned?
I'd be terrified, in her shoes. Surrounded by strangers. Watched all the time...
She's strong. If anyone can get through this, she can.
I worry about him. And not just for his sake...
I know he was angry when he left. But this... wasn't your fault.
One day, he'll understand you were trying to protect him.
We didn't always agree, but she's a sweet girl. I would never wish that fate on anyone.
I wonder how it compares to yours.
I needn't tell his own child how special he was. As to the letter, it pained me to send news of the templar's death.
I have business to attend. Business you're too good to be a part of.
They're on to us, boys.
Let's make sure this don't go any further.
He'll die of old age before he admits I did anything right.
I wouldn't count on it.
Maybe with time, he'll forgive me.
I hope you're right.
I can see it now—the apostate and the templar running from opposite ends of the Gallows to embrace each other.
That will be a touching scene.
Don't blame yourself.
I know it's not my fault. It's the templars who hauled her away.
I blame the templars.
If I'd gotten home sooner, she might still be free.
I should have been there.
Someone's got to blame me. Other than my mother, I mean.
If I don't, who will?
Even if— Well, I just want to make sure they know I didn't do it!
