Yes, and it's... a real nice night for an evening.
Uh, as you say, Captain.
I... you go first. I'll be right there. Just... don't tell him this is about me!
There were supposed to be others coming, right?
Right. Look, I should really...
I mean, how sad would it be if you needed a go-between? Have some backbone.
All this playing shy business? I like a little backbone.
You and I don't always see eye to eye, but that doesn't mean you deserved my anger. I owe you an apology.
I had no idea where you went, I was concerned.
I was worried about you.
I needed to be alone.
That's it? Just an apology?
You were out of line.
If you wish, I can go. You need not see me again.
That's not necessary.
No.
I'm relieved.
I think it's time we parted ways.
Yes.
Ah. I hoped it wouldn't come to this.
Perhaps you're right.
May fortune continue to smile on you, Hawke.
All I want is to know what happened in there.
I want an explanation.
There's no need to apologize.
I understand.
People take their frustrations out on me all the time.
That's what I'm here for.
You are generous.
When I was still a slave, Hadriana was a torment. She would ridicule me, deny my meals, hound my sleep.
Because of her status, I was powerless to respond and she knew it.
The thought of her slipping out of my grasp now... I couldn't let her go. I wanted to, but I couldn't.
That's more important than your promise?
You gave your word.
It's not easy to discover your principles are less noble than you believed.
I'm glad you killed her, then.
She deserved to die.
I should be happy now that Hadriana is dead. Instead, I feel nothing but... disquiet.
What do you mean?
You wanted to?
This hate... I thought I'd gotten away from it. But it dogs me no matter where I go.
To feel it again, to know it was they who planted it inside me... it was too much to bear.
But I didn't come here to burden you further.
You don't need to leave, Fenris.
Don't go.
It's not a burden.
We're friends, Fenris.
I'm not certain I know what that is.
I can help you.
I don't think anyone can help me.
We'll talk again some other time.
Maybe you should go.
An excellent idea.
Your need for revenge is consuming you.
You need to let your past go.
Admit it. You just wanted to kill her.
You're making excuses.
You clearly weren't thinking about finding your family when you did it.
What about your sister?
And what would you have me do?
Hadriana came after me! I have never had the option to simply walk away.
Am I supposed to forgive, no matter how many times they hunt me down? Am I supposed to forget all the things they've done to me?
You may not wear chains anymore, but you're not free.
You're still a slave.
You know nothing of being a slave!
If you're wondering why you can't move on, this is it.
It's eating you up, Fenris.
Yes, this is it! Why can I not grasp something so simple?
They say amnesia is a friend to the tormented.
Sounds like a plan.
A friend! I don't have any friends!
It's a sickness, this hate. This dark growth inside me that I can't ever get rid of, and they put it there!
Sighs This... isn't why I came here.
You don't need to leave, Fenris.
Don't go.
I think it would be best for both of us if I did.
So you're just going to leave?
Is that it?
I'm trying to help you.
Just think about what I've said.
You can't do this alone, Fenris.
Stop being so bloody stubborn.
Easier said than done.
You need to cool down.
Maybe you should go.
No doubt you are right.
Are you going to use the information Hadriana gave you?
What about your family?
I don't know yet. I will have to think on it.
You change your mind about helping the werewolves? Without help, they'll all go wild.
You dare ask for more help?
You've done more for me than I have any right to expect. But I don't even know what some of the things on this list are.
If I were the Keeper, you wouldn't even have that list. Your family murdered Zathrian and his entire tribe.
They weren't themselves. They were cursed. And each day more lose themselves to the beast.
Sorry to interrupt.
I'll just leave.
What's this about curses? And beasts?
What are you talking about?
This shemlen speaks for the werewolves of the Brecilian Forest. She represents murderers!
And saviors, too. They fought at the Battle of Denerim with the Hero of Ferelden.
But now they're losing hold of their senses. Even the Lady of the Forest is growing wild.
If you don't help soon, they'll be nothing but monsters. And then, then you'll see murders.
We are done.
You've come a long way to help werewolves. You're not one of them, are you?
Why help werewolves?
Me? No. But my cousin Jasiah is.
He was missing for years. We thought he was dead. But he came back after the Blight.
He was a hero, of sorts. But now... he's slowly losing his mind.
The Dalish said the werewolves killed Zathrian. And his entire tribe.
Werewolves murdered Dalish?
We heard a Dalish tribe was killed in the forest. I didn't know werewolves did that until I came here.
Keeper Marethari told me. She said Zathrian was at fault, too. That's all I know.
If I can help keep the werewolves from turning to beasts, I will.
Tell me how I can help.
Thank you. The curse can't be broken, but it can be slowed.
The Keeper gave me a list of ingredients, but some will be difficult and dangerous to find.
Please, help me find them.
Even if I could, I'm not sure I'd want to help werewolves.
I'm not getting involved.
I found all the ingredients, Clara.
I knew you'd come through! Take this.
I need to go. Before it's too late!
The Dalish won't help find the ingredients. There's only you.
If you change your mind...

Clara went to the Dalish elves in Sundermount to find a cure for the werewolves in the Brecilian Forest. She needs: an alchemically sealed flask, purified deathroot, twice-distilled quicksilver, and ebon rathleek (a rare poison).

Some of the ingredients to help with Clara's werewolf curse are acquired, but more remain to be found. She needs: an alchemically sealed flask, purified deathroot, twice-distilled quicksilver, and ebon rathleek (a rare poison).
All of the ingredients needed to help cure the werewolf curse are acquired. Go back to the Dalish elf camp in Sundermount and talk with Clara.
Clara provided a reward for finding the ingredients to help with the werewolf curse. Hopefully some lives will be saved.

Guardsman Donnic. You're free for an evening?

In the Fade, there is no time. Emotion rules everything. Justice doesn't know how to sit idle until the right moment to strike.

You chose to merge with him. Only you can make it work.
You have to control it.
I am trying.
I have not attacked the templars openly. I've helped the mages here as best I can. But this impasse cannot last.
There will be more violence. I know that. If you tie yourself to me, I'll only hurt you.
What's the worst that can happen? You turn into an abomination and start... never mind. Bad joke.
It'll be fine.
My control is fraying. I cannot hold back Justice—or whatever creature he has become—much longer.
You may split hairs over what sort of spirit lives in you. But it seems more demonic every day.
You are an abomination.
Justice is no demon! He is an ideal that men have striven to reach and never managed.
Just being with me puts you at risk.
The knight-commander has declared supporting apostates a hanging offense. The thought of them hurting you...
You're at as much risk as I am.
That's what I worry. What if your money and position aren't enough? What if the knight-commander turns on you?
Everything I've done to control this... I don't care. I would drown us in blood to keep you safe.
I don't want to see you lose yourself... to the templars or Justice.
Stay in control.
You don't think we should start with flowers... jewelry?
You're so romantic.
I won't lose you to this.
Don't risk yourself.
This is your fight, too.
The world needs to see men like you. Who do not fear to stand openly at a mage's side.
This is Justice talking, not you.
You're losing control.
We are the same. It is my passion for this cause that drives him.
I will not give up this fight, Hawke. Know this now.
We have toed the line for a thousand years. We have given up our families, any chance for children, any chance for love.
And yet they fear us all the more. We can win no ground with appeasement.
One day everyone in Kirkwall will have to choose a side.
Why have you come? Is it time for another lecture about how reckless I'm being?
Why have you come here? Did the Keeper put you up to this?
How much is left if you strip both those out?
I'm sorry. I can't be anyone but who I am.
If that's the man you're looking for, you're in the wrong place.
Nothing would hurt as much as losing you.
I can't let you go.
You don't want to do this. I have no control around you.
You keep saying that. You haven't yet.
Promises, promises.
You could have a normal life. You don't want to be with an apostate.
I never thought I'd meet another mage like you. Another apostate.
Don't tempt me. Not unless you're ready for what that means.
You're getting in too deep here and I can't follow.
You're right.
It's better this way.
One day, the world must see us as people, not just mages. Help me make that happen.
Jethann, an elf in the Blooming Rose, might know more about Ninette. The Hightown brothel is open at night.
Good, I suppose?
Doesn't matter. Free for an evening?
I have no immediate patrols. Why?
Never mind. Free drinks at the Hanged Man. Be there.

All right... the Hanged Man it is.
It's nothing to be concerned about. Meet me at the Hanged Man.

Maybe.

The Keeper isn't involved.
I know you're angry with me, but I'm doing this for your sake.
I'm here for you.

She pays by the lecture.
Trash. Trash. Keep. Trash. Trash...
Won't be needing that anymore...

Anders, calm down.
Throwing everything out isn't going to make you feel better.
Anders, calm down.

Should I feel better?

I murdered a girl! A mage! The very person I've dedicated my life to saving!

I am a monster. Everything I ever do will be stained by this.
Should I have heard of this? Very well, Serah Hawke, I guess I'll be there.
Ah, you must be Hawke. Thank you for coming on such short notice.

I can't believe you're joking about this!

I will not put myself in that position again.
You were out of control.
It wasn't your fault.

Give up this fight.

I don't know how.

Find a peaceful way.

All right, I get it already.

Stay with me.

Stay with me.

Do you think we could stop by my house in the alienage? There's something I ought to show you.

Orders are clear. No witnesses.
It's a trap!
No! Please, messere...
No... Oh, Maker, please... Forgive me.
They will die! I will have every last templar for these abuses!
It's over, Anders. They're all dead.
Calm down.
The templars are gone. You can stop glowing.
What's wrong with you?
We'll kill them all. I promise.
They will die.
Every one of them will feel justice's burn.
I am no demon! Are you one of them, that you would call me such!
No! Andraste, please, take it away. I've been good. I've served the Chantry—
Silence!
Anders, that girl is a mage. We rescued her from being made Tranquil.
Don't hurt her!
She is theirs! I can feel their hold on her!
She's the reason you're fighting, Anders. Don't turn on her now.
You are here under my command! Not another step!
Back down, Anders!
Justice... answers to nobody!
This is not the way to do it. Save your fire for the templars!
Please, messere...
Maker, no. I almost... If you weren't here...
You're out of control, Anders!
Get a hold of yourself!
I thought you told me you were a good spirit?
This is Justice?
Get over yourself and let's finish this.
Are you done?
I will have my vengeance!
Lyrium smugglers built these tunnels. To service the templars who crave the stuff.
I have personally led five mages to freedom through these tunnels. They bent to kiss the ground through the sewage.
It tells you something of Kirkwall's attitude, that they house their mages in an old slave prison.
The templars are despicable. They fear to fight us, so they destroy our minds instead.
It would be better as open warfare. At least then mages might get a fair fight.
If we find evidence of Ser Alrik's plan, I'm taking it straight to the grand cleric.
She will not be able to claim neutrality then.
This is it. This tunnel will take us into the Gallows.
Are you ready to help me find evidence of the Tranquil Solution?
Let's go.
Yes.
Just tap the stone here...
I'll be back when I'm ready.
Not yet.
We should go before Ser Alrik puts it into action.
I'll be waiting.
Have you noticed how many Tranquil are in the Gallows courtyard lately?
And don't tell me I'm just sensitive to it. I've been watching and every day there are new Tranquil, selling their bloody wares.
Good mages, too. People I know passed their Harrowing.
Doesn't Chantry law say that mages who pass their Harrowing can't be made Tranquil?
That's against the law.
Exactly.
Are you imagining some sinister plot to turn all the mages in Kirkwall Tranquil?
You think there's a plan?
I'm not imagining it.
What's it to you how many Tranquil there are?
So what?
The templars are using the Rite of Tranquility to silence those who speak against them.
They're working on a deliberate plan to turn every mage in Kirkwall within the next three years.
Whatever you think of templars, you can't imagine they're so heartless—
They wouldn't do that.
They're worse.
And here I was worried you were having delusions of persecution again.
You're crazy.
There are groups in Kirkwall who help those fleeing the Circle. I've talked to people on the inside.
Who's behind this?
We must stop them.
The plan is the work of a templar named Ser Alrik.
I've had a run-in with him myself. He's the one who did the ritual on Karl. Nasty piece of work, likes to make mages beg.
What happened between you and Ser Alrik?
A run-in?
I've been involved with an... underground resistance. Mages, living free in Kirkwall, who help others escape.
I can't tell you any more, for your sake and theirs. You have too much involvement with the Guard and nobility.
Suffice it to say, I've been in the Gallows. I've seen his work firsthand.
What else do you know about Ser Alrik?
Tell me about this templar.
The knight-commander is at least sincere in her convictions. However misguided, she believes she's helping people.
Ser Alrik's a sadist. Cold-blooded as a lizard.
He likes to experiment on mages, find out what it takes to push them into the arms of demons.
Then perhaps the blame can be laid on him, and not every templar?
Not all templars are that bad.
That's what I hope. If we bring the evidence of this plan to light, there must be men who'll stand against it.
Perhaps even the grand cleric will finally be forced to act.
Don't templars have anything better to do than come up with new ways to torment mages?
What are they, bored?
No.
How do we stop them?
Do you have a plan?
I've been working with a group, a secret mage underground that helps others escape the Gallows. They have a way in.
My friends in the mage underground know a way inside.
A secret entrance under the walls of the Gallows.
Come with me, tonight, please. Help me find the evidence of Ser Alrik's Tranquil Solution.
What do you mean, Tranquil Solution?
Tranquil solution?
That's what he calls it. His idea of a peaceful solution to the mage problem—to sunder the mind of every mage in the Free Marches!
I'm told he's bringing his proposal to Val Royeaux, to the Divine herself.
He would turn every mage in Thedas into a drooling simpleton under his command!
If this plot exists, it must be exposed.
Of course, I'll help.
I'll be there. Though this Ser Alrik would be a fool to keep such a plan in writing.
Of course, I'll help.
Then let us pray he's a fool as well as a bastard.
Let us go before they can act.
Of course, I'll help.
Thank you. I confess, I wasn't sure you'd share my outrage. I'm glad I can count on this much.
I am honored by your trust.
I wouldn't let you face this alone.
Of course, I'll help.
You are the one bright light in Kirkwall.
I've always feared being made Tranquil. Now more than ever.
I couldn't live to see you Tranquil at that monster's hand.
I'd rather die than have that monster strip away my feelings for you.
I'm ready to go when you are. Our entrance is concealed not far from here.
I'm sorry. I cannot stir more trouble between the mages and templars of Kirkwall.
You're on your own.
I don't want to break into the Gallows unless I know I can get out again.
You're on your own.
I will take no part in this.
You're on your own.
You can't be neutral.
If you don't help, then you're standing by while the templars work themselves up to massacre us.
I believe I finally have a suspect, a man called Gascard DuPuis.
I've been looking into the murders of several women for the past few years.
I now believe these women were abducted and killed by the same man: Gascard DuPuis.

I'm not paying you for goods you stole in the first place.
Forget it.
Too late.

Gamlen's debts aren't mine.
Oh, but it's more than that.
If Gamlen owes you, I'm sure we can come to an arrangement.
We can work this out.
I think it's well past that.
I've done so well because I've carved my way through half of Kirkwall! You really want to cross me?
Are you joking?
You spurned my offer. And lost us some serious coin.
I intend to take what you owe—with interest.
And you're as direct as I've been told. Good.
As I mentioned in my message, I require your help.
Chuckles Your tongue is as sharp as they say. I'll just get to the point.

Fenris?

Shut up.

Leave.

The rebels had wounded him. The soldiers he brought attempted to capture me—unsuccessfully.
It was weeks before Danarius was able to mount the hunt in earnest, but by then, I was already gone.
Even if I did, I felt... unworthy.
I had no way of knowing if I could truly escape from Danarius then. I didn't even know what that meant. I simply had to get away.
I stowed aboard a ship to the mainland and moved south... chased by my former master every step of the way.
How well did you know these Fog Warriors?
You regretted killing them?
I knew them only a few months, but in that time, I felt as if I truly lived.
They were bold. Strong. Free with their affections.
I was in awe of them, and owed them everything. And I turned on them even so.
You have not been a slave.
A slave does not dream of freedom, or wonder at possibilities. You think only of your master's desires, and what the next hour will bring.
It did not occur to me that I could be anything else until I had a taste of it.
But there are stories of slaves rebelling all the time. They did in Kirkwall.
All slaves feel that way?
The ritual that gave me my markings also stripped me of my memory.
Whatever I was before may as well have never been. Perhaps if I knew, I might have felt differently.
I wasn't running from him. Not at first.
You think they teach slaves how to write?
I have never spoken about what happened, to anyone. I've never wanted to.

It might mean more than that.
Just friends?

Let's not go crazy.

I agree.

To you, Hawke. May I fight at your side for years to come.

You were saying...?

I'm willing.
On another evening, perhaps.
Stop right there.
There's no need to continue.

Don't take this the wrong way, but...

I'm not sure we should...
This is a little sudden.
Of course. A conversation for another time, perhaps.
But nothing. This isn't a bonding moment.
We're not friends.
You don't need to say it. I understand.
You had to tell someone.
To much wine will make anyone chatty.
But you're drunk?
Let's just say you've earned my respect.
A last toast, then: to the fallen.
You can always ask.
Oh, this should be good.
It should be a small matter, but I worry.
I need you to give something to Guardsman Donnic. Here, in the barracks. No questions, and he is not to know it's from me.
Donnic? The one we pulled from an ambush?

I should know who I'm dealing with.
Who is Donnic?
Bad start to the no questions rule. Fine.

What's the package?
That's none of your business.
Make it my business.
That seems abrupt, even for you.
How very Qunari of you.

You need me for something as simple as this?

I need a friend to do this. It's a short list.
All right.
No. I'm not a messenger.

Guardsman Donnic is just one of many under my command.

Aveline, I just don't see the need.
He's in your own barracks. Kick it across the floor to him.
I gave the Keeper my word.
I'm glad I could help.
If this is what you wanted, then I'm glad I could be of service.
How about a kiss, then?

I'm sure I could think of a better way for you to thank me.

So, how did Donnic react?

To your garbage, you mean?

Stop defeating yourself!

Not that it really matters to people like you!

Grey Warden Letters
Wesley

Messenger's Orders
Take the first boat from Amaranthine to Kirkwall, then proceed with all haste to Weisshaupt Fortress. If the roads prove too perilous or blocked, our agent in Kirkwall can assist. Find the dead drop located in an alleyway near the Lowtown foundries during daylight hours. Protect the letters at all costs.
Warden-Commander of Ferelden

Avernus's Research
The limitations put upon my research have greatly hampered progress. With just a few subjects, I could test certain critical hypotheses. However, the information sent about the Architect has proven invaluable to my efforts, and I am pleased to report limited success. As the Architect surmised, considerable untapped power exists within Grey Warden blood. When properly prepared, its effects can be remarkable.
But my research has also revealed some alarming implications, which I've attached in the old Acanthan cipher. I urge you to send this to the First Warden at once.
I will conduct further tests as long as I'm able. My documentation is very thorough—if time finally claims me, others may follow in my footsteps.
Avernus

Avernus's Research
The last shipment was quite helpful for my research, Commander. If you could double the supply next time, it would prove most efficacious. Additionally, the information regarding the Architect has proven invaluable—we have made several breakthroughs recently. As the Architect surmised, considerable untapped power exists within Grey Warden blood. When properly prepared, its effects can be remarkable.

I will conduct further tests as long as I'm able. My documentation is very thorough—if time finally claims me, others may follow in my footsteps.
Avernus

What in the Maker's name is a wallop mallet?
I have a question for you.
I found this note on one of the thugs. Something about your wallop mallet.
Huh. Haven't played wallop since I was a kid. Still got my mallet up on the wall, though. Last time I was any good at something.
Your mother ran away!
I thought she abandoned us. I was angry. I didn't think she deserved what was left to her.
If I'd have known how much it hurt her... maybe I would have done things differently.
Let me tell you what I know about destiny.
Some men fight against it with every fiber of their being.
Some men fear it. Those ones you find on their knees, begging for mercy.
But every now and then someone comes along who embraces his destiny.
But every now and then there's one who embraces destiny.
That one, my friend... he changes the world forever.
This is a story you have to hear.
Some legends need to be told.
This is where the legend begins.
That doesn't make up for what you did.
I'm still not telling you.
No. It couldn't be. Mara? She wouldn't have kept something like this from me, would she?
I need a drink. Just... leave me awhile, would you?
Don't save me. Please, just... don't.
You really think I would let anyone else come to harm with what I'm doing?
I... suppose I should have known. I should go. Thank you for hearing me out, Hawke.
You worry too much.
You don't have to dream about it.
I thought I was pretty obvious already, but I could spell it out for you.
We're friends. Nothing more.
You're like a sister to me, Merrill.
Maker's blessing, Champion.
Have you come to pray?
I want to talk about mages.
Have you thought about which side you'll take? Between the mages and templars?
So... hypothetically, if there were a group of people being brutally subjugated by another...
You speak of mages.
Yes. No! Yes.
Why have you let the templars continue their oppression of mages?
It's no secret that you count apostates among your friends, Champion. You have done much to fan the flames of rebellion here.
We must give Meredith and Orsino time to work out their differences. No good can come of showing favor to one side.
Couldn't you solve this problem if you just spoke out?
Why not?
How would that help?
Both sides make good points. Both have flaws.
For a thousand years, the Chantry has had to find the balance between them. That hasn't changed here.
So you support the templars?
I understand. You are the voice of the Chantry. You can't turn against its own institutions.
All right, you won't budge on this one. Templars it is.
You're right. The templars serve a purpose.
That's not what I'm saying. I do not support the knight-commander's methods.
The mages need your help.
The Maker created mages. Why doesn't He protect them?
I guess that means you're not ready to disband the templars and set every mage free?
Mages have submitted to the Chantry's will for a thousand years. Will they never be trusted?
I feel for the mages, I do. I would not wish to be locked in the Gallows.
But I cannot take sides. We are all the Maker's creatures, but magic allows abuses beyond the scope of mortals.
I only hope I can balance the needs of everyone. For if it comes to war, it is the people of this city who will lose.
Can you offer me your blessing?
Yes.
May Andraste lend you strength until you ascend to be with the Maker.
This is a grave time. It is good to know you will face it in the Maker's grace.
The Maker abandoned us long ago—if He ever existed. What good would your blessing do me?
The Chantry is a scam.
There are apostates plotting something against the Chantry.
I bring a warning.
And the sky is blue and the rains come in the spring.
No. Truly—
It's no secret you have close associates who are apostates, Champion.
I do not doubt you know of one's plans. But mages have threatened me before.
I cannot turn on my templars, on the very words of Andraste, for fear. No matter how justified that fear might be.
It might help settle that anger. It's hard to accept that there is no divine hand we can look to for guidance.
But mankind has turned on the Maker twice. Now we are the ones who must prove our love for Him.
Is there some other reason you're here?
I was just leaving.
No.
You are the Maker's child, Champion. Whether you embrace Him or not.
There you are. I've been looking for you all over.
Your Grace.
Your soul is troubled, child. I hope you found a balm for it here.
Maybe there's still a way to change the Circle from within.
You've made it abundantly clear where you stand, Champion.
Your support has meant the world to me.
I wanted you to have this.
What's that, a... pillow?
Hand-embroidered by my mother. The only thing of hers they let me keep when I went to the Circle.
Why in the name of Andraste would you give that to me?
You've been a good friend, Varric.
Uh-uh. You keep your pillow, Blondie. And may you have many more dreams of killing templars on it.
I didn't realize you'd be home.
Hawke. I didn't think you'd come back here.
I know you don't understand why I must do what I do, but I thought maybe you'd support me.
You never even told me what you're doing!
Support you in what?
I'm trying to protect you.
There's no reason we both need to hang.
I believe in your cause. It's just your methods I question.
I do support you.
Revolutions do not happen peacefully.
Vague threats and pretentious speeches? Not the best way to change my mind.
You thought wrong.
You're the one who jerked me around with that ridiculous story about the Tevinter potion!
You lied to me!
I told you. I'm a liar. I'm a monster. I never claimed I would do anything but hurt you.
Should I have told you the truth? There's no one in Kirkwall I wouldn't kill to see mages free.
How would you have reacted to that?
There must be a peaceful solution.
You must find a better way.
No.
If you talk to the grand cleric—
No.
If Meredith steps down—
Probably not by saying, Great, let's go.
Badly, I imagine.
The Chantry will never change from within.
They see mages as monsters. They can't imagine a world with room for all of us.
Maybe they're right.
If you want mages to be free, you need to convince people you're not dangerous.
You won't win this way.
Impossible!
All you're doing is proving the templars right!
Do you know how long I've been telling them that? Mage after mage in Kirkwall, turning to blood magic because it's easy!
I always said they were their own worst enemies. But I never thought I... Sighs
Whatever you planned, there's still time to stop it.
It's not too late.
Yes. Time... maybe there's still time.
Leave! This does not concern you!
Leave! This does not concern you!
You will not get justice by becoming what everyone fears.
You must see reason.
I will get justice, by any means required.
I will get justice, by any means required.
Why, hello Justice. It's been so long.
Justice, I presume.
This is Anders's decision, not yours!
Let him go!
I am Anders.
You have given into sloth. You would stand by while mages are abducted and tortured.
Go. Anders has no need of you.
I am Anders.
You have given into sloth. You would stand by while mages are abducted and tortured.
Go. Anders has no need of you.
What was I saying?
You... don't know what just happened?
You don't remember?
No. What do—
Your better half doesn't like me.
Justice came out.
Oh. I'm having more... blanks in my memory. It's like the longer we go, the less of me there is.
You were right all along. I should never have done this.
I will see... maybe it's still not too late to change things.
You are beyond help.
You were right. You are a monster.
Being with you, loving you, I thought it would make a difference, but he's too strong.
I've tried my best. Don't hate me for failing.
It doesn't matter. It's pretty clear who's in charge here.
Forget it. Nothing I say will get through to you.
I give up.
Oh. You're home.
I want to tell you now, I love you.
Hawke. I... didn't expect you here.
But... let me take this time to tell you how much I respect you.
You've stood by me, when I gave you every reason to turn away.
Just remember, whatever happens, I wanted you to know that.
Why are you talking like this?
What's going on?
He'll still be here, you know—Justice—long after you and I are gone.
It doesn't mean the same thing to a spirit. He'll just go back to the Fade.
I don't want to lose you.
I know it.
I love you, Anders.
You've been a good friend.
No. I haven't, and I'm sorry.
Usually people don't say things like that unless they're about to stab someone in the back.
Is this when you betray me?
I love you. I wish that meant I would never hurt you.
You are the most important thing in my life.
But some things matter more than my life, more than either of us. I'm sorry.
You're wrong. There is nothing more important than love!
Love is important!
If you were curious, that's not the best way to get me in the mood.
Way to kill the mood.
I told you I would break your heart. Just know it breaks mine to do it.
This is war. We cannot be weakened by our feelings.
You're right.
I knew you would understand.
None of this is aimed at you, Hawke. I think I've made that clear.
I'm not expecting this to end with anything less than overthrowing the templars.
I'm ready for war.
Then you will not be disappointed.
I was hoping we'd find a better way, but... Justice and Vengeance are too intertwined. I can't tell one from the other.
You are the one shining light in my life. Never blame yourself for what will happen.
You have been a better friend than I ever thought to have.
Leave me. I have preparations to make.
I cannot tell you how good it feels for a spirit to fulfill its function.
The waiting is over. I am finally seeking justice. And he is exultant.
There is no ecstasy humankind can feel to match.
Are you going to tell me what you did?
What happened in the chantry?
You are Kirkwall's Champion.
You can better aid our cause in that role than by aligning yourself with me too closely here.
Every time you refuse to tell me, I have to imagine something crazier.
This gets worse and worse.
This isn't a fight for sane men.
Be careful.
Whatever you're doing, it's not worth your life.
Oh, it is. One human life would be a small price for freedom.
Don't despair for me, love. This is what I was born to do.
You're scaring me. You sound possessed.
I am possessed. And it's never felt better.
You should bottle that stuff. You'd make a fortune.
I'd like to try it.
I would share it if I could, love.
Ha. I don't think most people would be willing to pay the price.
Even Justice bows to you for the faith you have shown us.
A victory for mages will be a victory for you.
Then you are finally ready to face the knight-commander?
So you're ready to fight?
The war will happen. The clock is ticking down. It will be midnight soon.
Leave me in peace. I have much to do.
There is one more thing I need of you, my love. And I can't tell you why.
There is one more thing I would ask of you, Hawke. And I can't tell you why.
I must get inside the chantry, without being seen.
Will you talk to the grand cleric for me? Distract her long enough for me to do what must be done?
What do you want me to talk about?
What should I say?
Food? The weather? What does it matter?
No, talk of mages. Give her one final chance to hear what we have suffered. To pick a side.
Perhaps she'll be more inclined to listen to you.
What must be done?
What are you plotting?
Tell me your plan.
You would not thank me if I told you.
If you support freedom for mages, help me. That's all I can say.
What is it you don't want me to see?
This sounds suspicious.
Do you believe in me, love? Do you believe mages deserve to live free of the templars' grasp?
You said you believe in me. Again and again, you have shown your support for mages.
Then trust me now. I am doing only what is necessary.
Was this ever about you and Justice? Or have you lied this whole time?
Is there even a potion?
I lied. There is no potion.
But what we have gathered will bring freedom for more than just me and Justice. It will help mages throughout Thedas.
In the face of that, one lie means little.
I can't act blindly. Tell me your plan.
Do you trust me?
No. Whatever you're doing, you know I'd disapprove. That's why you won't tell me.
I cannot help you.
I am taking a risk. I would not see you drawn into it.
But maybe your support of mages ends at talk. It's easy to support freedom if no one must die to achieve it.
You cannot claim to love me, then turn on me now.
You cannot pretend friendship, then stop now.
I care for you. That doesn't mean I agree with every decision.
I do love you.
You cannot care for me and despise what I stand for.
I am the cause of mages. There is nothing else inside me.
Will you aid us now? Or does your support stop at the chantry door?
Tell me what you would have of me, then. But I won't forget you blackmailed me to get it.
Fine. I will help.
That's unfair. I will not be blackmailed into aiding some mad scheme. You're on your own.
Forget it.
I do trust you.
I will help.
I would not tell you my plans, Hawke. You have made it plain where your sympathies lie.
I will ask you straight, then. Has nothing you've seen changed your mind?
Will you help me free the mages of Kirkwall? Or will you stay at the side of the knight-tyrant?
I won't play the pawn for anyone.
I cannot help you.
I have always been on my own. For a time, I just forgot.
What do you need me to do?
Fine. I will help.
You surprise me again, Hawke. I'm glad these years spent ranting haven't been in vain.
I will help.
You do what you need to do.
I won't desert you now.
I do not deserve your love.
Your loyalty is more than I deserve.
I promise: whatever happens, it's on my head. It will not come back on you.
Go to the chantry. Talk to the grand cleric. I will join you when I'm done.
I'm going to be trying something, and I thought you'd want to be part of it.
You've been right all along.
We've both been wrong.
I've been wrong.
What I did with Justice was unnatural. It should never have happened.
I'm glad you finally understand that.
You're right.
Is there some way to undo it?
What does that mean?
You're getting him under control. I've seen it.
You're wrong.
I can't help mages like this. Not while I am everything the templars fear about magic.
I need to be free of this curse.
Tell me how to help.
You know I'll do anything I can.
Your patience with me... I marvel every day that you haven't thrown up your hands and left.
What must we do?
I've never heard of anyone getting... un-possessed.
Is there a way?
You brought this on yourself.
Impossible.
I did. But I think there's a way out.
I've spent the past three years researching the methods of Tevinter magisters.
They're the only ones who have ever sought to reverse spirit possession, not just behead the victims.
I believe I have a formula for a potion that can separate Justice and me. Without killing either.
Surely that's worth any risk it entails.
Let's do it.
That was going to be my next question.
Well, that's good.
I knew you'd stand behind me in this. Even if...
What?
Nothing.
I've gathered most of what I need, but there are some... outlandish ingredients I was hoping you'd help me collect.
A powder the Tevinters call sela petrae, and a small amount of drakestone.
Is it just a potion? Is there anything more to this ritual?
Tell me about this formula.
No, no ritual. Just mix the ingredients up and... boom. Justice and I are free.
And we can take our rightful place among free mages.
Where would we find sela petrae?
Sela petrae?
It's a crystal that forms from concentrated manure and urine.
I suggest we search the sewers. There's an entrance not far from here in Darktown.
What is drakestone?
Drakestone?
The Tevinters used to mine it for their apothecaries. There should still be deposits in the Bone Pit.
I assure you, we'll find them.
Sounds easy enough.
I could not have begun to do this without your support.
That doesn't sound sinister at all...
Those are creepy ingredients.
Well, you know Tevinters. They can't throw a Wintersend party without a human sacrifice or two.
But I promise, everything in my research says there's no blood magic involved.
What aren't you telling me?
Is that... all?
Oh, many things, I'm sure.
Did I tell you about the dream I had where the grand cleric was completely naked except for her miter?
And there was this giant glowing cheese wheel...
I don't want any part of this.
I'm not going to risk my standing by messing with some Imperial ritual.
You can do this without me.
Very well. I can follow this road myself. It is too important to leave undone.
Our cause is nearly lost.
You think I don't know the city guard is just another arm of the templars?
That is completely unfair.
If they show up here, I'll know who to blame. That's all I'm saying.
I'm sorry. I didn't mean for you to see that.
I just... can't be too careful. Now that the knight-commander has basically appointed herself viscount.
The knight-commander is trying to keep order. That's all.
She's hardly the viscount.
I can't even imagine how difficult it is to be a mage here now.
That must be hard.
It's easy for most of them. They're long-since Tranquil.
She's just waiting for the first legitimate excuse to drag me off to the Circle.
It's been awful.
You're our one hope. The Champion of the city, an open apostate. But it's not enough.
Between ruling the city and torturing mages, it's a wonder she has time to keep that sword so shiny.
She's a busy lady.
She has nearly crushed the flame of hope for mages here.
Are you in trouble?
Has she come after you?
Not personally. But I grow less hopeful each day.
Maybe she can stop rebels like you.
Keep your head down.
Oh, yes. Your knight-commander has done a wonderful job crushing rebels. You should be proud.
The mage underground is all but destroyed. And those left have turned to blood magic as their only option.
Which Meredith knows will prevent any chance of the public taking their side.
There's still hope.
There's still us.
There's still one good mage left in the city.
I don't know how you continue to believe in me.
This way there won't be war. You can change things more slowly, from within.
Maybe it's for the best.
How?
You don't think that kind of proves her point?
So, she's right?
If I have any influence here at all, Meredith will not be knight-commander long.
We will stop her.
I don't know what we would do without you.
How can people be so blind?
All mages are at risk of turning to blood magic.
Mages are dangerous.
At as much risk as you! I have never understood how you stand against your own kind.
A mage saved all of us from the Blight!
The Blight was stopped only with the aid of two mages, one an apostate!
But it makes no difference.
The Chantry set us all on this path long ago. It would take something truly catastrophic to change people's thinking now.
For the Maker's sake, draw the curtains! Do you know what could happen if the knight-commander's spies catch two apostates talking?
No. What?
No wonder the demons found you such easy prey.
Her ignorance will be what draws the templars down on us.
I have a gift for you.
Here. This might set your mind at ease.
Well, if you're really worried about the templars, have I got a deal for you...
There's something I want you to have.
What is it?
This key opens the cellars below the house here. You can get in from Darktown... if you ever need a quick escape.
Thank you.
Every time I think you don't understand, you turn around and do something like this.
It still surprises me how much you risk for my sake.
I will keep it close.
Don't worry about me.
I'll be fine.
I'm more concerned about you.
Don't worry about me.
I don't think we're at the point of having to worry about private conversations in our home, do you?
Things aren't that bad yet.
We do. They're watching.
She's a blood mage. Can you blame them for going after her?
The templars should hunt her.
I will never understand how you can be so antagonistic by day and so passionate by night.
You'll understand when it's me Meredith is coming for.
You won't be able to sit by so righteously.
Will we never be able to stop worrying about the blighted templars?
Damned templars!
As long as there's one templar in Thedas, mages will not be safe.
It means more than I can say to have had a partner these past three years.
It makes me believe we can do anything.
I love you.
I will always be here for you.
There will be war soon. The mages left in Kirkwall are at the breaking point.
I wish I could promise to keep you safe.
Merrill's gone now. Is this the best you can think to do?
Let's do something more fun.
The city is out of control. It will be open war soon.
War is coming.
Would that it had come sooner.
Meredith's rule has decimated the mage underground.
It would take the Maker's own aid to help us win now.
I think we're better off focusing on the task at hand.
I'll find you as soon as I'm done.
Just talk to the grand cleric. I'll only be a moment.
Thank you. I wouldn't have asked just anyone to venture in there for me.
There is one more thing, but we must discuss it privately.
Sorry to drag you down here.
We still need the drakestone from the Bone Pit.
I know it isn't my place to criticize, but...
Are you sure about Merrill?
She acts sweet, but she'll never pick you over her demon.
Merrill loves me.
We're happy.
What right do you have to question us? Is your Justice any different?
Yes.
Keep your illusions, then. Maker knows I won't be the one to change them.
Are you sure about Fenris?
He seems less a man to me than a wild dog.
You just don't know him.
Don't call him that.
I know as much as I'm ever likely to.
That's right, mage.
He has let one bad experience color his whole world. Surely, you want someone more open-minded.
A mage and a hypocrite. What company you keep.
We're not together. Not anymore.
He left me.
Oh. I'm sorry.
Though Isabela seems more than willing to help you forget the loss.
Was that you outside the door? I knew someone was listening!
Though it's probably for the best.
You're right. This isn't your place.
I don't want to talk about it.
They should rename this stuff dragon dung.
We still need the sela petrae from the sewers.
I hope the rest of the dragons haven't heard this place is on the market.
We'll need to visit the Bone Pit for the drakestone and the sewers to collect the sela petrae.
The grand cleric cannot continue to wave her hands and pretend the problem is solved. She's as good as helping Meredith.
Even the templars are turning on Meredith. That I never thought I'd see.
I wonder if they'd fight her directly if put to the test?
Meredith wants to convince you all mages are abominations waiting to happen.
But far more are like Emile.
I don't know which is worse, the rats or the people.
The people here, they never leave Hightown's fancy walls. They have no idea what's brewing below them.
So pious, aren't they? So ready to believe that any harm they do is the will of the Maker.
Half of Ferelden is packed into this stinking place. They'd have done better to fight the darkspawn.
No wonder they call this the Dragon Age. The bloody things are everywhere.
It's nice to get some fresh air. Kirkwall starts to stink after a bit.
Why don't you trust me?
The templars have ears everywhere. We shouldn't talk here.
I know I make stupid mistakes, and I babble like a fool, and you... you're beautiful and clever.
You're too good. You shouldn't have to waste your time trying to save me from my own folly.
You're worth it.
I don't mind playing the hero for you.
I care for you, Merrill. I want to be there for you.
But what if I just enjoy being your protector?
I can't let you hurt anyone.
Invest in the expedition. Fifty sovereigns, and he can't refuse. Not with me there to vouch for you.
Invest in the expedition. A hundred and fifty sovereigns, and he can't refuse. Not with me there to vouch for you.
Invest in the expedition. Two hundred and fifty sovereigns, and he can't refuse. Not with me there to vouch for you.
Let's just hope our dear old uncle is as good as his word.
Wait.
Here I am, about to defend these mages in hopeless battle.
You lead me to strange places, Hawke.
I'll take you to stranger places than this, just watch.
I'll lead you to more.
A tempting offer.
I expect you to fight to the best of your ability.
You're here now.
Of course. There is no turning back.
Sometimes you have to do the right thing.
We have no choice.
I'll take your word on that.
This isn't so strange, really. What's one more life-or-death battle?
That's what I do best.
Chuckles An excellent point.
I hope you're prepared for what we're about to face.
Desperation will drive these mages to terrible acts. I have seen it before. It will not be pretty.
What do you mean?
You've seen it before?
The Imperium has its own templars, and they too must act when mages cross the line.
The line is in a different place, but the end result is the same.
We will see abominations born of terror and wrath, men you never believed capable of depravity embracing it gladly.
We can't simply sit back and watch.
Something has to be done.
And we aren't.
I don't think it's too late. It doesn't have to go that far.
We can still help them.
We shall see.
Abominations and blood mages? Sounds like a Tuesday.
Sounds like fun.
Chuckles It does sound that way, doesn't it?
I... may not get the chance to say this again.
Meeting you was the most important thing that ever happened to me, Hawke.
Promise me you won't die. I can't bear the thought of living without you.
I don't plan on dying.
You won't have to.
You'd better not.
I don't make that promise unless you do.
I feel the same.
Nothing is going to keep me from you.
I didn't quite catch that. Could you speak up?
What are you saying?
Then let me make it clearer for you.
Then let me say one more thing, in case it's the last.
You're a good friend. The only one I've ever had. It will be an honor to fight at your side.
Meeting you was the only good fortune I've ever had. It will be a privilege fighting at your side.
Now the battle awaits us.
Na via lerno victoria. Only the living know victory. Fight well.
The battle awaits us, Hawke.
I've... heard about the Circle of Magi outside of the Imperium, but I've never been in one.
Are you certain it's wise for you to be here?
Oh, I'm sure nobody will notice little old me, don't you worry.
I'll blend in.
Very reassuring.
Are you certain it's wise for us to come here? Considering... who we're with.
It would help if you didn't ask questions like that.
Not if you don't stay quiet.
I could throw a fireball or two. Maybe that would help.
Probably not.
Yes, why don't you just wave a sign over our heads?
Maybe not, but we'll be cautious.
We'll be careful.
I don't think the templars will be surprised to see another mage here, do you?
What's one more mage?
Hmm. Maybe not.
I'll try to look sufficiently meek and oppressed.
Are there many Dalish here?
I'll try to avoid setting the place on fire. It'll be hard.
You're not helping.
This seems more like a prison. I wonder if it's more effective than the Circle I know.
How is the Imperial Circle of Magi different?
What is it like in Tevinter?
Once upon a time it was as it is here. The Chantry watched the magisters closely for any signs of corruption or weakness.
Then it changed. The magisters were permitted to watch over their own, and templars kept only to enforce the law.
What happened next was inevitable. The magisters rule again, as powerful as they ever were.
You said the Chantry used to watch the magisters. Why did they stop?
Why did it change?
You must remember that the attitude towards magic is different in Tevinter.
Magisters came from wealthy families, bloodlines that had nurtured magical talent for countless generations.
The Chantry was not trying to control poor peasants but the scions of the greatest houses in the Imperium.
I thought the magisters had been thrown down by the Chantry.
Weren't they defeated?
On the contrary, Andraste never defeated the Imperium. Her great army conquered the south, but not the north.
The magisters eventually surrendered to the Chantry, but they did so on their terms. They kept their influence.
Thus they reclaimed what they lost over the centuries. Some battles are lost by inches.
You're saying the same thing could happen here.
How is it inevitable?
If the mages were permitted to be their own watchers? Of course.
It is too easy for a mage to resort to blood magic if they feel the need is great enough.
A mage can desire power, justice, revenge, protection... any cause will do, and then they are lost.
You can't say every mage is corrupt.
Not all mages do that.
The ones that are lost should be dealt with.
Then they should be punished.
That is the question, isn't it? Who should deal with them?
You're saying that locking mages up is better?
So this is the answer?
All I am saying is the Imperium offers no answer. All that Andraste did long ago to end the tyranny of magic has been undone.
She ended the tyranny of magic and replaced it with an entirely new one.
Considering all that magic has done to my homeland and my race I weep for your predicament.
Tyranny of magic? Very dramatic.
Let me show you my homeland, or the ruins of Arlathan, and then you may speak of drama.
She freed our people as well, but it was your Chantry that undid that.
And who enslaved us in the first place? Don't be naive.
Power corrupts, as they say, and mages have power enough already.
You talk about the magisters as if they are all evil.
Are the magisters so terrible?
I have no doubt that some are good and noble men, strong enough to resist temptation.
But how many temptations do you wish to offer a man before he will give in?
Blood magic is everywhere in Tevinter. From the lowliest apprentice up to the archon himself.
You can't have seen this for yourself.
How do you know that?
Hmph. Danarius talked about it often.
Of course they say it's forbidden. Behind the smiles and closed doors, however, it's a different matter.
To be a magister in Tevinter is to be glorious. To be a powerful magister in Tevinter... that is worth any price.
It's wrong to oppress mages.
The templars here abuse their power. They go too far.
Does that mean they should not try?
Maybe it means they shouldn't be the ones to watch us.
Treating every mage like a criminal isn't the answer.
And not every mage deserves the benefit of the doubt.
And I suppose you decide which ones?
Injustice cannot be answered with injustice.
I think you need to be quiet now.
What the Circle does here is better than the alternative.
The Circle is necessary.
An alternative I am very familiar with.
Alternatives are so wonderful for those who have choices.
Herding mages together and putting them under lock and key? It can't be the answer.
According to everything I've seen, the Circle can't control mages anyhow.
The Circle doesn't work.
And what is the alternative?
Freedom is a noble ideal, but I see no oppression here. I see fear... and danger.
But enough. I'm sure we came here for a reason.
You know, you could go anywhere you like, now.
I'm aware of that.
Oh! You could become a raider! You could join my crew!
The crew of your non-existent ship?
Well, with that attitude you're never going anywhere, are you?
She doesn't understand.
You don't need to stay in this pit anymore, you know. Not that you haven't, er, fixed it up nicely.
It's falling apart, and my ability to keep the seneschal from noticing is nearing an end.
I appreciate what you've done, Aveline.
But you're staying. You could go anywhere now!
Perhaps I don't wish to go anywhere.
Freedom must be a terrible burden, I guess.
They don't understand.
Yes, I am free. Danarius is dead. Yet... it doesn't feel like it should.
You wanted him to stop chasing you. Now he has.
Get over it.
You thought killing him would solve everything, but it doesn't.
Revenge wasn't the answer.
I suppose not.
Seems like you should be dancing for joy.
You aren't happy?
I would have thought so.
I thought if I didn't need to run and fight to stay alive, I would finally be able to live as a free man does.
But how is that? Whatever past I had died with my sister. I have nothing now—not even an enemy.
But how is that? My sister is gone, and I have nothing—not even an enemy.
Is that all you do? Dwell on the negative?
You're whining.
No, I... well, all right, yes. Fair enough.
Maybe that just means there's nothing holding you back.
You have a future.
Hmm. An interesting thought.
You're not reminiscing about the good old days of being hunted, I hope.
You miss Danarius?
I wouldn't go that far.
It's just... difficult to overlook the stain that magic has left on my life. If I seem bitter, it's not without cause.
Perhaps it is time to move forward. I just don't know where that leads. Do you?
You're still blaming magic for everything?
You think magic is at fault?
Think about it, Hawke.
Look at what happened to your mother. Look at the life you've had to lead.
Look at what happened to your mother... your sister... so many others.
Is there anyone whose life has been touched by magic that actually benefits?
You make a good point.
Maybe you're right.
Blaming magic isn't the answer.
It isn't that simple.
For every mage such as you, Hawke, there are a dozen more too weak to handle their power.
There are problems enough in this world without putting such power in the hands of those too weak to resist its allure.
Them, I fear, as should you. As should anyone.
But what's important now is moving forward. I only wish I knew where that led.
Wherever it leads, I hope it means we'll stay together.
Stay with me.
That is my hope, as well.
Nobody knows the future, Fenris.
Does anyone?
You do what you want, it doesn't matter to me.
I don't care.
Ah. And here I'd hoped it might.
I'd hoped it might. I've always thought of you as a friend.
Fair enough, Hawke. I suppose I'll need to find out for myself... like anyone else, yes?
There's so many possibilities.
It can lead anywhere you want, Fenris.
That's the point, isn't it? You can do anything you like.
You want the answer right now? That would spoil all the fun!
The future of a slave is never uncertain. But I am no longer a slave. Perhaps it is time I remembered that.
Thank you, Hawke. I would never have thought to call a mage my friend, yet here you are.
Thank you, Hawke. Of all the things I thought to find here, a friend was not one of them.
Wherever the future leads, I hope it is at your side.
Festis bei umo canavarum.
Let me guess. You're upset. Again.
What's wrong now?
Am I supposed to understand that?
What?
No need to go overboard with the thanks or anything.
You're welcome.
It means, you will be the death of me.
Six years ago I decided to stay with you, in part because I owed you. But I also thought you could help me.
And you did. Hadriana is dead. Danarius is dead. I am finally free.
But none of it feels like it should. This freedom tastes like ashes.
I didn't tell you to do any of this.
How is that my fault?
And yet you led me, each step of the way.
You were already free, Fenris. Killing Danarius was just revenge.
This isn't freedom.
Ah, yes. Platitudes are so easy.
I always thought it tasted like chicken.
Try it with salt.
Yes, joke. That's your answer for everything, isn't it?
Sighs You are not responsible for my misery. Why am I angry at you?
I thought finding Varania would open up a new world, one that was lost forever. But it's gone and I can't get it back.
What do I do now, Hawke?
We're not exactly friends, Fenris.
You're asking me?
Yet I respect you.
Clearly you're doing something right. Perhaps you can see what I cannot.
Start over.
Stop waiting for your past.
You have a whole future to decide that.
Sounds like the perfect time to do something new.
You're obviously not happy here.
You should leave.
Obviously not.
There are other lands I haven't seen, places with no bad memories. Perhaps I shall go west.
For what it's worth, Hawke... thank you.
It's not up to me.
You're asking the wrong person.
What do you want to do?
Chuckles Clearly making decisions for myself isn't my best quality.
Change your clothes, join the Chantry, I don't know.
Laughs I don't think I'll go that far.
Maybe it is time to leave this hatred behind. It's poison, yet I continue to swallow it.
There is no one left to blame. What I have done I have done to myself.
You don't have to go through this alone.
I can help you.
Don't I?
It's about time you realized that.
Seems that way.
Laughs Been waiting, have you?
What you're going through can't be easy.
You're too hard on yourself.
You are too kind.
Danarius isn't exactly blameless.
You had help.
Perhaps. But he's dead, now.
We have never discussed what happened between us three years ago.
You didn't want to talk about it.
I felt like a fool. I thought it better if you hated me—I deserved no less.
But it isn't better. That night... I remember your touch as if it were yesterday.
I should have asked your forgiveness long ago. I hope you can forgive me now.
I need to understand why you left, Fenris.
Tell me why.
I've thought about the answer a thousand times.
The pain, the memories it brought up... it was too much. I was a coward.
If I could go back, I would stay. Tell you how I felt.
What would you have said?
Which is?
Nothing could be worse than the thought of living without you.
You're forgiven.
Don't let it happen again.
I understand. I always understood.
Oh, I don't know. This might be fun to hold over you a while longer.
If there is a future to be had, I will walk into it gladly at your side.
Whatever happened, it was a long time ago.
It's too late.
I had to ask.
Then I hope we can remain friends. That is something I have always valued.
If I have been difficult... I'm sorry. Clearly I owe you more than I believed.
Take a look at this.
A blade of mercy? I remember these.
You see them in the Imperium: replicas of the sword Archon Hessarian used to kill Andraste. This one looks finely crafted.
It seems like a regular sword.
Finely crafted?
I thought it might be worth something.
So it's not valuable.
It is.
So they sell these things at every market stand in Minrathous?
It's a souvenir?
Laughs Hardly.
Here, let me show you.
These are gifts of honor, given to those who have performed a service for the Imperium. Danarius coveted them, as I recall.
You don't talk about the Imperium much.
Tell me about Tevinter.
It's not a place I remember fondly.
Doesn't the Chantry forbid mages to rule over men?
Tevinter is ruled by mages?
Ah, yes. Magic is meant to serve man, and not rule over him.
In the Imperium they say that means magic should serve the greater good, which they claim the magisters do.
Do not believe it.
What do the magisters do that's so bad?
Why is that?
What you call the Circle of Magi rules the Imperium. They control the Chantry, as well as the templars.
They claim the magisters are governed by holy law, but they are the law.
They do as they please. All of them.
So they all use forbidden magic?
Are they blood mages?
The more powerful the mage, the higher he rises in the Senate. He makes the laws, he determines what is acceptable.
Everyone who wishes to compete must do the same, or be crushed.
Perhaps it wasn't always this way, but it is now.
I heard that the Imperium has been at war with the Qunari for decades.
Tevinter's at war with Qunari?
Ever since the Qunari landed on the island of Seheron, yes. Eighty years ago? Perhaps more.
The archon demanded aid from the rest of Thedas. It didn't get him far.
They've been at war a long time.
But who's winning?
The Qunari only ever wanted Seheron, which they have.
The Imperium has made numerous attempts to retake the island, without real success.
I believe the Qunari are saving their strength, building a massive fleet. When they wish true war, we will know.
Are the Qunari that strong?
You think they'll win?
They once fought all the lands of Thedas to a stand-still. If they wanted to conquer the Imperium, they would.
From what I saw on Seheron, they will not relent. They believe even more strongly than the magisters that they are in the right.
The slave trade is still in operation in the Imperium?
Slavery is legal in Tevinter?
It varies from one archon to the next. One outlawed it many years ago—he was quickly assassinated.
Tevinter would crumble without slaves. The Imperium's elite know no other way.
Seems like a slave rebellion would end that.
Don't they rise up?
There are rebellions all the time, actually.
Most of them end... poorly. The Senate always unites when faced with sedition.
One day things will change. Then the magisters will see just how fragile their hold is.
Keep the sword.
The blade is yours.
I'd like you to have it.
The blade is yours, if you want it.
For me? Yes... I think I'd like that. I'll think of the irony as I wield it.
Thank you, Hawke.
You think I wish to carry a symbol of Imperial honor? You must be joking.
Keep your sword. Sell it, melt it down. I want nothing to do with its filthy magic.
This could come in handy.
I'll keep the blade.
Without a doubt. I certainly don't want anything to do with it.
I have something for you.
It... it's a book.
This one is quite rare, actually.
It's no ordinary book.
It's a subject you're familiar with.
I thought you might enjoy it.
I see your eyesight is still working fine.
Of course it's a book.
The book is by Shartan, the elf who helped Andraste free the slaves. You know about him, right?
A little. It's just...
Slaves are not permitted to read. I've never learned.
Of course I know about him. What do you take me for?
I certainly didn't learn from books, though. Do you think they teach slaves to read?
You haven't been a slave for years.
Why haven't you learned?
I suppose that's true.
And? Am I not learning your ways quickly enough to suit you?
It's not too late to learn, Fenris.
I could teach you.
Isn't it? Sometimes I wonder.
Is that what this is? Let's teach the poor slave to read?
A simple thank you would have sufficed.
Do they teach manners?
Chuckles Thank you.
I don't mean to seem ungrateful. I do appreciate the thought.
Yes. Thank you for reminding me of something I can never do.
Growls Ignore me. You are not responsible for my deficiencies. I do appreciate your gift.
I've always wanted to learn more of Shartan. Perhaps this is my chance.
I never thought I would find myself begging to be allowed back into Kirkwall.
I hope we can get into the city soon. I don't know what will happen if we have to go elsewhere.
Friends in Low Places

I understand you're in dire need of some coin. If that's true, I believe I have a proposition that you simply will not be able to refuse. Look for me at night near the foundries in Lowtown.
—Dougal
Meet Dougal near the foundries in Lowtown at night.
I'm sorry, love. I was... distraught. I never really believed that. It's just...
The darkspawn would have been happy with any prey. It was my fault it was Bethany.
The ogre would have been happy with any prey. It was my fault it was Carver.
I-I miss him.
There were four of us when the Blight began. It will never be over while there are just three.
The estate is yours. Why are we still here?
Can we move to the estate now?
Technically, the house is now property of the viscount, since its owner died without an heir.
If we went there now, we would just be squatters.
But if the viscount acknowledges our rights, we can get back more than the house. We can get back our name.
I've got something for you.
Ooh. Did you get this from Master Ilen?
It looks like his work. He's always carving halla out of bits of scrap.
Before we left Ferelden, he had so many the Keeper said he'd need ten real halla to pull his carved ones north.
It's beautiful. Just like the real thing.
Mythal! Did I miss some important occasion? I'm so sorry! I'll make it up to you, I promise!
Your mother never hated you.
Grandmother's not worth this.
Your mom was a bitch.
That doesn't sound healthy.
He's obsessed.
Feeling homesick?
You sound sad.
Is having a weird fixation a Dalish thing, or specific just to your clan?
Are all elves crazy?
It's just a gift. Nothing to panic over.
Calm down.
There's no occasion, Merrill. I just thought you'd like it.
You didn't forget anything.
I think I missed the elvish sign for, This present induces terrible guilt. I'll shop more carefully in the future.
Did I give you the wrong gift?
I thought you were leaving.
I... I am.
You've spit on Tamlen's memory. On Mahariel's.
Then go. Or do you take some sick pleasure in drawing this out?
You've spit on Tamlen's memory. Do you think the clan will just forgive that?
Everything will be all right.
I feel like I'm forgetting something. Or there's more to do. Or...
A deal has been made with Dougal. Tell Bartrand that the 50 sovereigns will be delivered to him.
Dougal's deal has been refused. He said he would stay around the foundry area for a little while longer, just in case.
I'm with you, ma vhenan.
Bartrand has been paid without Dougal's help. Chances are Dougal has moved on by now.
I suppose whether we succeed or fail doesn't really matter.
I hope so. I'm... I'm sure this is for the best.
It's not a pretty home, but at least it's clean.
This is it, then.
I can't believe I'm actually... helping templars.
I didn't think... I only ever wanted to help the Dalish. Never a thought for any other people's troubles...
What happens now?
Looks like the Amells didn't hate Father enough to throw all his possessions away.
There's a letter. A mage called Tobrius says a mutual friend died. Might be worth checking after this is done.

Right. I knew that.

Looks like the Amells didn't hate your father enough to throw all his possessions away.

Of course not.
I apologize. I didn't expect him to strike so soon.

There were flowers.

You said you'd look into this after I told you about Emeric's death. Did you learn anything?

Trigger shady dealer letter.

Can you help me?

I did, but I've found little.
I will speak to my superiors and alert the city guard. They'll keep a lookout for your mother.
No, no! I'm content... with my choice.
I suppose you would see it in a bad light.

I do like it! I'm sorry I'm making a mess of this...

Stop it.

Ma serannas. I'll find a good place for this.
I know you don't want to be tied down, and I would never do that to you.
I'm not proposing marriage.
Come on, Daisy. You shouldn't be stuck in this rat-trap. Does Hawke even know you're here?
I don't have to ask permission to come to my own house, Varric.
Come on, Daisy. You've been holed up in here for days. If you don't get some sunshine, you'll wilt.
I'm not a plant, Varric. I'm fine.
Just take a walk around the Lowtown market. Get some air, and I'll stop bothering you.
I thought you of all people would understand.
You knew this was wrong. You told me you were going to stop it!
I thought you'd changed.
I tried. Justice... Vengeance... He was too strong for me.
Justice once told me that demons are just spirits perverted by their desires.
I made my friend a demon. And he did this.
Kill me now before there is nothing of me left.
I forgive you.
I know you would have changed it if you could.
But I have proven I cannot. If I couldn't control Vengeance now, I never will.
I need to die.

But I know better than anyone that love alone should not stay your hand.
Kill me if you must. I knew there was that chance.

Truly? Then... you do not wish me dead for my actions?
This was your plan, Anders?
Was that... why you needed me to distract the grand cleric?

I could have stopped you.
No. This had to happen.
I removed the chance of compromise, because there is no compromise.
I... know you mean well. But I have too much to do right now.
I'll let you talk some sense into her, Hawke.
Varric is... very sweet. Frequently infuriating and a terrible busybody, but sweet.
Things are different now.
I... probably should have told Bodahn where I was going. I hope I didn't worry you.

I never noticed those things.
Never noticed.
Speak to Fenris at his Hightown mansion.
That's what I say!
I knew you were special from the moment I laid eyes on you. You're someone worthy of... a duel.
Really? But those things are what make Lowtown... well, Lowtown!
The templar?
Are you sure about this? You know she's going to murder people whose only crime was being born a mage.
What do you want me to do? Let the city go up in flames?
You have a better idea?

We have to end the chaos.
It's a bad choice. The mages are defending themselves, and the templars are just protecting the city.
We're out of options.
It broke his heart. Destroyed him.
Good. I... appreciate it.
Anders condemned the Circle already. The grand cleric was beloved by the entire city.
Anders tied our hands.
Either the templars annul the Circle or the citizens of Kirkwall will riot and murder the mages themselves.
All we can do now is try to keep casualties to a minimum.
People will die no matter what we choose. Anders made sure of that.
I think we agree that nobody wants mages and templars fighting in the streets.
I suppose... you're right. This decision was taken out of our hands.
By the killer? That's... not good. I didn't expect him to strike again so soon.
Why?
Not your business.
Oh? I can come up with much crazier things in my dreams.
You need better dreams.
It's not that.
We could work on that.
If it brings your memory back, maybe we need to do it more often.
Don't you want to get your memories back?
Perhaps you don't realize how upsetting this is.
I've never remembered anything, and to have it all come back in a rush, only to lose it...
I can't... I can't.
You're the one who came to me, remember?
You started this!
Yes, you should.
It could be.
I might be able to help with your problems... or give you a few more.
They could be.
More problems than you normally do, I assume.
Chuckles Only a few?
Or a lot.
The good kind.
It depends if I really work at it.
Tempting.
You're a handsome man, Hawke. Is there no one else who has your... attention?

You're a beautiful woman, Hawke. Is there no one else who has your... attention?
I didn't quite catch that first part.
You think I'm beautiful?
Chuckles I don't need to repeat the obvious, I'm certain.
Not yet.
The day's still young.
I'm an attentive man.
I'm an attentive woman.
Do you see anyone else here?
Just you.
I'm an escaped slave, and an elf, living in a borrowed mansion. None of those things bother you?
Not for what I have in mind.
I'm not proposing marriage.
Well that's something.
Why do you think that would bother me?
Not at all.
You are not most people, clearly.
And I'm an apostate refugee. Does that bother you?
I'm a mage, remember?
And I'm a refugee as well as a human. Does that bother you?
I'm not without faults.
You have me there.
You raise an interesting point. I'll have to... consider it.
Are you saying what I think you're saying?
So you've never...?
If there was someone before, I have no memory of it.
There was no one after you escaped, even?
And since?
I stayed nowhere for long. Who would I trust?
I didn't think I needed anyone. Or wanted anyone. Until now.
Leliana

I give up.

I'm trying to honor him.
Still lying to yourself... Just go.

The time for talk is over. The battle is about to begin.

I didn't want to believe it. But I just... had to.
Take care, my dear.
Take care, my boy.
Thank the Creators you were there...
Are you the ones who sent the note about the Gem of Keroshek?
He still hasn't returned?
You can't bring her back, Merrill. Just accept it.
You can't bring Tamlen back. Maybe it's time you stopped trying.
I... never mind. There's no use in discussing this.
Not yet. I promise you, if I see him, you'll be the first to know.
If you would, keep an eye out for our hunters. Many have gone out and not returned.
We shouldn't even be here! If anything has happened to Harshal...
Don't. There's no need to panic yet.
Ugh. At least the crates are numbered so we can find them fast.
You mind if I just sit here while you search for the crates?
Fish, fish and more fish. Pfaugh! Let's look for those crates.
Those crates are somewhere in this warehouse.
Dareth shiral, human. Maybe you'll have better luck with Merrill than the Keeper did.
We're grateful that you returned with news of our hunters, even if it is bad news.
Mekel
Veld
Be careful, human. That blade belongs to our clan, and we expect it returned to us.
Amaranthine Conspirator
Are you sure she didn't say where she was going?
We're searching a warehouse full of dead fish for one lousy crate?
The vhenadahl tree is where we need to go.
The tree that mallet was made from is here in the alienage.
Isn't that sacred-tree-thing we wanted here in the alienage?
Let's go see if this vhenadahl tree can give us any answers.
The vhenadahl tree is here in the alienage.
I'm surprised they sent so many men just to capture someone like Gamlen.
Come on! Let's go search for those crates!
So they were to capture Gamlen and take him to the caverns? Sounds like the opening of a bad romance story.
Let me guess: that's your final answer?
You declare your Circle of Magi free, as if it were your right to do so, and thus stir up every mage outside of your kingdom.
Three mages have fled to Ferelden, and you have intervened to protect them as if it is your right to do so.
What other answer did you expect, your Majesty?
A maybe might have been nice.
I do not deal in maybes. I deal in cold, hard facts—as should you.
Perhaps when Ferelden next chooses a king, it will be one that takes his duty to the Maker seriously.
Well. That was awkward.
You asked to see me?
You called me here?
I did! Or I think I did, anyhow.
How do you do, your Majesty?
Greetings.
I've been better. Manlier too, come to think of it.
That's just Meredith's idea of Kirkwall hospitality.
Don't mind her.
Really? Kirkwall brutality must rip the skin off your face, then.
This is the Champion of Kirkwall.
Right! I'm Alistair, uh... king of Ferelden. And this is Teagan, my uncle. Sort of.
We've met—a few years back. Thank you again, Champion.
I'm actually Teagan. I'm only sort of his uncle.
Say... weren't you a Grey Warden once?
That's the rumor. Wait, weren't you...?
That's the rumor.
Huh. I guess we get around.
So you're a king, now? My, something new to brag about!
Isabela. Yes, I remember you.
I suppose borrowing you for the summer is out now?
So you're a king now? Moving up in the world!
Isabela, right? You look... different.
Don't we all?
I was hoping we could talk. Would've been better timing before being emasculated by Meredith, but I'm not picky.
If you want to talk, then talk.
What do you want?
I'm surprised you would even know who I am.
You know about me?
Things are looking up! It's not often I get called on to meet with foreign leaders.
An audience with a king?
I know you came here from Lothering. A Fereldan refugee that did well for himself, against all odds.
I know you came here from Lothering. A Fereldan refugee that did well for herself, against all odds.
I have to admit, I was hoping your influence in Kirkwall might be of use.
Things... haven't been going well with Orlais. Without a viscount here, however, there's only the knight-commander to deal with.
You were having an argument about mages?
Why was Meredith angry?
Is there to be a war, then?
What happened with Orlais?

He's trying to leave. I know a runner when I see one.
I... uh, I'm really sorry about your mother.
It's your fault she's dead. You knew Quentin all along. You could've helped me stop this!
You killed her.
Tell me why I shouldn't rip you to shreds right here.
You don't deserve to live.

FirstName/> Hawke,
Many thanks for the kind return of my property. Fenris is his usual compliant self now that his memories have been once again removed. Not a simple process, but considering the investment, I consider it very much worthwhile.
As promised, I'm enclosing a little gift from the storehouses of the Arcanist Hall in Minrathous. Should you ever find yourself in the Imperium, do feel free to visit. I'll provide a tour of the Hall myself, if you like.
Danarius
Returning it? You're something else, Hawke.
Our mother was... well, no word adequately describes an old dwarven lady's rage.
I'll throw in a couple of werewolves and a griffon for balance.
