Did someone ask you to give this to me?
Who gave this to you?
This person is like an underpaid brothel wench. He enjoys leading us on.
Another note?
Get back to your tree, and leave me alone.
Did I say you can talk to me?
And you're welcome.
How was I supposed to know he was going to take your mother?
I can't even look at him. Aveline?
Help me here, Aveline.
Think carefully. If you knew Quentin meant to take her, would you have told us?
Fenris. What would you do to him?
Your turn, Fenris.
That pain you feel is just the beginning, mage.
You're just saying that because you're afraid of me.
You're not sorry.
Well, maybe now my contact at the gates of Orzammar won't ignore my letters.
Well, I guess I better start answering my mail from Orzammar.
Unfortunately, the person was hooded, and it was dark. I didn't get a good look.
I was given a few coins to hand this over to whoever came asking about wallop mallets.
Yes, well, apparently I don't feel the same way about mages as the Chantry does.
So we're in disagreement. That means they get nasty. They're like that.
Sounds like the Circle is better off in Ferelden.
Mages have it better there?
You'd think so, wouldn't you?
Sadly, I don't control the Circle. I can only deal with mages outside the Circle... of which there aren't many.
Aren't they in your kingdom? Why not just kick the templars out?
So take over the Circle.
Ha! Easier said than done!
Doesn't mean you shouldn't try.
I'm sure there's something you can do.
Perhaps some things are better left alone.
We'll see what comes of it. Ferelden had a Blight to contend with, remember? We're not exactly at our strongest.
I hope not!
You're more optimistic than I am.
Empress Celene is doing her best. Orlais isn't the most stable place right now.
What's happening in Orlais?
Why is that?
Oh, the usual. Attempted assassinations, uprisings, fancy parties with stinky cheeses.
Apparently, some Orlesians think it would be grand to get their lost province back.
Well, we won't let them swoop down on us, will we?
That's right. Swooping is bad.
A lot of your people fled to Kirkwall, you know.
There are many Fereldans here.
I know. I wish I could have helped them.
The Blight devastated the kingdom, and afterwards... well, it hasn't exactly been peaceful.
They're welcome back, of course. As are you. But after so many years away, would you still consider it home?
How can I help?
You've done nothing for the Fereldans here, and now you want my help?
You have a lot of nerve.
I could be viscount.
Champion. I hope my letter found you well.
Harrowmont is hoping that if he just shuts his eyes tight and wishes, the real world will go away.
I swear, if I read one more page about golems...
Bhelen's court just reminds me too much of family dinners with my cousins.
Anyway, I owe you one, Hawke. Remind me later to put you on my tab.
It's not my fault! I didn't know he was going to take your mother!
Well?
N-no. I wouldn't have told you. I wanted to kill him on my own so I could keep his knowledge to myself.
It was never about revenge. I never had a sister.
Groans
What do you want from me?
Yes, I lied! I knew Quentin from the start.
The portrait in my house belonged to a woman I... I experimented on, when Quentin refused to teach me necromancy.

You knew he was hurting people!
It's not just about my mother.
Sacrifices must be made in the name of progress!
That's the best excuse you could come up with?
You didn't know?
You have a cousin?
I didn't know you had such a pretty little cousin, Hawke.
You never told me you had a cousin!
I have a cousin?
Gamlen never told you? I... of course he didn't. Why would he?
Veld? What are you doing here?
Mekel is dead. That bastard killed him!
Mekel is dead. That bitch killed him!
She told me not to expect her return. Not a word more.
Why would she say such a thing? Has the whole clan gone mad?

Rivaini Fertility Talisman
Killing me isn't going to bring your mother back!
What do you want? Nothing I say can change anything.
You repulsive little man.
Disgusting.
Who has the Keeper chosen to be her First now?
No one.
What? No, you must be joking.
Only Feynriel had the gift, and he was human-blooded. The clan would never have followed him.
I begged her to ask the Arlathvhen for a suitable apprentice from another clan. She refused.
H-Hawke? I... I should thank you for showing me what a monster Quentin was.
Nothing will bring her back. Get out of my sight.
You're right.
I... I'll find some way to repay you. I will.
It won't bring her back, but it will make me feel better.
I don't care.
I think she holds out the hope that you will return, foolish as that is.
And I have to live knowing that I made that terrible mistake!
Ship in a Bottle
Rivaini Talisman
Pray for her, young one. I fear... just pray that the Creators guide her.
I don't know who you are, but we can talk about this.
Please, calm down.
Talk about this? Like you talked with my brother before you cut him down?
That doesn't make sense. Mekel was just supposed to hand over the note!
You really think we didn't read it? We know about the gem, Charade. Hand it over. I won't let Mekel's death be for nothing.
What's a Mekel?
Who did I kill?
Insult me again, and it won't just be this Mekel who died by my hand.
Watch your mouth.
You let your brother go up against someone like Hawke for a stupid gem?
You know what: I did find the gem, but you're not getting your pathetic little hands on it, Veld.
Fine. We'll do this the hard way.
My brother! Mekel was my brother, and you killed him!
I came as soon as I heard.
What a crime.
Yes, Isabela, that is something you would say.
You made short work of this lot. This is common?
Well fought, Donnic.
As common as I like. What's going on?
I didn't expect to find you so... deep in bandits.
Not such an easy assignment.
A good day, to be sure. I'll be sore tomorrow, but it was my choice.
Tell me, what's going on?
It's all right. Go ahead.
Every guard chooses the patrol they want. My wife promotes from the bold, not the reckless.
Action is up, casualties are down. It is... remarkable.
As are you, love.
Another time, Serah Hawke. Safe travels.
What's this about, Captain? Don't trust me to work on my own?
It's nothing, Guardsman. Speak your mind, as always.
Looks like she pushes you into some rough patrols.
She forces you to do this?
Sounds like you don't think much of Aveline.
You don't sound happy.
She's the captain. She's clear about what is required. What we like doesn't matter.
I expected her people to be more... protected.
She's not coddling you?
Ha! You can sit in the barracks if you like, but not if you want to get promoted any time soon.
Casualties are down, I'll admit. But you have to be tough, or you're out.
If that's all, Captain. I have to get back to my patrol.
That should be sufficient. Take that to the templar.
Indeed. Let's go talk to Cullen.
I heard what happened.
I heard the news.
I don't know what to say, but I am here.
I... uh, I feel I should say... something.
I know you're not good at... emotional stuff.
You don't have to.
I'd rather be alone right now, Isabela.
Just leave me.
Suit yourself. And I'm sorry.
You... know where to find me if you want to talk about it. I understand if you don't.
Donnic will be on this route.
You will not find him bored.
Let's see what his patrol consists of.
Let's see how hard you sweat your men.
I know you wouldn't send him on a boring patrol. Not you.
So, let's see what you require of your guards.
So, let's see what his patrol is.
Your Majesty. May I say what an honor it is to meet you?
You could, but you'd be the first today.
I fought at Ostagar. What happened there was... a great tragedy.
Ah. Yes. Yes, it was. Thankfully the man responsible has paid for that.
Ah. Yes, it was. Sadly, Loghain still lives.
We... we heard the Dalish were given land in Ferelden. Is it true?
Yes. I wish I could say that went better.
Why? What happened?
It's... a long story. I intend to make it up to your people, however. I owe an old friend of mine too much to do otherwise.
Chuckles Uh, well, I... Who knows?
Ferelden will always be my home.
I do.
I hope we see you back there someday. We could use someone like you, Champion.
Kirkwall is my home now.
Not anymore.
I understand. Ferelden's loss.
What do you need me to do?
Do you really think there's something I can do?
Sadly, it may be too late. Meredith got wind of my arrival sooner than I'd hoped.
Fereldans fled everywhere! And we've tried to help everyone who came back!
It's all right, Teagan. I wish we could have done more.
You know, with your help there could be a viscount.
Hypothetically speaking, you could fix the no-viscount situation.
That's asking a lot.
It's tempting. But I'm sorry to say that my support won't mean much without the support of the templars.
I suppose it doesn't matter. I was hoping to have your help before Meredith got wind of my arrival, but that's done now.
What you can do is protect Kirkwall. It will take someone like you to keep it from falling apart.
I'm the Champion. If there's a danger, I'll deal with it.
This is my city.
You remind me a little of someone I once knew.
Well, that's comforting.
Protect Kirkwall from what, exactly?
Is there another threat?
You ask me, the biggest threat to this city just walked out the door.
But maybe that's the ex-templar in me talking.
Just me standing between the city and disaster, huh?
That's a big responsibility.
I've been there. Trust me, it isn't pretty.
Well, I suppose I should get back to the old ball and chain.
You know, the queen hates it when you call her that.
No she doesn't. Just because she killed an Archdemon... she doesn't scare me.
You keep telling yourself that, Your Majesty.
Well, I suppose we should be getting back.
The Grey Wardens are waiting for you in Denerim.
With more questions, I'll bet. Lovely.
Indeed. You-know-who should already have returned from her mission.
Is she? Well! Let's not tell the queen, then.
Wouldn't dream of it, Your Majesty.
Is she? Well! The day's looking up already.
We should. The Hero of Ferelden should be back in Denerim by now.
You're always so formal. She has a name, you know.
You're always so formal. He has a name, you know.
At least your mother loved you. Not everyone can say that.
I'm going to hold on to my memories of what she was, not the thing Quentin made of her.
I'll remember her that way.
I couldn't save her. I'm to blame.
I failed her.
I'm sorry, Champion. If Captain Aveline has concerns about these accusations, bring her to speak with me.
And just think: You stopped him. Quentin's never going to hurt anyone again.
Listen, if you want to blame anyone, blame that madman, Quentin.
You loved your mother, and she knew it. It wasn't your fault.
Ir abelas, ma vhenan.
There's nothing to say right now.
I don't want to talk about it.
I let Bethany down. I promised her I'd look after Mother.
I let Carver down. I promised him I'd look after Mother.
I'm glad you're here, Merrill.
Thank you.
I don't speak elven, Merrill.
What?
I am filled with sorrow. For your loss.
Leandra is in a better place now.
She's with the Maker.
You're right.
All right. I'll... just go then.
Or with Falon'din. You never know.
I am a prince of Ferelden, I'm telling you!
He keeps saying that.
That's because it's true!
I think it is true, actually.
He... does look a little like King Cailan.
Well, he was a prince in bed. That's all I remember.
Well, now he's a drunk in a bar in the ass end of Kirkwall. But aren't we all?
Just leave me alone. I've had enough of people like you. You're all the same.
Keep a lid on it, prince.
Watch it.
Right, I'll shut up. Don't speak out! Don't tell anyone that a traitor should die, oh no.
Are you okay?
Do you need help?
No, not okay! Worse than okay. Disgraced traitor, that's what I am.
How about I buy the next one?
Have another drink.
I don't need another drink. Okay, maybe I do. But just one. Or two.
Now you've done it. He'll keep on like this all day.
You sound like Morrigan.
Swooping is bad...
It should have been me. Not Loghain!
I can't believe Loghain's still alive. He should have hanged!
Stupid Grey Wardens and their stupid rituals.
Why does anyone take the Joining anyway? What are the Wardens good for?
Just a stupid club, that's what it is. Everyone hanging around, talking about their taint.
Well, I don't need it.
That's right. I said it.
I failed you, Duncan. I'm so sorry.
This is all Morrigan's fault. I know it!
Just leave me alone.
Mother should be here. Alive. With her family.
That's not a comfort.
I'm sorry. I said something wrong. I... I'll just be quiet now.
Quentin used dark magic, just like you do. It turned him into a monster.
This is what magic does.
It's not the same! The magic is just a tool. He used it for something terrible.
I'm using magic to help my people. It's not the same at all.
I'm really sorry about your mother.
Yes, I'm still here! What do you want from me?
So you are here.
Go away, Teagan.
That's enough, Alistair. I think you've wallowed in self-pity long enough, don't you?
And what am I supposed to do?
Start again. Come with me. Back to Ferelden.
Sighs
I know nothing I say will change it. I'm just... I'm sorry.
I appreciate it, Anders.
Thank you.
I'm here for you. Whatever you need.
I didn't try hard enough to save her.
I let her down.
She wouldn't want you to blame yourself.
Maybe the templars are right.
A mage did this to her... Maybe we are a danger to everyone around us.
You still think mages should be free?
He was a madman. That's what made him do this. Not magic.
I know you're looking for someone to be angry at. If it helps, go ahead and take it out on me.
I'd rather deal with this on my own.
You should go.
I understand.
Am I to blame for not saving her?
Is it my fault?
You are looking for forgiveness, but I'm not the one who can give it to you.
Just say something. Anything.
Can you try saying something?
They say death is only a journey. Does that help?
I suppose they say you go back to the Maker when you die.
A little bit.
I'd rather be alone.
I don't need you.
Very well.
It just raises questions. Journey to where?
Not really.
I don't know. It's just something people say.
How is that supposed to help the grieving?
No.
It doesn't. But you asked me to say something.
To be honest, I don't think there is much point in filling these moments with empty talk.
I think no matter what, she'd be proud of you.
The claims against Aveline are garbage. Did you bother to verify them?
The accusations are lies.
No.
I saw no evidence to support the claims against her.
The concerns are baseless.
I have successfully wasted my time, and there is no merit to the claims.
Investigating was pointless.
Champion. And you are with the captain. None too happy about the accusations against her, I'm sure.
You could say that.
Swindler
I don't like what I'm hearing about you getting caught up in all this business between the mages and the templars.
You know how hard I've tried to keep you out of the Circle's sight.
Think of your sister. You don't want to bring the eye of the Circle down on her.
That creature Sten was horrifying enough, but a whole camp of them?
The viscount would do well to throw the lot of them back where they came from.
I've had word from Lothering. They are rebuilding. I don't know if I could ever return to the site of such horrors.
Is this dwarven venture truly the only way? I hate to think of you going willingly into the darkspawn's grasp.
Mother was all I had left.
I've no family now.
You don't really think that, do you?
So this is what it's like to be an orphan.
I'm an orphan.
Family's not just the people you're related to by blood. There are other people who care about you.
Like... Aveline.
Oh, look who's here! Time to change the locks again.
I knocked this time. Bodahn let me in.
That's private.
You only make the trip here when you want something. What is it this time?
Is everything all right?
Guess what? Castillon's in town, and I'm not waiting around for him to stick a knife in my vitals.
We're going to get him before he gets me.
Could Castillon be in Kirkwall for other reasons?
Not everything is about you.
Maybe, but that doesn't change anything. Better safe than sorry.
We're going to surprise Castillon? I love surprises.
Count me in.
That rule has served me well.
I agree.
Unfortunately, Castillon's holed up somewhere in Kirkwall. I haven't been able to find him.
I do know where Velasco is, however. That's his right hand. We just have to make him tell us where Castillon is.
Somehow.
So you're saying you don't have a plan.
Somehow?
I have something of a plan.
What a plan! Your scheming ability puts me to shame.
Brilliant!
Well, I haven't worked out all the kinks.
Step one, we go to Velasco. Step two, something exciting happens. Step three, profit!
Well, do you have a better idea?
If we kill him and search his body, we might find something.
We kill him?

Ser Alrik's Letter

To Her Excellency, Divine Justinia,
I am well aware both you and Knight-Commander Meredith have rejected my proposal, but I beg you to reconsider. The mages in the Free Marches are past controlling, their numbers have doubled in three years, and they have found a way to plant their abominations in our ranks. They cannot be contained!
The Tranquil Solution is our answer. All mages at the age of majority must be made Tranquil. They'll coexist peacefully, retain their usefulness—a perfect strategy! It's simply the best way to ensure mages obey the laws of men and Maker.
I remain, as always, your obedient servant, Ser Otto Alrik
Well?
Return to the suspicious lady in the Hanged Man tonight; let her know the raider captains are dead and their plans were overheard.
Return to the suspicious lady in the Hanged Man tonight and let her know the raider captains are dead.

As I suspected.

Let Aveline face her accusers.

That big man made every step of the story my choice.
I loved that.

Good. Feel it. Everything. Wallow in it.

Release her.

I don't care if he does, as long as he teaches me to do it, too.
You don't understand. Someone is after her. I had to keep her safe!

Uh... andaran atish'an, stranger.

Leave it. You won't need it.
I took her so he'd have to come to me. I was finally going to face my sister's killer, but then you showed up...

I sent the elven girl to the chantry. They can help her, I'm sure of it.

Even so, I gave her what little I had. Enough to put her on a ship to Ferelden and maybe carry her for a while.
After that she's on her own. I don't expect she'll do well.
Greetings, Master.
Greetings, Mistress.
Your home was difficult to find. I've never been out on my own before. But... I found it. Many people know of you.
I hope I've made myself useful. I've already begun cleaning, and I can cook... not as good as papa, but a little.
Is there... anything else you'd like me to do?
What sort of skills do you have?
What else can you do?
Not many, I fear.
The magister bade me to clean, and sometimes fetch... but papa told me to keep out of her sight much as I could.
But I can learn! I'll serve you well! Please don't hurt me.
You've been through a great deal. How are you feeling?
Are you all right?
I miss papa, the other servants. I... try not to think about what happened.
I even feel sorry for the magister. Is that bad?
Hadriana killed your father—for his blood! Why would you feel sorry for her?
She was evil.
She tried so hard! It was very difficult for her, trying to prove herself.
The other magisters laughed at her. I saw how it tore at her soul.
People don't think that slaves watch, but we do. I know what she did, but... I still ache that she's gone.
You served her a long time. I understand.
No, it's not bad.
I'm sure Hadriana was very thankful for such loyalty.
She wouldn't think so.
I... suppose she was.
I'll serve you just as well, Master, you'll see.
I'll serve you just as well, Mistress, you'll see.
If you're staying here, Orana, it will be as my servant.
I'm going to pay you.
You mean... I won't be a slave anymore?
You'll be paid, like anyone else.
I... a slave is all I've ever been, like papa and grandpapa before me.
I'll try to be a good servant. Thank you, Master. You're too good to me.
I'll try to be a good servant. Thank you, Mistress. You're too good to me.

You're doing fine.
Just do as I ask, Orana.
Do whatever I tell you.
Of course, Master. I'll do my very best.
Of course, Mistress. I'll do my very best.

Talk to my mother.

Of course.

Talk to Fenris.

Part of being free means deciding for yourself.
You're free.
Oh.

Take this coin.

Thank you so much. I'll... try my best to be free.
I'm sorry about your mama. I will miss her.

I hope all is well, Mistress.

Varric.

I've seen your evidence—scattered notes, conjecture, nothing remotely usable.
You can't expect us to act on your hunches alone. Look what happened when we did.

How do you know that he doesn't know that you know that he knows that you know, you know?
What?

Do you ever feel like you're part of a story that someone's telling?

My mother used to say there are a lot more mages now than when she was a child.
I think it's the lyrium in the water.
The truth is out there.
Hawke!

Oh?

I promise! If I go back there, I won't be alone.

Harlan's thinking of changing the name of the Blooming Rose to Harlan's Harlots.
The Qunari have been here for years. People are getting really nervous about that. I just know they're going to attack soon.
There's been a bunch of elves camped out on Sundermount for ages. People say they're starting a settlement.

Watch out for pirates and raiders, if you plan to travel by sea. The coast around the Free Marches is swarming with them.
People are real tense about the mages and templars. If they go to war, Kirkwall will be squashed in between.

Bless Elthina's heart. She's the only thing keeping Meredith from tearing Orsino apart.
There was a templar in here yesterday. Says Meredith's been spending more and more time alone in her office.
And if you walk by, it sounds like she's talking to herself. Strange, huh?
Some Qunari stragglers are lurking about outside the town. I hope someone does something about them.

Meh. I have people.
Wait... did you say people? Or peephole?

You'd think so, right? But... not so much.

I saw Meredith the other day. Scary.

Wow.
I'm distantly related to Viscount Dumar. My aunt's second husband's fourth, uh, eldest daughter once cleaned the viscount's privy.
Why is this place called the Hanged Man?
Because everytime someone asks a stupid question, we string them up from the rafters.
I hear Meredith makes blankets from the hair of dead mages, to keep her warm in winter.
You tried to help a friend. Surely no harm can come of that.
I wish I still had your innocence. There was too much hatred in me. Justice thought he would overcome that.
Did you hear about the gruesome laboratory the guard discovered under a Lowtown foundry?

Those Qunari are still waiting for a ship. Can you believe it? What's it been now, four years?
At least.
They're either lying about wanting to leave or they have very, very slow boats.

Why don't they, then?

If all the templars get killed fighting Qunari, who's going to watch over the mages?
This ale isn't as good as it used to be.
It was never good.
Oh. Well, maybe I'm not as drunk as I used to be, then.
Did you hear about what happened on Sundermount? The Champion killed every elf there!
I hear the ground cracked open and swallowed them whole.
Knight-Commander Meredith's gone a bit mad. I hear she sees enemies everywhere, these days.
Nonsense. Meredith's the best thing that's ever happened to this city. She keeps us safe.
I hear the Champion of Kirkwall's killed a dozen dragons and sleeps on a bed made from their bones.
And I hear she uses the Arishok's skull as a gravy boat.
And I hear he uses the Arishok's skull as a gravy boat.
You really believe everything you hear, don't you?
This is what Mother was protecting me from.
We would never turn someone over to the templars, Mistress. Never.
You spend a lot of time here, don't you?
Varric told me you found a pair of magical pantaloons in the Deep Roads. They glow when darkspawn are near.
Nice to see the Champion of Kirkwall isn't too proud to come to the Hanged Man.
How do you think Meredith keeps her skin so clear? Is it magic? I bet it's magic, isn't it? What a hypocrite.
I feel sorry for the mages sometimes, you know? What a terrible thing, to be used by everyone.
I wish some rich man would marry me and take me away from here. But this tavern's the worst place to meet men.
Did you really take on a dragon while naked, wielding nothing but a wooden spoon? Varric says you did.
I hate my job. I've been here years and all I've got to show for it is a sore back and blisters on my feet.
You should hear the stories Varric's telling about you. That man has a tongue of silver, I swear.

Devrona.

She was so sweet. I can't say one bad thing about her.

Greetings, Champion. May the Maker smile upon you.

The Champion himself! Hmm, I wonder if he's still looking for a wife.
The Champion herself. I hear she isn't married yet, either. Maybe there's still hope for Jatia.

Thank goodness.

Captain!

Champion.

Andraste's sanctified ass! Why would anyone make the ground vertical?
If we had a giant rock to push uphill, this would perfectly sum up my life.

Slave runners working out of the Undercity, yes. A whole nest.

I can try.

It's not.

I do have a life.

I enjoy a man with markings like that.

Not made of lyrium, I'd imagine.

So this relic you mentioned losing...
You have pretty eyes.

Oh, I would never try. Not without reason, of course.
Forget I said anything.
You keep staring at me. Is it my eyes again?

Now you're just making it challenging.
Do you intend to go after me, then?

Not this again.

Always close at hand. Always within reach. Glistening.

Mmmm.

Where I come from, we would call that insanity.
Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
I still can't believe Hawke saved you.
You've been saying that for years. Would you have turned me over to the qunari?

Pfft. Could I refuse?

Oh.
If you wish to thank Hawke, he's standing right there.
If you wish to thank Hawke, she's standing right there.

Yours are not made of lyrium.

Mine were carved into my flesh against my will, in a ritual I remember only for the agony it caused me.
I'm... so sorry.
I don't want your pity.
Are you talking to me?
You said you were sorry about the ritual I endured. Keep your sorrow.

You never come to the alienage, Fenris.

What?
