I thought all dwarves had beards. Where's yours?
I misplaced it, along with my sense of dwarven pride and my gold-plated noble caste pin.
I thought maybe it fell onto your chest.
Oh-ho! The broody elf tells a joke!
I don't brood.
Friend, if your brooding were any more impressive woman would swoon as you passed. They'd have broody babies in your honor.
You're a very odd dwarf.
And you thought I was joking about the pin.
So where's your beard, elf?
Elves don't grow beards.
Huh. I thought maybe you'd shaved it off in a fit of broody pique.
So you're a funny dwarf.
So you found your brother.
I did! Wasn't expecting that.
I assume there was a time when you and he were friends?
With Bartrand? No, just brothers. Occasionally he wasn't insufferable.
And yet you remained at his side.
Too bad he didn't do the same.
You know, if you need advice on how to lay low I can give you some.
Being short would make for an excellent start, I suspect.
Keep that up, serah, and you can keep on hiding like a rank amateur.
What would you suggest, Varric? Cower in the shadows like a rat?
You could try wearing something that didn't scream I hate you all I was a slave.
The markings would still show.
Really? Through anything? That's... kind of cool.
So who is Bianca?
My crossbow. Say hello, Bianca.
But why Bianca? You must have named her after someone.
Nope. Mirabelle was taken.
The way you fondle your weapon is disturbing.
Hey! I'm a perfect gentleman. In public.
I notice you hardly ever comment on mages and templars and such.
It's a lot of humans in skirts. I get them mixed up.
I highly doubt that. The subject comes up all the time.
Tell me about it.
And no opinion? One way or the other?
Opinions are like testicles. You kick them hard enough, doesn't matter how many you got.
That's... something.
Hello? Is Anders there? Can I speak to Anders?
You can stop yelling now. It's always me.
Oh, good. I didn't want to talk to that other guy. You know. The stick-in-the-mud.
He can still hear you. Justice and I are one.
Anyway, you wanted to talk to me?
Not really. I just wanted to make sure it was you.
I've been thinking about it, and you seem very familiar. It's like I've seen you somewhere before.
I get that a lot.
I've even been told I resemble the King of Ferelden.
Now that you mention it... Hmm, have you ever thought about using that to make a little coin?
I know where this is going, and no.
That's a shame. There must be women out there who'd love to hold the royal sceptre, even if it's just a look-alike.
Have you ever been to the Pearl? In Denerim?
Perhaps, in another life.
I knew it! I've seen you there, haven't I?
I admit to nothing.
So this relic you lost... how is it you don't know what it is?
It was in a box.
And you didn't open it? You managed to resist the urge to open a box to see what it contained?
It was locked! It was a locked box!
That hasn't stopped you before.
What do you want me to say?
Hmm, nothing. I just found it curious, that's all.
Isabela, do you even have an opinion about the mages?
Sure, I have an opinion. I don't feel a constant need to bring it up, however.
Humor me, please.
Fine.Sighs Mages don't worry me. I don't believe the templars when they say I should be worried.
I believe I'm more likely to be shanked in a bar, than eaten by an abomination. You can hear an abomination coming a mile away.
Grrr. Arrrrgghh! Oh, is that an abomination coming to eat us? We should get out of here!
Abominations don't go, Grrr. Arrgh.
They don't? I should rethink the whole thing then.
I don't know how you live the way you do, blithely ignoring the consequences of your actions.
This is about the qunari thing, isn't it? I'm not blithely ignoring what happened. I just recognize that it happened years ago.
There's this fantastic thing called moving on. You should try it sometime.
Has it occured to you that Kirkwall is only just recovering from the qunari attack?
And you want me to... what? Flog myself daily about it?
Has it occured to you that maybe there's no justice in the world? Except for that voice you keep in your head?
There is justice in the world.
Oh, is there? You want to free the mages. Let's say you do. Let's say you kill a bunch of innocent people while doing so.
What about justice for those innocent people? Don't they deserve justice just as much as the mages?
Yes.
And then what? Where does it end?
It's like being in a bar brawl, with people continuously being drawn into the fray until no one remembers why it started.
Justice is an idea. It makes sense in a world of ideas, and not in ours.
Do men find you intimidating? What about Wesley? Did he think you were intimidating?
Isabela...
What? Too soon?
Too soon, too inappropriate, too personal. Too... everything!
Ooh, sore spot, huh?
If you don't shut up, all that's left of you will be a sore spot.
You have such pretty hair. What a lovely color.
Other children used to laugh at me for having ginger hair.
Really? Aww. I bet you were cute. Did you have pigtails?
Sometimes.
How precious! Little Aveline, running around the village with her flaming orange pigtails streaming behind her...
... the little boys all scattering and screaming for mercy as she approached.
Shut up, whore.
How did you ever get to be so successful with men? You're not that pretty.
Cast a wide enough net, and you're bound to catch something.
Laughs At least you're willing to admit it.
Trust me, I've heard Get away from me, you ugly pirate hag! more times than I care to count.
Doesn't that bother you?
Why should it? They don't know me. I know me.
If I know who I am, does it matter what other people say?
You're right.
About?
About knowing who you are.
I'm the Captain of the Guard. I'm a warrior. I'm loyal, strong and I don't look too bad naked.
Exactly. And if I called you a mannish, awkward, ball-crushing do-gooder, you'd say...?
Shut up, whore.
That's my girl.
You didn't come for my solstice dinner party.
Look at you! Dinner parties, cooking... do you have a lace apron yet, or should I get one for you?
Don't change the subject. I sent you an invitation and you didn't show up.
I thought it would be... I mean, I don't know. I just don't do family gatherings.
Besides, one day you and Donnic will have children and I'll be the last person you want around them.
Can you imagine all the awkward question's you'll have to answer? Mother, what's a slattern?
I'll just point at you and go, That's a slattern.
How's marriage been treating you, big girl?
It's been good. No, great. I'd forgotten what it was like to...
Be flipped arse over tits and hammered like a bent nail?
To. Be. Loved.
Oh. Right, of course.
Not that I'm complaining about that other thing.
So you've... been with women. In bed?
I know. Shocking, isn't it?
You see, sweetness, men are only good for one thing. Women are good for six.
Six? Which six?
Isabela!
Laughs
Hessarian's Spear. That's the book you were reading this morning. I don't think Hessarian had a spear in the legends.
He does in this one. Read the description.
Andraste knelt before no man but her Maker. But she hadn't counted on the Archon Hessarian.
Can Hessarian penetrate the tight-knit defenses of the warrior-prophetess? Will she be prepared to face the full blast of his... power?
Wait a minute... Isabela! This is a vulgar thing!
You don't want to borrow it?
No!
You sure? It has pictures!
Not listening! I'm not listening!
You look like a man I once dueled.
He was a little intimidated by my reputation as a vicious pirate, but rose to the challenge.
He looked like me, you say?
It went on all night, under the stars, the waves lapping at our ankles.
On the beach? In the surf? How did you get proper footing?
We didn't. There was quite a bit of tumbling around, and we were soaked and sore by the time the sun came up.
Did you... win?
I managed to get on top towards the end, but I'd consider it a tie.
You know, when you say you're a duelist, what do you really mean?
Why is it always about sex with you?
It's not. Sometimes it's about sex with other people.
You see? It comes up, every single time we talk.
We're just talking, Carver. If it comes up, that's not my fault.
What? I mean... that's not what I meant. It... it doesn't!
I hate you so much.
So you freed a group of slaves.
Would-be slaves. They weren't slaves yet.
Still, you did the right thing. Many would turn a blind eye.
Don't read too much into it, all right? It just seemed a good idea at the time.
So what's with that magical fisting thing you do?
I'm... sorry?
You know, when you stick your hand into people.
Oh. That. Yes. It's a... talent.
You could make so much coin with that.
This one time, I was sailing to Llomerryn, and there was a fight between two of my men.
It was over a dice game, or the last piece of toast, or something. Sailors—they're touchy about their toast.
Is this going anywhere?
It will if you let me finish.
So, Jim and Hatecastle are in a knife fight, and Jim sticks Hatecastle right in the shoulder. The blade breaks off.
So now Hatecastle's got a knife-blade stuck in his shoulder, and we're out at sea.
If you were there, you could've just reached out and plucked that blade, right from his flesh.
That's your whole point?
Pretty much.
So I hear you think mages should be free.
Everyone should be free. Not just mages.
Not everyone's dangerous.
It's not about who's dangerous. It's about having choices made for you, because you were born a certain way.
Don't you wish you had a choice in whether you had lyrium stuck under your skin?
I do.
Sighs This is silly. I don't want to argue.
You seem especially broody today.
Does it bother you? Should I stop?
No, don't stop. Though I was just wondering if you could add a bit of smoulder to the brooding. Just for me.
Smoulder?
Oh, and while you're at it, perhaps throw in some cold insolence. Thanks!
You want me to smoulder and be cold at the same time? You know these things don't go together?
Shush. Don't distract me with your logic.
That night... I can't stop thinking about it.
Well then, I'll see you later.
That was direct.
I thought I'd get straight to the point. Were you expecting flowers or something?
Don't be silly.
Then I'll see you tonight.
Do you really like sailing?
Like it? No. I love it. The salt spray on my face, the wind whipping by my ears, the gulls screaming overhead—I love it all.
Don't you get sick? I was so sick on our trip across the sea.
Were you in the hold?
Everyone was in the hold.
There's your problem. You need to be up on deck, under the sky, with nothing between you and the horizon.
It's like sex. Do it wrong and it'll make you sick and maybe even kill you.
But do it right and there's no feeling in the world quite like it.
It's not always fun and games on the sea though. There are storms, and hostile pirates.
And it's trying being on a ship with a bunch of men who haven't seen a woman in months.
You're a woman.
No, besides me. I don't let them touch me, so they get... frustrated.
I insist that all of them get alone time. It helps with the crankiness.
But they're already lonely! Why would you insist that they be alone some more? That's cruel!
Merrill.
What? Did I miss something?
Go think about it. Maybe it'll come to you.
You and Hawke... there's something there, isn't it?
She's so amazing and beautiful... how could anyone not love her?
He's clever, strong and wonderful. How could anyone not love him?
How could anyone not?
You're very quiet today. Is something wrong?
Gasps It's me. I said something wrong, didn't I?
No, of course not! You could never say anything wrong.
I'm happy for you, Kitten. You've been alone long enough.
Oh, I could give you a list, but that might just bore you.
So... did you get naked?
Isabela!
Ooh, look at that blush. That good, huh?
Sighs Why do you even like me? I must seem so dull.
What? What brought this on?
Your... your life has been so exciting. The adventures, the duels, the passionate love-affairs.
Compared to that, my life is like a stale, dry biscuit. Sighs I wish I had your life.
No, you don't. You don't want my life.
Why?
Because you have a good heart, and you deserve better.
You've had many lovers, haven't you?
Fewer than some think.
But you never stay with them.
No, why should I?
But the act of love-making is so... intimate.
I don't make love. What I do is only skin-deep, Kitten.
Don't worry your pretty little head about it.
Why are you smiling?
No reason.
Ooh, ooh! It's something dirty, isn't it? Tell me, tell me!
It... it isn't anything dirty for once. I'm just... happy.
Oh. That's good too, but I was hoping for something dirty.
Come by the tavern later. I've got stories that will make your toes curl.
Rivaini, stop looking at my chest. My eyes are up here.
But the chest hair...
Do you know how much I suffer under your gaze? I am a person, not an object!
Uh, Varric?
Laughs Just shitting you. Ogle away, Sunshine.
I'll let you run your fingers through it, if you want.
Your chest hair? My fingers? Oh, Varric, stop. You're making me quiver.
You know you want to.
Oh, I do... I can't resist you. No woman can.
I know. It's a terrible burden, but someone has to bear it.
Oh, yes, come to me and I'll take you to places you've never been...
Isabela. Are you talking to Bianca?
I think she deserves to feel a woman's touch on her trigger, don't you?
Bianca responds to my touch. She'd never give it up for you.
That's what they always say. And I always prove them wrong.
Stop it. You're confusing her. And me.
Psst. I've got some of it written down now.
Give it here.
Her breasts strained against the leather jerkin, like two wild stallions corralled against their will. Chuckles
She pounced—the smooth moves of a jungle cat—and locked her thighs around Donnic's waist. He—
What?
Nothing.
What is that?
Shh! Giggles
Isabela just thought she'd celebrate your love-affair with a... written dedication.
It's friend-fiction! I do it out of love!
I feel like I will never, ever be clean again.
Maybe you should read the rest of it in private.
I think that's best.
Varric, how does one get made a Paragon?
The Assembly votes on it. If you get enough votes—BAM!—you're a living god.
You should ask to be made a Paragon. Of manliness.
I like the way you think, Rivaini. But one doesn't just ask to be made a Paragon.
Why not? Everyone can see you're a paragon of manliness, it's just a matter of making it official.
After all this, going back to the life of a pirate's going to be a little dull, isn't it?
You have a point. I might have to kidnap the queen of Antiva to amuse myself.
And which part of that would you find amusing? The kidnapping, or the queen?
The kidnapping. I hear the queen's a sour-faced toad.
I hear good things about you, Anders. Not what I expected.
From a mage, you mean.
I didn't say that.
How else would you judge me? What else am I a shining example of?
I don't know... other Fereldans lurking in Darktown? Mage or not.
You... have a fair point.
I could use your consult, Anders.
Bring it to Darktown, and I'll get you a salve or something.
What? No! I need to know some things about mages.
Why?
I'm a guard. I'm the first person who has to deal with... trouble.
You want help killing people like me.
Not every mage can be trusted.
Nor every guard.
You're glaring, Anders. Is there a reason, or is it one of your moods?
Your term as captain hasn't been particularly mage friendly.
I've only turned a handful over to the templars.
Every despot starts somewhere.
And yet I allow an abomination to whine at me! Credit where it's due.
So you're two people, Anders and... Justice?
That's not strictly accurate.
But you are of two minds.
Many people are.
Now you're the one not being accurate.
I thought those were the rules of this game.
I never know who I'm talking to with you.
Then it's fortunate it doesn't occur often.
I have to admit, Anders. Of the mages I know, you're the one I expected to go out in a blaze.
The day is young.
It was a compliment, you ass.
No, it wasn't.
Out of your element, Bethany?
I thought Kirkwall would be a new start, but it seems like such an unforgiving place.
It's changed hands more than once. They're careful about their borders.
It's hard to think of us as that kind of threat.
Looked at your sister lately?
Looked at your brother lately?
There is that.
You show admirable restraint, Bethany.
For a mage, you mean.
I could also say for a Hawke, but yes, for a mage.
You have a sword. Why aren't you killing someone right now?
Fair point, but I can put my sword down.
Believe me, I have tried.
I'm sorry I couldn't get you more information about the Circle, Bethany. It's difficult without naming you.
Thank you for being discreet. I don't want the templars at my door.
No one does.
Let them corral the troublemakers. I just want information.
Right. Right.
It sounds like I'm trying to convince myself, doesn't it?
I wouldn't have said. But yes.
Don't worry, sweetie. You'll be fine now. No more living in the streets.
But Madam Lusine said...
Oh, that old cow never carries through on her threats. You're safe with us.
No unnecessary violence, Carver.
Tell that to my sister.
She knows. She may not listen, but she knows.
Tell that to my brother.
He knows. He may not listen, but he knows.
But I need special supervision, is that it?
Yes.
All... all right then.
I don't like some of the people you've been associating with, Carver.
Talk to my sister. She's the one in charge.
Talk to my brother. He's the one in charge.
Maybe, but I know you get around.
Who says I don't mean her too?
Who says I don't mean him too?
This city's full of people who are dead set on ending badly. I don't want to see you end up the same way.
Would asking you to stop spying on me help in the least?
No.
So, Carver, have you thought about what you'll do if your expedition doesn't pay off?
This is our only chance and you know it.
You're so damned proud you couldn't pick up a trade?
And who would take a Fereldan apprentice? Maybe in another year I could work my way up to piss-boy.
Fine, let's crawl down some holes. Good bloody luck for your sake.
What should I be doing?
You just have to look pretty, dear.
I remember you! The kind one!
Well, well, if it isn't our favorite little guardsman.
Here to make sure we aren't stealing from the viscount again?
That was a mistake. I've already apologized enough.
Please keep it quiet, serah. The viscount mustn't be disturbed.
Good day to you, serah.
A quiet day, today, isn't it?
Are you safe, Fenris?
No.
You know, some guards give people the opportunity to lie if it will keep the peace.
You can see what I am. Lie to yourself if you must.
You are known, Fenris.
What?
I'm going through Jeven's neglected reports. Some involve you. And requests about you.
By whom?
I don't know. They're old, poorly kept. But you should be on your best behavior.
Thank you for getting rid of them.
I didn't.
All right, I'm just going to say it. Fenris, you need to present yourself better.
What are you talking about?
You're squatting in Hightown. I sympathize with your claims, but your neighbors have influence.
My claims?
To the estate. Rightfully stolen isn't exactly something I can forward to the viscount. Be more discreet about... yourself.
I shall endeavor to exist with less offense.
Fenris, did you consider my offer for you to train the guard in Tevinter fighting techniques? I've heard nothing.
My abilities were inflicted, not taught. I will not pass that on.
Some good should come of them.
No.
Do you feel like a citizen, Fenris?
Excuse me?
You've been in Kirkwall as long as I have. Does it feel like home?
It feels. That itself has been a surprise.
I think I know what you mean.
I think I had a chance for that and missed it.
I have no comparison, really. It feels like a free place.
Maybe that’s enough.
We shall see.
There's a war coming. Does it feel different, fighting by choice?
You were never ordered to kill?
I was a soldier, but I was willing.
I was willing, as well, but not by choice. Laughs If that makes any sense.
Does anything in this mess?
So, Isabela. You're a captain?
That's right, big girl. What of it?
I don't remember your name on any registries. Every ship that docks has to declare.
I never docked, and you're no port authority.
And you... are no merchant.
Ooh... scrutiny.
Well. Captain. Can I call you captain? You can call me captain.
I won't be doing that.
Neither will I. Because you're a guard captain. No real authority. Not like on a ship.
Well, you would know about having a large number of men under you.
You've been waiting to use that one. Did you practice?
Shut up.
I had trouble with another of your women, Isabela. She stole from a... distracted client. You're lucky she wasn't jailed.
My women? I am but a shepherd. And what free enterprise are you oppressing now?
Theft is not enterprise.
Opportunities insufficiently guarded. Victimless crimes.
Except for all the victims.
Details. Victimless details.
So, how good is Donnic? Is he cocksure?
Sighs Just... get it out of your system.
Did he curl your toes?
Pudding your peach?
Dwarf your beard?
Grope your grinder?
Dampen your Divine?
Float your frigate?
Arl your Eamon?
Pamper your Paragon?
Kaddis your Katie?
Shank your Jory?
Gray your Warden?
Establish his canon?
Praise your Maker?
Or master your taint? That's an old one.
How about satisfy a demand of your Qun.
Or did he Cup your Joining?
Yes, all right? He is an incredibly proficient lover. Happy?
Well that's rather personal, don't you think?
You know, Isabela. If someone had told me that I'd put up with you for all these years, I'd have punched them flat.
And if someone had told me you'd leave first, I'd have called them daft.
Don't celebrate yet. It'll take time.
Do I look like I'm smiling, big girl?
Don't bullshit me with “respected rival” garbage now. You're not sorry to see me go.
No. But I'm sorry you gave up.
And if someone had told me I'd still be here, I'd have done the same.
You have your ship. What’s stopping you?
Save your bits, you'll have your ship one day.
And what would you do without me as a constant headache in the Rose?
Someone would rush to fill the hole. You know, like you never left.
That’s my girl.
I don't know what I'm supposed to do...
Sweetie, it's an easy job. You can do it asleep. They never notice. And some of them enjoy it more that way. Creeps.
Varric, do you do anything?
Am I the next stop in your career evaluations? Joy of joys.
You watch and you talk. Is that it?
You are dismissing hallmarks of both the utterly ineffectual and the incredibly dangerous.
I don't know what you mean.
It means coins flow when I talk and when I shut up. Like if you got paid to guard or unguard.
That makes no sense.
Good.
Maybe I should put you to use, Varric. Have you pen some warnings for the lawless.
Who’s that for? Are most criminals big readers? Seems like pacifying the nobles.
Pictures then. It was just a suggestion.
How about a giant sign that just says Don't. You could hit people with it.
Thank you, I get the point.
You, Varric, have a very large mouth.
And here I've always looked up to you. What is it now?
There were fistfights in the barracks over who is the model for your guard serial.
Hard in Hightown. Riveting stuff. Everyone loves a dirty guard on the edge.
Varric.
Fine. I'll start his big finish. Three chapters until Donnen Brennicovick retires and opens a tavern on the coast.
You are very close to losing your printing blocks, Varric.
Once more I am falsely accused of whatever it is that I am accused of. Falsely.
Someone swapped the text of my recruitment poster with some filth from the Blooming Rose.
That does sound pretty good.
Sure, fill the barracks with whores. But you've also filled the Rose with guards.
It’s true what they say. The best comedy comes from tragedy.
You're too quiet, Varric.
I'm thinking of switching to romances. Nothing? Not even a foreboding frown?
I am content. Write what you will.
Well that certainly takes the fun out of it. Contentment in the barracks? Who'll pay to hear that shit?
Then I should have thought of it years ago.
Do what you will. I don't care.
That is... not a comforting thought.
It is what it is. I'm used to it.
I think we've both lost some inspiration.
How are you at finales, Varric?
I'm expecting some practical experience fairly soon.
Make it a good one, will you?
For you, madam, endless sunsets and roses.
Varric.
And the swift hand of the law sweeping all aside. I thought it went unsaid.
Can't get enough? Well, who can, really?
This encounter will have a high challenge rating, big boy.
Well, aren't you adventurous? Let's get you some experience, sweetie...
I don't care how much that man pays, I am not rubbing Hubert's feet again until he bathes! Disgusting.
Templars for you all day, is it?
Scoffs Elves!
They love dwarves. I don't ask why. Probably don't want to know. At least they tip well.
The way this place attracts templars, you'd think it was full of apostates.
It should be searched. Thoroughly.
It's not entirely your fault, darling.
I should never have let him learn to cut purses...
Did you take the perfume out of my room?
What would I want with perfume? Do I look like a woman?
Of course you do, sweetie—you're an elf. And not a pretty one, I'm afraid, but there it is.
I haven't seen the seneschal much lately. Don't tell me the man's gone religious.
No, he just keeps terrible hours now.
Let's hope it stays that way.
Cora and Katriela are being horrible to my boy! Can't you stop them?
Quintus! Can't I have just one drink?
Madam says no, and I'm not crossing that old bat for anything.
Fetch mummy a glass of wine, won't you darling?
You'd better tip this time.
If they want to waste their time disciplining your useless brat, let them.
I do hope the viscount remembers to eat supper today.
That corner looks dusty. How embarrassing.
Don't you threaten my boy, you skinny hag! I'll have you sacked!
Madam doesn't give a rat's ass about your brat. She pays me a copper every time I kick the little bastard.
No servants to blame for theft today, good Garol?
Day's still young. Servant.
Why do you get paid more than me?
The guard wouldn't have taken my boy if you'd just been decent to him!
Because I'm better than you. At everything.
You mean if I hadn't yelled, Stop! Thief when he stole my wages? Fat chance, sweetie.
I heard you were invited to the Keep last night.
Hightown is such a strange place. It feels like it's miles away from everywhere else.
Good luck getting in. I've been waiting all day.
How much longer do I have to wait?
You there. Some wine. I'll not wait around all day without proper refreshments.
Yes, messere. I'll have some sent right up.
Oh, and bring me some cheese, too. I'm starving.
You do realize it's rude to keep people waiting for so long.
The viscount means no disrespect, he's a very busy man.
Oh, shut it. I don't need a servant to explain the duties of nobility to me.
Messere. Please stop kicking the wall.
Who are you to talk to me like that, you bloody peasant?
The guard who'll throw you out if you kick that wall one more time.
What are you doing out of the alienage?
Simply running an errand, messere!
That's my next stop, I promise!
Right away, messere.
Scat!
I see you picking pockets, you're done!
Gasps
I'm not afraid of you!
I haven't done nothing!
Little early for you to be out, isn't it?
Don't you worry about me, messere.
Oh, I can handle myself!
Looking for a discount, hmm?
No luck today?
Day's early!
I'm resting. Don't you mind me.
Laughs Not yet!
You be careful, serah.
Of you, maybe.
Don't you make me bring you in again.
Shove off, you.
Maybe later, darling.
Go back to the alienage. Now!
I'm simply running an errand, messere!
That's my next stop, I promise!
Right away, messere.
The alienage, Sundermount, Ferelden... those could be from a dream.
Oh, ma vhenan, I didn't see you there. I'm going to visit the alienage. Do you want anything from Lowtown?
There's nothing in that cesspit I want.
No, I don't.
Are you close to many of the people in the alienage?
Visiting friends there?
I almost miss Lowtown. I haven't had my pocket picked in ages.
Say hi to the beggars for me.
It's not so bad. Better than Darktown! Or the Gallows!
No, not really. I think most of them don't even know my name.
It's such a friendly gesture, sticking your hand in someone else's pocket. The Dalish are never that familiar.
I'm... stopping by my house for a bit, that's all.
I've left some things undone there. I'll be back later.
The viscount must be terribly busy. I've been waiting most of the day.
I wonder if I should try coming back tomorrow?
I don't mean to bother you, but would I be able to get some water?
Of course, my lady. Are you hungry as well? I can have a plate brought up.
Oh, that would be lovely.
My lady, you've been so patient. Is there something I can get for you?
Oh, no. I'm quite all right. It's my own fault for not bringing something to do.
Just let me know if you need anything.
You go to the alienage almost every day.
You spend too much time there.
Whatever you're doing, watch yourself, Merrill.
Be careful.
If you'd just move in all your stuff, you wouldn't have to keep going there.
Just bring your stuff here.
So, Donnic was in the Rose.
He was not!
Easy, big girl. He wasn't shopping for himself. You're lucky to have a man who wants to please you.
But, maybe you could indulge him more. Are there areas of intimacy you haven't explored?
Why? Why do you give me these doubts!
Aveline. If you shove your thumb up his ass, I win.
Good. Happy for him. He needs to calm down.
You're tough on the man. I don't see how it's his fault if you missed your chance.
Isabela, I realize that you are always prepared for a sudden random phallus, but for your own safety, shut your mouth!
Don't just leave me waiting. What is it?
There's a killer in Kirkwall who sends his victims white lilies before he takes them. He's murdered several women already.
There's nothing wrong with that. I am an elf, in case you've forgotten.
I... will. Thank you, ma vhenan.
It's better if... some things stay far away from this house.
Back before dark, I promise.
All right. The boy and I will stay here in case she returns.
Note
I know someone who might be able to help: Gascard DuPuis.
Note
Note
We're going to win.
Don't be nervous. Things are going so well!
I guess I shouldn't be surprised that nothing turned out the way I'd hoped.
Especially not... with you.
Maybe I was. It's none of your business where my business goes.
Mother!
There's nothing to be done. The magic that kept her alive...
There's nothing I can do. His magic was keeping her alive.
His magic was the only thing keeping her alive. I'm so sorry.
I knew you would come.
I tried to find you.
I wasn't fast enough.
Don't move, Mother. We'll find a way to...
I'm going to save you.
You know me. I always save the day.
Don't I always?
Shh. Don't fret, darling.
That man would have kept me trapped in here. But now... I'm free.
I'll be with Carver and Bethany... and your father. But you'll be all alone.
I get to see Bethany again... and your father. But you'll be here alone.
I get to see Carver again... and your father. But you'll be here alone.
I should have watched over you more closely, I should have...
I failed you.
Goodbye, Mother.
I'll remember you as you were.
I'll miss you.
Say hello to them for me.
I'll be fine, Mother.
Don't worry about me.
My little girl has become so strong.
I love you. You've always made me so proud.
Can't you take that Amell fellow? Just once?
He likes you better. Asks for you by name. And isn't the customer always right?
What's your secret?
Pardon?
You're paid more than anyone else in the Rose. Even Quintus! How'd you do it?
Dwarves are irresistible. I can't help it.
Wait, wait... you say you saw Leandra?
I did. What of it?
Blue dress? Grey hair? Her cloak was brown, I think. She holds it closed with a round brooch, silver with... with garnets.
Let's go sheath that weapon of yours.
Do you want to take another look at my ditties?
Wanting to get in touch with nature, I see.
My little boy has become so strong.
A Slave's Life
Did you bathe this time, Master Amell? I've had... complaints.
Of course I have! A few days ago.
The Champion? Here?
It's the captain? Are we ready for this?
Go on up, ser. They're waiting.
Fine day, serah.
Hope the day is treating you well, serah.
You speak to me as if I'm touched in the head.
You mean you aren't?
What's your excuse, then?
A fine day, isn't it, Chel?
Indeed, it is, Garol.
Ugh. Find yourselves a broom closet for the next five minutes and leave me in peace.
Blade of Mercy
He didn't really ask you to wear a feather boa!
What's the matter, my love?
Orlesians, darling. You get used to it.
Look at this mess. Quentin's clearly insane.
Don't you see what he's done?
Insane... but powerful.
Tell me the truth: Am I losing my chest hair?
You'll still be pretty, even if you do.
I was thinking of changing my hairstyle.
That's brilliant! You have had this one for seven years now.
Back for more?
Got quite the spear, haven't you?
One of us won't be able to walk away from this.
I keep telling Lusine, once they go dwarf, they never go back.
Looking to explore the Deep Roads, are you?
You made the only reasonable choice.
That did not just happen.
That... was definitely not what I was expecting.
Note to self: be more specific when asking for something different.
I swear, I'm not making this up. He actually said, Exalted March of the Dales.
Greetings, serah.
So good to see you again.
You seem to be in good spirits.
May I say you're looking lovely today?
Everything well with your family, I hope?
A new family arrived from the Starkhaven alienage. Have you heard?
Isn't it exciting? I hope they have a young daughter my son can meet.
I found a job down at the docks today, sweeping the warehouses.
Oh, you're quite lucky!
Oh, hello!
Everything is well with you?
Greetings.
You're looking good.
Thank you! We should get our families together soon.
I trust your family is in good health?
So far, thank the Maker.
There's to be a marriage next week, have you heard?
I have! We're going to decorate the vhenadahl tomorrow evening.
Is your husband still looking for work?
I'm afraid so. Andraste willing, he'll find something soon.
Blessed be all the Maker's children, even those who struggle against His wisdom.
Greetings, child. I hope to see you at the chantry soon?
I will bring my whole family if I can, messere.
We all know the guard hurt that poor girl, but will anyone do anything?
I can't believe a Keeper came to the city! I've never heard of such a thing!
Such a terrible tragedy. So many elves, gone.
Huon killed so many people, and yet nobody seems to care.
Sighs Another day...
Maker bless us with His wisdom.
Our children will do better than us. One day.
I wonder what Hightown's like.
I need four more dwarven ales.
Right, drinks. Coming. Sit.
Are you messing up my orders on purpose? I said Nevarran red, not Orlesian!
What's wrong with the new girl?
First-day jitters. She'll be fine.
Pumpkin, it's all going to the same place in the end. Tell the customer to be a little more worldly.
What can I get for you?
Another one?
I'll put that on your tab.
Back for more?
Why don't we go upstairs and see how exalted this march will be?
Oh, if it were up to me, I'd have done this for free.
You think that's bad? Mine wanted me to dress up like the viscount.
Oh, that's just sick. Politics should stay out of the bedroom.
Do you think Lusine will hire one of those oxmen?
Lusine would hire the Maker, if He returned.
She'd try. But she's so cheap, she'd never afford him.
The city's going mad. I might head for Orlais before things get worse.
I'd love to go to Orlais, but I'll never afford it.
Forget Orlais. At least go to to Cumberland. Anything is better than this place.
You can wear the collar this time.
Are you a warrior? You're carrying quite the sword.
I'll join your party.
Why hello there!
Busy today, I see?
Good to see you again.
The boys and I are going for drinks later, if you'd like to join us.
Don't mind if I do! See you there.
Your wife is over her sickness, I hope?
The worst is over. I pray she'll get better soon; I've missed too much work already.
I don't suppose you've heard of any work?
Not yet. The shem who oversees the docks says he doesn't want any more knife ears than necessary.
Bloody shems. We work as well as anyone else.
Will I see you at the tavern later?
Not today. My sisters have me decorating the vhenadahl.
Roped you in, did they? Well, good luck!
Oh, hello!
Good to see you again, my dear.
Greetings.
You kept my brother out far too late last night.
Laughs He's an adult now, isn't he? But I promise I'll be more careful.
My cousin said he might have a job for you. Thought you should know.
Did he? I'll have to speak with him soon. Thank you!
The priest was asking after you again last week.
I've brought my family there twice this year. What more does she want from us?
How is your wife doing? Still recovering?
The weakness comes and goes, but I'm hoping for the best. Thank you for asking.
You knife ears should go back to the alienage, that's what.
Drunken shem.
Bloody elves.
Maker watch over you, serah.
Greetings, serah. I have not seen you at the chantry in some time.
I must find work, messere, and my wife has been very ill.
The Maker will not wait for you. You must find the time for Him.
Yes, messere. Of course.
Nobody is doing anything to avenge that girl. Well, something will be done! We'll see to it!
A Keeper in the alienage? Unbelievable!
They should've killed Huon. Then he'd never have gotten out at all.
Bloody humans. They can keep their Maker, that's what.
I swear, I should bring my family out to those Dalish.
Sighs Who am I kidding?
Hopefully I can find work soon. There has to be something!
Those are some fine amulets you have.
They aren't all simply amulets, messere. Some are magical!
These rings are so expensive!
A bargain at any price! And some are enchanted.
Quite a collection of amulets.
Indeed it is, messere! Try one on!
What sorts of rings are those?
Some come from the master jewelsmiths of Minrathous. I can show you if you like!
Champion! Surely you have need of something.
My good man! Might you have need of a new belt?
A ring for your lovely wife, yes?
My good woman! Perhaps you'd like a new amulet to wear?
Come! See my collection for yourself!
These prices cannot be beat! I swear it in Andraste's name!
Come, messere! Don't be shy!
By all means, see if there's something that takes your fancy!
I am always willing to haggle.
I would like to know more about being a guard, Aveline.
I don't think that's the job for you.
I know, but it might help me not get caught.
You probably shouldn't have said that part.
Why?
Just... never mind.
Why don't you arrest us, Aveline?
What?
We break the law. I'm pretty sure. There are laws for almost everything. You're not a bad guard, are you?
No!
That's good. Is it because you're fond of Hawke? I kind of am.
How very nice for you. Keep it to yourself.
I'd rather keep it with her.
I'd rather keep it with him.
That's good. You look uncomfortable. Did I say something wrong again?
No, Merrill, that's fine.
Ah. Maybe it's your shoes.
You're incredibly talented, Merrill. I can see you are meant for great things.
Thank you!
But you're stupid.
I'm sorry, what?
Don't you think it would be better to work on where you are now, instead of recreating old glory?
No. No, that's kind of the opposite of what I've been saying. I'm the stupid one? Whatever.
Giggles
Yes?
Is it like you thought? It's nice, isn't it? He seems nice.
Yes, he's very nice.
I know! And you're so cute when you're with him! Not like normal-you at all!
Haven't you got something unholy to do?
No, we're following Hawke. That's important, too.
Aveline, what's in your mirror?
What do you mean?
In your mirror. What do you see?
A warrior. A wife. All the mistakes I made to get here and make it right.
A Guardian. All the people I protect. Doubt, sometimes.
Why? What have you decided to see?
My mirror is broken. But I think... I think I see good things.
Maybe a headband.
Demons. And... cracks.
Sometimes it's hard to tell. Cracks, mostly.
Maybe I'll borrow yours sometime. If that's all right?
It's all right.
I didn't expect you to stick around for this mess, Merrill. This has nothing to do with your elves.
I love Hawke. I wouldn't go anywhere.
But it's not your fight.
I love Hawke.
You said that.
I say it a lot. It makes things clearer. Takes away doubt when everything is crazy and people are dying.
I understand.
Oh good. Someone should.
What about you? You're quitting!
That's complicated.
Not if I understand it. You're walking away, like... like everyone does.
Sometimes, it's the best choice.
It's the easiest. You're supposed to do the hard stuff. That's why... I liked you.
It shouldn't be. Not when people need you. I don't want to give up like that.
Sometimes they give up on you.
Friends don't do that. I wouldn't.
Everything affects everything. We were born, a bunch of things happened, and now we're in a mess with our friends.
That seems too simple.
Simple is good. It sneaks up on you, makes you smile.
Or maybe it says, Hey, over there! And kills with a pin.
Merrill?
Simple, Aveline. Not stupid.
Maybe that should be enough once in a while.
Simple it is.
Do you even know her name, shem? No? It's Danyla. She's dead.
And you killed her!
I was a beast then. A werewolf. I did... many terrible things. I-I'm sorry.
It didn't have to come to this.
Take this. And thanks.
She was crazy. Just insane.
Thank you. She would've killed me!
Sorry does not bring my mother back!
I was a victim, too, elf. Of Zathrian's vengeance. Stranger, please calm her down.
Did I hear you right? You're a werewolf?
A werewolf?
I was one, but no longer. Her Dalish Keeper cursed some humans with lycanthropy long ago.
The disease spread over the years. But the Hero of Ferelden freed us.
I'm not a werewolf. How many times do I have to say it? Y-you're crazy.
Lies!
Help! This crazy elf is going to kill me!
He doesn't look like a werewolf, Dalish. He seems harmless.
You think he's a werewolf?
He hides in human form. Do not let him fool you.
P-please. She's scaring me.
Let him go.
He was cursed. You can't blame him for that.
You have the wrong man.
You stand up for him?
Fine. Then you will die for him!
Do what you will.
He's all yours.
You better be right, or you're killing an innocent.
Run, shem. It will make the hunt more enjoyable.
Is this what your mother would want?
Don't do this.
You shame me. My mother... would not want this.
Leave, shem. Before I change my mind.
You ever going to stop harping on the mages here?
No.
They aren't what you saw in Tevinter.
The moment they are free, mages will make themselves magisters.
They're slaves! You should want to help them!
I don't.
So, there must be mages in Tevinter who don't use blood magic.
Of course. There are slaves. The magisters do not hesitate to collar their own kind.
But no magisters?
Why must you go on about this? No magister would turn down an advantage over his rivals. If he did, he'd be dead.
You know, to use blood magic, you need to look a demon in the eye and accept his offer.
I just figured some of them would say no. For esthetic reasons, if nothing else.
Is there something you want, Anders?
You really don't have the temperament for a slave.
Is that a compliment or an insult?
I'm just wondering how your master didn't kill you.
How have the templars not killed you?
I'm charming.
Did you ever think about killing yourself?
I could ask you the same thing.
I'm serious. To get out of slavery, to escape Danarius... don't tell me you never thought about it.
I did not. To kill oneself is a sin in the eyes of the Maker.
I try to. Some things must be worse than slavery.
Some things are worse than death.
Do you still support the knight-commander?
I don't care a fig for her. But she's the only one holding back the madness in this city.
Holding back? She's howling at the bloody moon!
Even her own people think she's lost it.
What will it take for you to see that she's crazy?
Mages in glass houses shouldn't throw fireballs.
You were an idiot to leave Hawke.
And you were fast enough to replace me.
I love her.
I love him.
You can't even imagine what that is.
Do not bare your heart to me, mage. Unless you would see me rip it out.
I can't imagine what Hawke sees in you.
It is done. Leave it be.
Well, good. I always knew she had some sense.
Well, good. I always knew he had some sense.
Do not make light of this. Leaving was the hardest thing I've ever done.
Oh, will you two get over yourselves?
I did her, too.
I did him, too.
You're like two dogs around a bitch in heat.
We were talking about Hawke. Not you.
Templar Archer
You're Fereldan, right? Ever spend time at the Pearl?
That's it!
You used to really like that girl with the griffon tattoos, right? What was her name?
The Lay Warden?
That's right! I think you were there the night I—
Oh! Were you the runaway mage who could do that electricity thing? That was nice...
I don't think I need to know this about either of you.
Please stop talking. Now.
Handcuffs, whipped cream, always be on top?
I never used to give two bits what anyone thought of me.
Justice once asked me why I didn't do more for other mages. I told him it was too much work.
But I couldn't go back after that. Couldn't stop thinking about it.
Sometimes, I miss being that selfish.
Huh? Were you talking? I was still at whipped cream.
About what?
Anything? Everything? I can't figure you out.
This place feels strange. Wrong.
You've been here before, haven't you?
Haven't we been here before?
This is where you found the human remains all those years ago. We should've known there was something else here.
I wonder if we'll find more than just a sack of bones this time.
Don't you remember? You found Ninette's hand here.
I found Ninette's hand and the sack of human remains here three years ago.
The same thing that makes anything valuable. Someone's willing to pay for it.
The past's past. I learned that young. If it can't bring you gold or giggles, what's the point in dwelling on it?
Maybe the chance to fix a mistake? Make things right again?
Eh. Our mistakes make us who we are.
That's not evasive.
Look, I didn't get where I am by showing my hand, you know?
No, your hand isn't what I hear you've been showing.
Hey! You take that back!
You had your relic. You were gone. There was no reason for you to come back and face the Qunari.
I still don't have a ship. I thought I could get one.
From a bunch of shipwrecked Qunari?
From the viscount. I just got here late.
I always knew you had a heart of gold.
Shh! Don't tell anyone.
I am a repeatable encounter, you know.
My, my... it looks like we have a hardened adventurer here.
Let's go. I'll let you roll for initiative.
Screw me if I'm wrong, but haven't we met before?
Why don't we go play Slay the Dragon?
I've got the ship, you've got the harbor. Let's tie up for the night.
Sorry, no one is allowed to see the viscount uninvited.
The viscount is busy at the moment. He has no time for unannounced visitors.
Over here. Look!
Here! There's a trapdoor.
I'm guessing this leads somewhere.
The viscount told me to let you right in.
I told you, I only like to be on top.
I mean against the templars! You like freedom, right? You hate slavery.
Why wouldn't you side with the mages?
Maybe I just don't like you.
You cut yourself and realized the power? You didn't actually deal with a demon?
Oh, no. I did.
Why would you do that?
I needed his help. He was really very nice about it.
Of course he was! He's using you to get a foothold in a mortal brain!
He's a spirit. He offered me his aid. I hardly think you're one to criticize.
Did I ask you?
Spirits were the first children of the Maker, but He turned His back on them to dote on His mortal creations.
The ones who resented this became demons, driven to take everything mortals had and gain back the Maker's favor.
Your Maker is a story you humans use to explain the world.
We have our own stories. I don't need to borrow yours.
We've never thought of the Fade as the home of our gods.
It is another realm, another people's home. No different or more foreign than, say, Orzammar.
You can say that again.
But have you never studied the types of demons? They break down very clearly into different sins—
Spirits differ from each other, just as you and Hawke and Isabela are all human.
More or less...
Looks like someone forgot to conceal the door to his hideout.
Looks like your killer might be hiding under the foundry.
Ooh, a door!
This wasn't here before.
Mother must be down there. With him.
Good day, Champion.
I doubt Seneschal Bran wants visitors, Champion.
Please move on, serah. The viscount won't be seeing you today.
Go right in, serah. The viscount is waiting for you.
Good day, serah.
Hello again, Champion.
I doubt Seneschal Bran is in the mood to see anyone right now, Champion.
Look at this handsome lad.
And look at this stunning vision.
Giggles You know, it's my nameday. Want to buy me a drink?
No.
What?
Being an abomination. I just got a taste of your future.
I'm not that foolish. Our relationship is, um, strictly platonic.
It's like you're trapped in your own body, seeing out your eyes, while someone else moves you like a puppet.
And you're trying to scream, to move a single muscle, but there's no escape. Until you look down at the blood on your hands...
Stop it. You're scaring me.
That's the point.
It was my risk to take! I never asked her to do this for me.
She knew you didn't have the strength to resist the demon. That's why it picked you.
Why are you doing this? What can I do about it now?
Make up for your mistakes. Most blood mages never get a second chance.
It's not my fight.
You can't hide in Sundermount.
Your clan is dead.
There is no place for you among the Dalish.
No! My clan is all I ever cared about! Everything I did, I did for them!
On second thought, maybe don't try to help us.
Just wondering if the feathered pauldrons are an essential part of the moody rebel mage persona.
What are you talking about?
I'm working on an epic poem about a hopelessly romantic apostate waging an epic struggle against forces he can't possibly defeat.
What do you mean, can't possibly defeat?
Well, it's not a good story unless the hero dies.
Where were they trying to go?
Anywhere but here.
I mean, you have to question the collective sanity of people who live in a city powered by raw lava running through its walls.
So, you're not having any warm dwarven feelings of homecoming?
The only road Orzammar needs points straight up.
Too prosaic. Trapped in a cave with hungry bears, right at the spring thaw.
That lets him off too easy. Dipped in molten gold and left as a statue in the Viscount's Keep.
Ooh. That's poetic!
What are you two talking about?
What to do to Bartrand when I find him.
Any suggestions?
Don't.
You made a mistake. It happens.
I killed a girl.
I almost killed a girl.
You've killed two-hundred and fifty-four by my last count. Plus about five hundred men, a few dozen giant spiders, and at least two demons.
It's not the same.
Why? Because this one you feel bad about? Maybe that's the problem.
So, you and Hawke... I need some details. Did you go down on one knee?
Did she jump you?
Did he jump you?
Did you swear eternal vows of love, or is this just a physical thing?
I don't see how that's any of your business.
Fine. But if you don't tell me, I'm just going to have to make it up.
This is past time for joking.
I'm helping you indulge in elaborate revenge fantasies. I think it's good for you.
Meredith will die. Do not doubt that.
Go away, Justice. Can Anders come out and play?
Stop.
You are no fun anymore.
Lyrium Smuggler Archer
But I thought Gascard DuPuis was the one responsible. We executed him.
Gascard must have been innocent.
We've made a terrible mistake.
Could he have been playing dead?
Are you sure?
Gascard probably deserved it, but it doesn't change the fact that my mother's gone.
He had it coming.
Speak to Emeric in the Gallows.
He confessed to kidnapping and blood magic. His death was deserved.
I am sure, serah. He was beheaded.
Ha-ha!
Don't fall over!
Hey mister! You all right?
Bloody brats.
Get!
Bah. The less children the better, I say.
Where are your parents, young man?
How should I know?
You return home to your parents this instant!
No way! Pa's drunk and Mother has company.
The Maker will know if you misbehave, child.
Does He always know?
Sighs Maker watch over fools and children alike.
Keep your distance, you shifty ragamuffin.
Scoffs Blighter.
I see you lurking there.
I didn't do anything.
Don't you children have homes?
Bet they're not as nice as yours!
Bloody Fereldans! Who asked you to come, anyway?
Did you really go all the way into the Deep Roads?
Look! It's the Champion!
I wish I could've helped you kill all those oxmen!
Don't look now. Here comes another one.
I'm just standing here. Don't look at me.
Why you running around with all that stuff?
Who are you looking at?
A Scribbled Note
Used quicklime to preserve her feet. Unsure whether texture of the skin is to my liking. Will try other methods.
These were part of some necromantic ritual. I'm close now.
Bone Pit Mines
Champion! Could I interest you or your companions in some new armor?
Spend some of your hard-earned coin here, Champion!
A veteran of the Deep Roads right there, ladies and gentlemen!
An adventurer! Do you need new armor? Anything at all?
Don't get stabbed again! Buy armor today!
Quality armor! The best outside of Orzammar!
Of course! Of course! Look around!
Anything you need. If it protects your body, I have it.
Gather round, all. I bring to you a priceless treasure! From the highest heights of Mount Daverus it's traveled.
That was almost profound.
Necromancy. And here I thought I was twisted.
This is quite a collection of books. Blood magic, necromancy... where did he get all these?
Books on necromancy. The templars will want to confiscate those.
What a surprise.
Necromantic rituals? What terrible things are going on down here?
A mage who plays with dead people. Charming.
Necromancy. This man is dabbling in some dangerous magic.
A Scribbled Note
Mharen… it's a pretty name. I saw her hands. Long, slender fingers. Fair skin—the hands of a lifelong scholar. Oh, to lock my own clumsy fingers in hers again...
The Fereldan, eh?
A Scribbled Note
If it isn't the Champion!
Might you need a new outfit, Champion?
Messere! Surely an adventurer has need of a good tailor!
One so wealthy could use a new pair of boots, yes?
Clothing of all kinds!

Follow the example of Serah Hawke, who valiantly apprehended many Starkhaven apostates in years past, thereby making the realm safer. The apostates are:
Innley of Starkhaven Deborah Keins Jake the Black

An anonymous noble will pay for the elimination of three Qunari patrols that have been traveling in the Wounded Coast, Sundermount, and the Bone Pit.

Serah Hawke,
Few have succeeded in curbing the ambitions of the Qunari—except you. I write to present an opportunity: In the countryside, travelers have spotted three Qunari patrols searching the Wounded Coast, Sundermount, and the Bone Pits. I would have them eliminated. —A noble friend

It grows harder by the day for our kind to live in Kirkwall. My shop is dedicated to helping us survive in this hostile soil. I could perform several potent enchantments with the right ingredients and specialized tomes. Provide these ingredients, and I will compensate you handsomely.
I need: - Patterns Within Form, unedited version. The Chantry's version butchered Enchanter Halden's lessons. - The Midnight Compendium or any chapter or section you can find. - Essence of Shade. Admittedly hard to gather, as most shades dissipate when destroyed. - An enchanted golden crucible.
—Marcia Arthurius

I know I do.
Sometimes, it's painful to speak. But it's the only way the wound can be lanced.
Terrible things do happen, Sebastian.
But what we see is only a piece of the puzzle. Only the Maker can see the greater picture.
The guilty prosper. Innocents die.
And then they are brought to the side of the Maker. Their suffering ends. There is always a greater purpose.
Danarius once killed a little boy to fuel blood magic that let him impress his fellow Senators at a party. What was the purpose there?
Perhaps it was witnessing that which will give you the strength to prevent it ever happening again.
It's our duty to tell the templars.
Then why haven't you done it?

Is this getting you any closer to your ship?
Huh?

What's keeping you here?
Mostly the sex.
Hawke's an absolute tiger between the sheets. I mean, all night, every night.
Oh, cute! You're blushing!
Mostly the Blooming Rose. I'm paid up through the end of the year. I'd hate not to use it.
The... brothel?
What? Women can't go to brothels, too? You're just not using your imagination.
Oh, look! Now you are. You're cute when you're blushing.
I used to be like you, you know.
You used to be a woman?
No!
That explains a lot.
My family put me in the Chantry because I was giving them a bad name.
It was the best thing that ever happened to me. I found peace. I found a purpose.
Before I came here, I used to be out to all hours, drinking and whoring. I didn't believe in anything except my own pleasure.
Why couldn't I have met you then?
That was very brave, coming back to face the Qunari.
It was idiotic. They would've killed me.
And you returned anyway. You couldn't face the thought of so many innocents dying for something you could prevent.
Tell that to the viscount.
It's frightening, isn't it, to realize you have the potential to be a better person?
So, I've never understood why the Chantry says if you're good, you'll be taken up to the Maker's side.
Those who die with the sins cleansed from their souls will walk beside the Maker in eternity.
That doesn't sound fun!
If they really want people to be good, shouldn't they offer an afterlife with... lakes of wine and a dozen naked virgins?
Anyone who wants that will be going to the Void.
Sounds like that's where all the good parties will be.
Have you heard the Chant of Light?
That's the song they sing at the chantry, right? It's pretty... but a little repetitive.
Then you know the story? How Andraste became the Maker's divine bride and convinced Him to offer us a second chance?
Right. But I never understood why she had to die.
Her mortal husband betrayed her out of jealousy.
But if He wanted her to spread her faith, couldn't she do that better alive?
The Maker gave us free will. By his betrayal, Maferath showed that men were not yet worth saving.
I don't know. It's a nice story, but I think it's got some holes.
So, what do you believe, Merrill?
Our gods abandoned us long ago. They haven't answered our prayers since the fall of Arlathan.
When we've proven that we're elves again, that we didn't lose everything, they'll come back to us.
We say the same of the Maker.
Perhaps they're only different names for the same divine force that created the world.
The Maker wants you to be elves?
What does your Chantry do?
I mean, you keep saying how great it is. Anders and Isabela tell me to stay away from it. But what does it do?
Among the Dalish, the Keepers teach the children, preserve our history, perform magic. The priestesses here just... sing.
The Chantry does many charitable works. It cares for widows and orphans—
Who in the Dalish would just be part of the clan, like everyone else.
You need to seek atonement.
I know I should have died there, not Marethari. Don't you think I feel guilty enough?
Guilt isn't a punishment. It's a reminder there are things you haven't set right.
The only way to shed its burden is to repent with a sincere heart and rectify your failings.
But how?
My entire clan is dead because of me.
The Keeper is dead. My clan lost everything because of me.
There's not enough I can do in this lifetime to make up for that.
It was your pride that led you to the demon. Admitting what you can't do is a good first step.
It's been very exciting working with Hawke.
Are you for real?
It seems like she's involved every time something goes wrong in Kirkwall.
It seems like he's involved every time there's a crisis in Kirkwall.
I've never had so many opportunities to help people!
All right. I thought I was getting tired of moody. I take it back.
You're making my teeth ache.
You must forgive your brother.
While you were off playing prince, Bartrand trapped us in the Deep Roads and left us to die.
When you hold onto anger, it colors everything you do.
You escaped the Deep Roads. You built a life without your brother. Do you still want him haunting you?
Oh, go find some beggars to sing to, will you?
You know, if you have time, I could give you a few archery pointers.
Excuse me?
Sometimes your shots veer a little left. I thought maybe your cocking ring was off.
I could take a look if you like.
You want to touch Bianca's cocking ring?
It was just a thought.
So, I've known you for three years now. I give up. You beat me. What is it?
You like boys? Sheep? You slept with your sister?
What are you talking about?
What are you hiding? Nobody's this bloody clean.
After you leave the chantry you... get drunk at the Hanged Man and walk around in women's clothes?
Not that I've seen. Unfortunately.
I've been honest with you and Hawke.
Liar.
Lying is a sin.

In the past fortnight, seven apostates have been captured because of one templar: Ser Conrad Vernhart. It is never wise to underestimate a templar's intelligence, but Ser Conrad is both brilliant and ruthless. We must remove this threat. Killing him is not an option—he must be disgraced, removed from Kirkwall, and, ideally, cast out of the templar order.
Fortunately for us, the templars now fear they've been infiltrated by a blood mage's puppets. Of the several templars who are watching their own, one is deep in the throws of lyrium and can be fooled. His name is Ser Roderick, and he frequents the Hanged Man. His testimony alone will be dubious, so we must search the Gallows and Lowtown for any slight or fabrication that can defame Ser Conrad... before we all fall.
Find ways to slander Ser Conrad Vernhart. Ser Roderick in the Hanged Man is investigating corrupt templars. There may be other opportunities in Lowtown and the Gallows.

Family Letters

Dear FirstName/>,
I hope this letter finds you well. My time in the Circle has been bearable, even after the templars made a point of putting me through the Harrowing as soon as I arrived. They thought I was at risk of possession or running away like Father. Glad it's over with.
I've started mentoring apprentices. I enjoy time with the children, teaching them basic spells. One of them, Ella, has taken a shine to me. Adorable!
Life's not perfect here, mind you. The templars are mostly polite, and I know they're just doing their jobs, but some hold extreme views. There's one creep named Ser Alrik who likes harassing mages, but I'll steer clear of him!
I'm doing fine! Please don't worry about me.
With love, Bethany

FirstName/>,
So it's official: I'm a Grey Warden. Stroud says I'm lucky that the Warden's ritual has kept the taint at bay. Not sure if I'd call it luck, but I'm alive.
It's been brutal, going through this. I have awful nightmares. I close my eyes and hear whispering. Is it real, or am I going mad? I'll survive that, too. That's my life is now: survival, getting through each day. That's what you wanted, isn't it?
Tell Mother I miss her.
With love, Bethany

Dear FirstName/>,
How are you? I hope you and Mother are doing well. Things are good here. I've found my place among the templars. It's nice to have purpose, to be part of something bigger than myself... and you! All right, all right, I'll stop being a pain in the ass.
It's not a perfect job, though. I don't really like what we do to mages, but do we have a choice? It keeps everyone safe, and it's better than the alternative. Many mages understand that we're trying to help, even if our methods could use improvement.
Unfortunately, there are extreme elements within the Order. Some argue for a permanent solution and have ideas I hope never take root. Makes me glad Bethany never had to live in a place like this.
I'll wrap this up. Duty calls. Send my love to Mother.
Your brother, Carver

FirstName/>,
How are you? Hope all is well. Things are good here, I suppose. Grey Warden legends do fail to mention a few things, though! I've yet to do anything remotely glorious or honorable since arriving. In fact, most of it is painful, dirty, often horrific work. Thanks a lot! (In case you forgot that it's your fault I'm here.)
The positive is that I'm alive and part of something greater. I've a chance to prove myself. Maybe I'll even step out of your big fat shadow! Thing is, Ferelden already has a hero that stopped the Blight. Pfft! Big deal, right?
Say hello to Mother and Gamlen for me. Carver

I had hoped prayer might cleanse me of the desire demon's touch.
But I still hear her voice so clearly. I feel like I've bathed in filth that will never come off.
You acted honorably. Why are you ashamed?
You did nothing wrong.
Wash behind the ears. Evil usually gets stuck there.
You just need to scrub.
The Harimanns won't stand against you. Will you ride back to Starkhaven now?
You have what you need.
You were looking for this?
Here, you were looking for this.
I heard you lost something. This it?
You were whining about losing something?
This is yours. Try to keep track of your things.
Your lost garbage, serah.
I think I found something of yours.
This is yours, if I'm not mistaken.
I believe you lost this somewhere?
You were looking for this, I believe.
Something of yours, serah.
Did you misplace this?
I think you let this get away from you.
Check your purse—I think you lost something.
A little something of yours I picked up somewhere.
This fell into my hands. Recognize it?
It's probably nothing, but are you missing this incredibly important thing?
Look what I found—your reason for living.
I don't know. Flora said others are still vying for the title. I should find out who before I charge in blindly.
In truth, I can't feel as righteous as I did before.
I keep asking myself, Do I want this because it's right, or simply to have what I never thought I could?
Aren't you your parents' heir?
Never thought you could?
I'm the youngest son of three.
My parents were... rather traditional. They wanted the heir and the spare, and I was left in the cold.
They put me in the Chantry to prevent my competing with my brothers.
You seem very dedicated to the Chantry. You were put there against your will?
You didn't join by choice?
At first. But it was the best thing that could have happened.
I was a wild boy, a shame to my family. The Chantry made me a man.
It's odd. When I wanted to rule, I would have been terrible at it. Now that I might be decent, I don't know if it's the right thing to do.
It's the wisdom not to want power that lets you use it wisely.
Listen to your heart.
You must do what you think is right, Sebastian.
What do you want to do?
Do you have an answer?
That's a good question.
Don't let the demon make you doubt yourself.
You must take back your land.
In trying to retake Starkhaven, I have already brought death to so many.
Could I ever do enough good as prince to justify that?
You could be a just and fair ruler. Worry about reparations once you take your lands.
You'll be a great prince.
Real princes don't worry about who they step on on their way to the top.
Can't make an omelette...
Would you stand aside and let someone else claim what your family fought and died for?
It is your birthright.
If you've need of something a little more exotic, come to me.
Just remember: quality like this comes at a price.
Feel free to look at my merchandise... if you've the coin.
In the market for something special, friend?
I'm sure you'll see that everything is worth the impressive prices.
Just don't ask where anything came from.
Ah! I see someone with an eye for fine merchandise!
Let's see if we can't find something to interest you, messere.
You won't regret any purchase you make here. Trust me.

The demon didn't lie. I used to be bitterly jealous of my brother. I wanted to be prince.
Now, everything he had is mine. And he lies in ashes.
You didn't feel what that demon stirred in me.
No.
It cannot be right to lead any army to Starkhaven with such doubt in my heart.
I owe you more than I can say, Hawke. I will offer my service to you here before I move on.
If you want to help me, do it because we're friends. There's no debt between us.
You owe me nothing.
You have a good soul, Hawke.
It was truly the Maker who led you to me.
Killing a few hundred more bandits ought to help you make up your mind.
Sounds fun!
Laughs You do have a unique way of working out your inner struggles, Hawke.
Enough of this. I will make no decision today.
You swore an oath to serve the Chantry. It's not right to turn your back.
You should honor your vows.
Andraste herself said the highest grace is to honor our parents. Our first loyalty is to our roots.
It is not so simple a decision.
I can think of a few services for you to perform...
Your service, huh?
What? Why are you smiling like...?
Oh. Oh, my. That's... not what I meant. I...
I think I need to pray. A lot.
I know you've done great things in Kirkwall, Hawke.
I imagine your methods haven't always been scrupulous, but you clearly do more good than harm.
I just don't know if I can follow that road.
I... I had never thought to see this again. Thank you.
You found this? I don't know what to say.
I didn't expect to see this again. Thank you. Truly.
How did you...? No, I don't want to know. Just, thank you.
This couldn't come at a better time. Thank you.
You surprise me. I didn't think that was possible anymore.
Templar
Templar Archer
Templar Hunter
Bless my fool spirit, I never thought I'd see that again. Thank you.
You brought it home? I am... right stunned, actually.
You brought me what? Maker, that's... wonderful.
I don't know if I am comfortable even holding it, but... truly, thank you.
What do you mean bringing me that? I mean, I'm amazed!
How did you get that? No... I really don't want to know.
You just stumbled on this? Can't say I'm surprised. Bloody fools.
I had long since paid my debt over this. It's grand to see it again.
An old, foolish thing to need. Thank you for saving me the trip.
Simple as that? Just a walk and drop? Amazing.
Well, isn't that a sight for sun-blind eyes? Thank you more than kindly.
Who'd have thought that would show up again? Wonder of wonders.
A strange turn. Thank you.
Ma serannas. This is a rare gesture.
You did this? Without being begged and thrice paid? Interesting.
I thought this was lost to us—like so many other things. My gratitude.
You have done a great kindness in returning this.
I thought this was lost. Perhaps it should be, but that does not diminish your kindness.
Hello again, Hawke.
I cannot fault Sebastian for wanting to know why an old ally would turn against his parents.
But I fear he's too impetuous. He may do something he regrets.
Please, go with him, try to restrain him. If the Harimanns are guilty, they will receive justice from the viscount.
Sebastian need not take their punishment into his own hands.
Shh! I can't accurately express my gratitude, but thank you.
Where did you get this? It's... just what I need. Thank you.
You found it? By the Void I didn't think... thank you.
Thank the Maker and various others! I need to lock this up.
This was free of its handler? Well, you're a lucky one. Thank you.
Don't wave that around! I mean: thank you for this perfectly normal item.

I must pray to Andraste for guidance.

Act 3: Opening Dialog

Dear Hawke,
Or is it now Champion Hawke? The story of how you handled the Arishok is very popular here. There are few things the Tevinters love more than a tale of Qunari defeat!
To say the Imperium is a strange place would be a vast understatement. Men and women work magic in the streets while their slaves look on. I watched my own master kill a rival magister in a duel just days ago. Sometimes I look around and think I understand the templars back in Kirkwall.
My studies are going well. My dreams don't trouble me as much these days. I'm hopeful that, in time, I'll master myself. I just wanted to thank you. I owe you more than my life. I owe you my mind and my future.
Feynriel

Messere Hawke,
It is I, Macha, Keran's sister. I'm writing to tell you that we are well, all things considered. It's hard getting by without Keran's templar allowance, but we manage. He's been unhappy about leaving the Order, but at least he's safe and alive.
Thank you for everything! Macha

Messere Hawke,
I wanted to thank you for helping my brother. I worry about what the templars will do to Keran, but it's what he wants. He is grateful that you defended him before Ser Cullen.
Thank you, from both of us. Macha

To Hawke,
Life with the Dalish hasn't been easy. Keeper Marethari tries her best, but I don't know what else she can do for me. The younger elves won't accept me, and I often hear them whispering behind my back. The elders have more discretion, but I can see it in their eyes—they're afraid of me.
I don't know why I'm telling you this. Sometimes it feels like you're the only person I can trust.
Your friend, Feynriel

To Hawke,
It's been years, and the Circle has yet to find a way to help me. I've seen the way the templars look at me. I know they want me to undergo the Rite of Tranquility. If something doesn't change soon, they will force it upon me.
I try to keep myself under control, but it's difficult. The nightmares are coming more frequently. They seem so real. I can't help thinking that the Dalish would've had an answer for this.
Feynriel

From Ella
I'm sure it won't be much longer. Gamlen must still be looking for us!
And if he's not?
Don't look now, but I think that's our man.
This must be him now.
Wait. I think someone's coming.

Messere Hawke,
In case you don't remember me, we met in the Gallows a few years ago. You saved my life. Twice, in fact. Once from Ser Alrik, and once from... someone else.
It's not the kindest thing to say, but nobody misses Alrik. Not even the other templars. I know it's hard to imagine, but they don't want to fight. They want things to be normal: no Harrowings, no Tranquil, and no one dying. But none of us are getting that wish now.
So many dark whispers in the Circle. Terrible days are coming for all of us. I pray the Maker keeps you safe.
Sincerely, Ella

Messere Hawke,
In case you don't remember me, we met in the Gallows a few years ago. You saved my life. Twice, in fact.
Bethany sends her love. I should have recognized the family resemblance sooner. Knowing Bethany, it now makes perfect sense that you, of all the people in Thedas, would be the one to rescue me.
It's not the kindest thing to say, but nobody misses Ser Alrik. Not even the other templars. I know it's hard to imagine, but they don't want to fight. They want things to be normal: no Harrowings, no Tranquil, no one dying. But none of us are getting that wish now.
So many dark whispers in the Circle. Terrible days are coming for all of us. Your sister and I will pray that Andraste keeps you safe.
Sincerely, Ella

Messere Hawke,
Maybe you don't remember me. We met briefly, and though it was the most important moment of my life, you've changed so many lives that you probably can't keep them all straight.
You rescued me from Ser Alrik, and you told me to leave Kirkwall. I wanted to tell you that I have. I won't say where I am now, but I'm free, and I'm not looking back.
I've heard the rumors. Terrible days are coming. I pray for the safety of my family, and all the souls in Kirkwall, and especially for you. May Andraste keep you from harm.
Sincerely, Ella

A Message from Lothering
From Charade

Dear FirstName/>,
I assume Gamlen's told you nothing about me. I ask after you every time I visit him, and all I get is, You've heard it all from the town criers. Dear old dad.
I hope this letter finds you well. I hear stories, but I can't tell what's true and what's exaggerated. Did you really fistfight the Qunari leader? Are you actually sleeping with the captain of the city guard? Did you slay a dragon in Darktown? It can't all be true!
It is exciting to hear the stories and say, That's my cousin! Write to me, and tell me how you've been. I want news! I'll trade you incriminating gossip about your favorite uncle.
Yours truly, Charade

Dearest Leandra,
I hope you and the children are holding up. I'm so sorry about Bethany. Such a dear girl. I remember her helping me weed. The Blight has taken too much from us! Thank the Maker for the Hero of Ferelden and the Grey Wardens.
Things are slowly getting back to normal in most of the country, but Lothering is gone for good. We hoped to rebuild there, but the Blight poisoned the land. It'll take decades for the earth to recover. It may never.
Redcliffe is a nice place, and I'm starting to see it as home. The village saw some trouble during the Blight, but it's recovering. Perhaps you could visit sometime.
Please write me again, my dear. I wish to hear about your life in Kirkwall. Send my regrets and fond regards to the children.
Your friend, Miriam

Dearest Leandra,
I hope you and the children are holding up. I'm so sorry about Carver. I remember the dear boy helping me trap rats in the cellar. The Blight has taken too much from us. Thank the Maker for the Hero of Ferelden and the Grey Wardens.
Things are slowly getting back to normal in most parts of the country, but Lothering is gone for good. We had hoped to rebuild there, but the Blight poisoned the land. It'll take decades for the earth to recover. It may never.
Redcliffe is a nice place, and I'm starting to see it as home. The village saw some trouble during the Blight, but it's recovering. Perhaps you could visit sometime.
Please write me again, my dear. I wish to hear about your life in Kirkwall. Send my regrets and fond regards to the children.
Your friend, Miriam
Feeling Inadequate?
A Letter in a Fancy Envelope

Messere,
Interest rates are the lowest they've been in two hundred years, making this the perfect time to take out a mortgage on your estate! The next viscount will likely raise rates, and if you wait too long, this chance will pass you by. When the Chantry demands tithes on all Hightown estates, where will you be?
The lending house of Tancum, Salmer, and Grees can take you through the process of mortgaging your estate with ease and confidence, leaving you with nothing to do but admire your wealth.
Speak to our accountant in the Dwarven Merchants Guild for a free consultation before time runs out.

Flag flying at half-mast? Does your soldier not stand to attention? Does your dwarf shy away from the Deep Roads? Come to Jorman's Apothecary and ask for our Special Sauce. Our Special Sauce is infused with the essences of fifty-two herbs. It's completely natural, completely safe, and ABSOLUTELY EFFECTIVE. You will never feel the same again!
Be the man other men want to be. Be the man you DESERVE to be.
I don't know why they hate me! I've never been to Antiva!
I've never been to Denerim! I swear I haven't! Help!
Why the bloody blazes would I go to Orzammar! Get them off me!
Par Vollen? I've never been there! Screams
The land they call Rivain? I've never! Help!
Take my advice, friend: stay away from storytellers. Never know what they'll say.
A Strange Letter from Lothering

Hawke,
Heard you lot got to the Free Marches. Don't know why you'd bother, but I suppose it's better than Orlais.
They got spiders up there? Big ones? Couldn't swing a dead cat round here without hitting a giant spider, but the Blight drove 'em off. Maker! Dark days ahead. Mark my words! A man can't even cover his blighted land with poisonous traps!
Old Barlin
More than I knew. My reputation precludes me.
A Letter For Bethany
A Letter For Carver
The screaming mage? You have a lot of enemies.
