TAKE BACK OUR STREETS!
Fereldan refugees, Qunari soldiers... Who next? Tevinter slavers snatching children out of their beds?
THIS ENDS NOW!
Send a message that Kirkwallers WILL NOT ACCEPT THIS! We must band together to drive foreign waste from our doorstep. Reclaim the Free Marches FOR THE MARCHERS!

A Note Addressed to Gamlen

Dear Bethany,
I'm so sorry. I don't know what happened to Tamra. I think her family fled to Redcliffe, but I haven't been able to locate them. I don't have much hope left, but miracles can happen. I will keep trying. I know Tamra was a close friend. I will write you as soon as I hear something.
I hope your family is doing well in Kirkwall. Please send my love to your mother. I will keep praying for you all.
Sincerely, Sister Ursula

My darling Carver,
I miss you so much! When are you coming back to Ferelden? The Blight is over and the darkspawn are gone! There's nothing to be afraid of... not that you'd ever be afraid, bravest-man-I've-ever-known!
We're not going back to Lothering. I hear the land is poisoned or something. Father is raising money for a new farm in the Bannorn. I don't know when that'll happen, but he's working very hard. We're living with my aunt in Denerim, so please send your letters there.
Why haven't you been writing, Carver? Did you find another girl in the Free Marches? Remember: no girl will ever do what I did for you behind Barlin's shed that time. You just think about that!
Write me soon! I love you! Peaches

Dear Carver,
Thank you for your letter. It's so nice to hear that you're still alive. I'm sorry about Bethany. How is your brother taking it? I hope he's all right. Please give him a hug for me. And a kiss!
Did he find a girl in Kirkwall? Please say he didn't. I think that would break my heart. I always thought he liked me, but I don't know why nothing ever came of it. He looked at me once, that one time at the fair, and I thought I was going to die from happiness. I don't know why you never brought us together. You're a bad friend, Carver.
You're coming back to Ferelden, aren't you? I miss all of you! I think I've filled out just a little more since you left. I think your brother would appreciate it. I look so much better in dresses now and even more amazing out of them.
I'm living with my aunt in Denerim, since Lothering is gone. Write me soon!
Your friend, Peaches

Gamlen Amell,
Payment is now two months late, serah. Interest accrues, as you are well aware. You will find yourself barred from our establishments unless payment is made. Think! No bettor, cardsharp, or numbers runner in Kirkwall will deal with you.
I certainly hope this matter is attended to before steps are taken. Let us avoid further unpleasantness.
Gallard
A Strangely Official-Looking Letter

Dear Sir or Madam,
I am Lord Achim Falk of Starkhaven. I have faith in the Maker and Andraste, his beloved prophet, that I must bring this matter of urgent business to you. Years ago, I served the office of Seneschal to the royal family of Starkhaven. Sadly, they have been deposed, ousted by a foul usurper. I represent His Royal Highness, Prince Corbinian Vael, the true heir to the throne, and with your help, Maker willing, we will see him wear the crown of Starkhaven once more.
His Highness had a fortune of eleven thousand sovereigns locked away in the vaults of the Royal Bank of Antiva. With access to this fortune, he can raise an army to retake the throne, but it is too dangerous for His Highness to simply withdraw the funds himself. This is where we require your assistance and discretion.
Simply send me the details of an open bank account in Kirkwall, and I will arrange that the funds are transferred to you. My King will then contact you to retrieve his fortune, leaving you with a hefty award. I must warn you, the Antivans will not consider the account viable if it contains less than 100 sovereigns. Please observe the utmost confidentiality.
Yours, Lord Achim Falk

Don't ask where it comes from and you'll get the best. That's what you want, isn't it?
Always willing to give a discount to the people who save my skin.
Away with you! I will not be caged again!
You are in a strange place, Fereldan.
Tell me about it.
Knowing is half the battle. And it need not be wholly unprofitable. Provided few questions are asked.
Not every coin is valued by weight. Some carry where they've been, like small whispers of the past.
Places hunger for people to find them. No matter how disagreeable the denizens.
This is getting out of hand. Can a man who knows much not know where to find rest?
Finally, the streets are safe for decent citizens and particularly ambulatory metaphors.
Rapscallions!
You are the biggest news in Kirkwall, messere. Your grandparents would be so proud.
I'm giving it all up! I made a vow to the Chantry, and it was wrong to turn my back.

Is the bow special?
As the youngest son, it was my place to lead Starkhaven's militia. But I never had a talent for swordplay. Too much getting hit.
My grandfather said the bow is the wise man's weapon. You can defend your city without opening its gates.
Grandfather said the day I could pull the string on his bow, it would be mine.
Then why didn't you have it with you?
So the bow is yours?
I was thirteen when my grandfather made me that promise.
I would rise at dawn to practice my shots until I could hit the eye slit of a helmet from the top of the ramparts.

Were you and your grandfather close?
Tell me of your grandfather.
He was a man of the world—prince of Starkhaven—but he had the most unshakable faith in the Maker.
When my parents threatened to pledge me to the Chantry, he told me he'd gladly trade his title for a life of contemplation.
The Maker ordained a place for each of us, I remember him saying. We have only to serve.
I'm sorry I never got a chance to meet them. To... save them.
I wish I could have helped.
You can't shoot your family at a charging bandit and stop him dead between the eyes.
A bow's better than a family.

I look forward to testing it.
Think of them with every arrow you fire to retake your land.

How to Frame a Templar

Hawke,
I must tell you of a recent event: Ser Conrad was fighting with another templar; Ser Roderick broke in and accused Ser Conrad of worshipping The Great Demon and doing demony things. The other templars were aghast. In the middle of the scene that followed, a dockworker came up and said, calm as you please, You Ser Conrad? Got a shipment of raw lyrium for you. Sign here. It took all my resolve not to burst into laughter.
Ser Conrad was discharged from the order and is under investigation. I don't know how you did it, Hawke, but you saved a lot of apostates.
-A friend

Hawke -
I must tell you of a recent event: Ser Conrad was fighting with another templar; then Ser Roderick came in, laying accusations against Ser Conrad. The templars were in an uproar. In the middle of the chaos, a dockworker came up and said, calm as you please, You Ser Conrad? Got a shipment of raw lyrium for you. Sign here. It took all my resolve not to burst into laughter.
Needless to say, Ser Conrad was whisked away and hasn't been seen since. I don't know how you did it, Hawke, but you saved a lot of apostates.

It's a shame we couldn't get them all, but every little thread helps. Take this.
Sebastian, listen to yourself. You're as impulsive now as the day you turned away from us.
Do you think the Maker wants another rashly-spoken vow that you'll abandon when the next passion takes you?
I will not—
This is your life, child. Don't spend it being blown about like a weathervane.
But here's Hawke. Maybe you can talk some sense into him.
Is the grand cleric upset with you?
She seems frustrated.
I don't think sense is really my strong suit.
I'm not a good choice.
Have you done something dumb again?
What's going on now?
You brought me this to remember and honor them.
Yes. This will be a fitting weapon to carry against the usurpers.
Thank you for thinking of me, Hawke.
She thinks I'm fickle. But I mean it!
How long has she spent telling me to return to the Chantry? And now that I want to, she won't take me!
No. I'm finally doing something smart.
It was wrong for me to break my oath to the Chantry. I've turned against the Maker, and for what?
You belong in the Chantry.
You must take Starkhaven!
I can't believe you'd turn your back on Starkhaven now. After all we've done.
I know you don't agree, but I can't continue to break my oath. And for what?
You're wise to stay here. No one trusts a man who breaks his oath.
Maybe you're right. Princes have to do a lot of underhanded things. You might not be so good at that.
Don't give up now. You defeated the desire demons. All of Kirkwall benefited.
Of everything we've done, I'll never regret that. But I don't know.
I've been praying for guidance and had nothing.
When I think of going to Starkhaven... calling on allies like Flora Harimann and all the corrupt, scheming nobles...
My throat swells shut in horror. When I think about staying, I'm at peace.
And here's Hawke. Come to goad you into further heroics, no doubt.
I don't have to goad anyone. They follow me for my natural charm.
What does she mean goad?
I thought you would try to talk me out of this, Hawke. Thank you for understanding.
Why would I want to rule Starkhaven and deal with jackals like Lady Harimann for the rest of my life?
Power and money?
Do you see yourself as a prince or a priest?
What do you want to do?
That's exactly the question I've been praying for guidance about.
If you give it up, what then?
What will you do now?
I suppose I must convince Elthina my commitment is sincere.
Then I will remain here to represent the Maker's interests as she thinks best.
When you're a prince, those same jackals will kneel at your feet and pay you taxes.
Being a prince is more fun.
You should ask what's best for your people, not just for you.
What's right for Starkhaven?
You don't become a prince because you want to. You do it because it's your responsibility.
It's your birthright.
I do not have hubris enough to imagine it matters to the common people who rules them.
Kirkwall does well enough with no one in the viscount's seat.
Someone will take the reins. The fields will be planted, the crops gathered.
No one will notice that a Vael lives and isn't there. And I can devote my life to the Maker's will on Thedas.
Nobody tells a prince what to do. Or who to do it with...
Princes are sexy.
Hawke, you— Don't think I'm not tempted.
But I can't. I knelt and swore before the Maker that I would take no bride but Andraste.
I'm just talking about two people, one night, and forgetting all your troubles.
Who said marriage?
If I broke my vows to be with you, I wouldn't be worthy of you.
I already have enough sins to atone for.
I cannot return to Starkhaven—and subject my people to war—without a clear sign that it's the Maker's will.

Forbidden Knowledge

title>Tarohne's Book of Blood/title>
Was Dabbon Hait one mage? Or a full cabal? I found another reference to Xebenkeck in his Black Journal:
The blood feeds, the blood nourishes. In blood, the call is heard. In blood, the deal is made. My master bathed in a river of blood, Then the Great Xebenkeck came!

title>Tarohne's Beginning/title>
In 4:2 Black is the oldest account of the Forbidden Ones, though most mages consider them a hoax. But someone had to make that first deal, that first contact with the other side. From the unknown mage's account:
The first of the magus cast themselves deep in the Fade in search of answers and power, always power. They found the forbidden ones— Xebenkeck, Imshael, Gaxkang the Unbound, and The Formless One. Many conversations were had and much of the fabric of the world revealed. And thus the magic of blood was born.
Even those who consider this folly dare not utter these names.

title>Tarohne's Lessons/title>
Everything you learned was a lie. Andraste was a deluded fool. The Maker is a hoax. There is far more evidence of the Forbidden Ones and demons then has been gathered over a thousand years of a fictitious god.
Demons are not enemies—they are tools to be used. Extract what secrets you can and teach others. Some of us will die, some will be corrupted. But each victory is another pieces of the truth we uncover.

title>Tarohne's Beginnings II/title>
Inside the grimoire's pages were such secrets. A mage's rightful place is not under the heel of the templars. We are masters of the elements. We call forth the spirits themselves. As far as we have advanced, the ancient Tevinter mages knew so much more... and even they were only starting their journey to understand the nature of our world.
We were never meant to walk among mortal men. We were meant to command them.

title>Tarohne's Prophecies/title>
The Fell Grimoire holds the names of power. It holds the key to their summoning. Xebenkeck will return. He will feast on the blood of a thousand of my enemies. It is inevitable!

title>Excerpt from The Last Letters of Tarohne/title>
I have copied the grimoire and hidden it. It must live on. It is the signpost of The Path, and The Path never dies. I have set guardians along it, but you must overcome them. Read the signs, my brothers and sisters. For even if my enemies destroy me, together we cannot fail. There are secrets undreamt of deep in the Fade. Therein lies our destiny—our salvation.
Sundermount

Anything you ask.
You honor me.
I can't imagine any way this will go wrong.
Why not?

Ask your question first.
The Divine is concerned about the situation here. She does not want to see the Free Marches become another Imperium.
She has sent an agent to... assess the danger.
Meet with her, please. Tell her drastic measures won't be required.
I don't want to see the Divine's armies march against Kirkwall.
Of course.
But they are needed.
Messages for the Wardens. Hmm. They'd probably pay to have them returned.
There's the dead drop. Hopefully the Wardens will appreciate this.

The templars are tracking down all apostates. So far, Hightown has been spared their scrutiny, but that will undoubtedly change. If you can help us, and possibly your own family and friends, please contact Mistress Selby at the docks. She's put herself in harm's way to help our lot out. And if just doing the right thing doesn't interest you, each job pays well.

Has Kirkwall not suffered enough? Should it be declared anathema and an enemy of the Chantry?
Imagine Hightown's streets, filled not just with Meredith's templars, but all the forces the Divine can command.
Surely the Divine wouldn't treat the whole city as enemies!
She is concerned. It is never wise to draw the concern of the powerful.
She is the voice of Andraste. She cannot turn the might of the Chantry against the innocent due to... proximity.
Were no innocents harmed in the Exalted Marches? She will do her best, Sebastian, but she must act first to protect the faith.
What can you tell me about this servant of the Divine?
Who is the agent?
I was not told her real name, only to call her Sister Nightingale.
She is said to be the Divine's left hand, sent to do work that might blacken the Divine's name.
What argument would convince her?
What should we say?
This cannot wait.
We'll go right now.
The mages here must be taught a lesson. I won't stand in the way.
I won't stop the Divine.
No one else's words bear your weight, Champion. If you do not do this, we will have war.
As you read the pages, the words change before your eyes. Fleeting sentences offer tantalizing secrets.
The book offers power in exchange for a promise: to leave it alone afterwards.
Accept the book's deal.
Your eyes can barely keep up with the words as they dance across the page. Knowledge courses through your skull.
It ends, and you feel stronger. You also find it hard to even glance at the book.

Pick up the body.
There must be someplace in the area you can hide the corpse.
Leave it.

— Prince Sebastian Vael
Prince Sebastian Vael of Starkhaven has offered a bounty on members of the Flint mercenary company who killed his family.
The Kirkwall Chantry has guarded the remains of the martyr Deverina for eight hundred years. They must be protected.
I will not leave my flock.
Would you let yourself die?
There is no greater devotion than to lay one's life at the Maker's feet. There is no better death than to take the blow for another.
Sister Nightingale took a great risk to warn you. Don't be rash.
Please reconsider.
You don't hear that one quoted often, do you?
That's morbid.
You've been warned. Do what you will.
Fine. Your choice.
Please, your grace. Sister Nightingale thinks there will be war.
Then I must make peace.
If you will not shield yourself, then I will be your shield. You will come through this safely, by the Maker's name. I swear it.
The first Flint Company mercenary group was dealt with. More remain.
The second Flint Company mercenary group was dealt with. More remain.
The third Flint Company mercenary group was dealt with. More remain.
All of the Flint Company mercenary groups were dealt with. Return to the chantry and tell Prince Sebastian Vael that his family is avenged.
Sebastian Vael was very pleased that his family was avenged, and offered a reward.
I'm at your service, Hawke. Where do you want me?
Sebastian, I need you somewhere with a good vantage. Cover us while we move in.
May the Maker favor us now.
Mercenary
This is why Andraste spoke against magic. To the Void with him and his kind!
Come. This beast has not yet been brought to heel.
Steel Latch
Fanatic
Fanatic
Fanatic
Fanatic
Fanatic
Fanatic
Look to the Chantry! There is no easy solution here, but the Chantry has kept the balance for a thousand years. Listen to Elthina.
Enter the Fade? Hawke, don't do this. The Golden City was corrupted from such folly.
Elthina! No! Maker, no! She was Your most faithful, Your most beloved...
Why didn't she listen to me?
Maybe she wasn't there. Maybe she made it out...
Blessed be the souls of the faithful that they ascend to Your right hand...
Why are we debating the Right of Annulment when the monster who did this is right here?
I swear to you, I will kill him!
This? This is what you tried to trick me into doing?
And you went along with him!
You were... part of this?
Elthina is not the Circle! She was a good woman, and you murdered her!
But what of Anders?
Your first act must be to execute this traitor.
Did they act alone? We may find answers if we search them.
A secret meeting at the docks. The plot thickens. Shall we?
He should be killed on the spot. With the templars busy, there is no one who can contain him until a trial.
You condone this? The brutal death of an innocent woman of faith? Someone you knew! Who trusted you!
Do not hide behind your spirit! It was your hand that did this.
If I'd been in that chantry today, would you be waffling? You know what must be done!
It will never be enough, but it's a start.
No! You cannot let this abomination walk free. He dies, or I am returning to Starkhaven.
And I will bring such an army with me on my return that there'll be nothing left of Kirkwall for these maleficarum to rule!
Do not interfere, Sebastian.
I will not kill him.
I thought I knew you, Hawke.
I gave up on Starkhaven to serve the Maker, but He has turned his back on Kirkwall for harboring heretics like this.
You're the one who taught me that it is the ends that matter, not the steps you take to get there.
I will not fight you, Hawke. My death now would serve nothing.
I will return to Starkhaven. But...
I swear to you, I will come back and find your precious Anders. I will teach him what true justice is!
Thank you for my life. I'll try not to make such a mess of it this time.
He's right. The grand cleric deserves justice.
Fine. Anders dies.
Yes. I would not deny anyone's right to that.
Him being our man would be a trifle too easy.
And this Javaris is supposed to be a master thief?
My throat burns. We must find the source.
Dear Andraste, forgive us. They are beyond our help.
They deserve their fates.
Time to tell the Arishok how he was right... and wrong.
So, who hired that lot? Someone anti-Qunari, anti-viscount, or Saemus himself not wanting to be rescued?
Any chance the Arishok will just give us the viscount's son?
The chantry is never this quiet. Where's Saemus?
Qunari and blood in the chantry. The viscount's son dead. This won't just go away.
A fine mess for both sides.
We won't be here when you get back. We got a campsite outside the city. Look for us there.
There was no time to deal with Aveline's concerns.
You're doing well for yourself.
Her Grace would never be involved in something like this!
There was no time to complete Aveline's request.
These zealots have taken noble ideals too far.
Then we'll find her.
By Chantry law, these mages must be contained. But Elthina, bless her, feared Meredith as much.
I will stand with you, Hawke.
The Wardens never received their secret letters.
The trouble on the Wounded Coast continues to this day.
The Carta swindlers continue to harass Lowtown to this day.
Maker forgive me for aiding these apostates, but the knight-commander must be stopped.
Each of these maleficar could have helped Anders with his butchery.
This is everything that Grand Cleric Elthina feared.
We must end this at the Gallows.
Harley and her men were left to die.
The Evets Marauders were killed. It's too late to collect a reward.
No one knows what actually happened between Renvil Harrowmont and the Carta years ago.
Taarbas never located the Qunari blades in Kirkwall.
The accusations against Aveline went unanswered.
It's too late to assist Varric with this now.
It's too late to assist Varric with this now.
A nameless friend has offered a reward for the removal of the minor gangs running rampant at night in Lowtown, Hightown, and the Docks.
All of the minor gangs that claimed Kirkwall over the years have been defeated.
Not all of the minor gangs that claimed Kirkwall over the years were defeated.
The Sharps aim to needle Lowtown to death, but their leader, Ignacio Strand, can't hide forever. Clear their hideout.
Aside from a few stragglers, the Sharps are no longer keen on taking Lowtown.
The Sharps claimed Lowtown for several years.
The Redwater Teeth are all over the Docks. Convince their leader, Leech, that his broad reaching is ill-advised by clearing the Redwater hideout.
The Redwater Teeth were once called the Dandy Lampreys. True story.
The Redwater Teeth claimed the Docks for several years.
The Shallowguard use guardsmen uniforms to get close to their victims. Assault their storehouse, and take out the false captain.
Aside from some stragglers, The Shallowguard are no more.
The Shallowguard vexed Hightown for several years.
The Dog Lords are making every Fereldan look bad. Clear their hideout and kill The Bastard.
Aside from a few strays, the Dog Lords are no more.
The Dog Lords claimed Lowtown for several years.
The Carta offshoot The Undercuts are smuggling weapons. Can't have their leader, Kanky Hammertoe, arming just anyone. Clear their hideout.
Aside from a few stragglers, The Undercuts are keeping a low profile.
The Undercuts claimed Lowtown for several years.
The Invisible Sisters claim Hightown at night. Eliminate Gracious Gillian Winger in the group's hideout.
The Invisible Sisters were exposed. Stalkings are down considerably.
The Invisible Sisters claimed Hightown for several years.
The Followers of She are all over Lowtown. Clear their hideout and rid the city of this She.
Hanker and the moderate dreams of her followers are defeated. Only stragglers won't stop believing.
The Followers of She claimed Lowtown for several years.
The Reining Men are corralling people in the Docks. The street's the place to go to oust Leashmaster Jess Varvel from her hideout.
According to all sources, most of the slavers have abandoned Lowtown.
The Reining Men claimed the Docks for several years.
The Crimson Weaver bloodragers are terrorizing Hightown. Track their leader, The Bleeder, to their hideout.
The major cutters of the Crimson Weavers have been stanched.
The Crimson Weave claimed Hightown for several years.
The Notes of Arl Foreshadow

Readings for endless days by the coming fire:
Elvehan Diis Falsis: Triew Metod Dracas -Transitional Tevinter. Interesting.
Perforation Theory: Walking the Dream -Worrying. Good walls make good neighbors. Also, parapets.
Of Locks and Lineage: If Right was Wrong -“Whoops” indeed.
The Qun -Popular. Get one before they're gone.
Timely Talking: The Art of the Reveal -Irrelevant. Some take steps by two, and speak as such.
The Awiergan Scrolls: First Aspect
A hidden lair has been added to the map. Follow to see what lies beneath.
A physical aspect of something has been destroyed.
A hidden lair has been added to the map. Follow to see what lies beneath.
A physical aspect of something has been destroyed.
The Awiergan Scrolls: Second Aspect
A hidden lair has been added to the map. Follow to see what lies beneath.
A physical aspect of something has been destroyed.
The Awiergan Scrolls: Third Aspect
Search for more scrolls and hidden lairs to reveal an ancient evil.
Search for the last scroll and hidden lair to reveal an ancient evil.
The Awiergan Scrolls: Pride Unbound
There is an ancient evil sealed beneath Kirkwall. Search Darktown for a hidden magical entrance.
The physical form of Hybris is defeated.
Fenris's sister left the Hanged Man long ago.
The Awiergan Scrolls: First Aspect
The Awiergan Scrolls: Second Aspect
The Awiergan Scrolls: Third Aspect

Two scrolls. The first is a letter bearing the seal of a lesser Orlesian noble house.
Our line is dead, but still walking. I know not if it is because of the old ways, but my three boys are now something other because of want. If He can be called on, I ask you, Scholar, do so, and the price is paid.
The second scroll is vellum, with archaic script and phrasing, but the red ink remains somehow wet.
Of binding a symptom, no vial can contain you. Two of three, three yourself, asunder. Caged, but still meddling, you will not goad me. Truth will hold you, or it is no longer true.
The second scroll ends with a crude map, and a handprint in red, the little finger severed at the second knuckle.

The first scroll bears Rivaini markings.
He was our hero against Par Vollen, and we were in awe. Perhaps it was our fault. There was a day when he changed and saw us as servants, not those he offered to serve. And then he was infested. We need a seal, Scholar, in the faith you choose. The price is paid.
The second scroll is vellum with archaic script and phrasing, but the red ink remains somehow wet.
Of binding a symptom, no vial can contain you. Three of three, you perverted a man elevated by others. I will not yield, even as I must turn to face you. Truth will hold you, or a new truth we will create.
The second scroll ends with a crude map and a handprint in red, the little finger severed at the root.

The first scroll is marked with a Chasind chieftain’s sigil.
Mine dottir was taken by the caster, and mine legion met him. She was pried from his blood-scrawls, but some horror did inhabit him instead. Mine legion could not contain, and I ask for a seal, whatever the faith. Price be paid, Scholar.
The second scroll is vellum with archaic script and phrasing, but the red ink remains somehow wet.
Of binding a symptom, no vial can contain you. One of three, separated in prevention. Unbound, but caged, I must not follow. Truth will hold you, for that is what truth does.
The second scroll ends with a crude map and a handprint in red, the little finger severed at the first knuckle.
Fenris eventually went to deal with Hadriana himself. He has not spoken of it since.
The Wild Ones

A matter of public safety:
Though feral mabari were eliminated as a threat within the city, many beasts escaped to infest the countryside. This is an ongoing threat to commerce on several trade routes surrounding the city.
By the authority of the guard, we offer a bounty for these animals. Baiting posts have been set on several trails. Bait them with mutton, and no doubt these animals will make their presence known.
Find the baiting posts outside of Kirkwall, and draw out the feral mabari packs.
The feral mabari outside Kirkwall are dead. Return to the civilian contract board in the barracks.
The feral mabari were cleared from around Kirkwall.
The mabari outside Kirkwall went unchecked.

A matter of public safety:
Efforts to control feral mabari have only culled the weakest. The Formari have added to the problem with the escape of a pure breeding bitch two years ago. The wild mabari are showing her influence by herding other animals, a behavior that has recently expanded to hunting lightly armed smugglers.
By the authority of the guard, a reward is offered to anyone who can fight through the herded prey to kill the pure bitch and her pack.
Kill the herded animals and highwaymen outside Kirkwall to find the bitch.
The bitch is dead. Return to the citizen contract board in the barracks.
The pure bitch is dead.
The pure bitch went unchecked.
100% Pure Bitch
Whatever a Spider

A matter of public safety:
Fereldans in the lesser districts cannot feed themselves, let alone their accursed hounds. Many have simply turned their animals to the streets to become a constant feral nuisance.
By the authority of the guard, we offer a bounty for these loathsome animals, regardless of breed. Clear Darktown for a reward.
Kill the packs of ferel mabari infesting Darktown.
The feral mabari in Darktown are dead. Return to the citizen contract board in the barracks.
The feral mabari were cleared from Darktown.
Darktown's mabari went unchecked.
Fine Hounds Abound

A matter of public safety:
Seems some of the refugees are desperate enough to risk threadbare magics. There are reports of an abomination and its mindless thralls lurking among slavers.
By the authority of the guard, it is preferred that this civilian matter be closed before the templars decide to wall off entire sections of Kirkwall. Let some targeted justice resolve this for once.
Search the corners of Lowtown for thralls of the abomination.
The thralls of the abomination point the way. The lair of the abomination is on the map.
The abomination is dead. Return to the civilian contract board in the barracks.
The abomination is dead.
A Breech Below

A matter of public safety:
A splinter group of apostates, determined to prove the templar’s case, are drawing workers from around the mines. Their siren songs have caused chaos.
By the authority of the guard, we ask for assistance. It may be templar duty, but we, alone, must prevent the greater citizenry from harm. Remove the practitioners of this coven before they further disgrace Kirkwall.
Track the coven to the mines.
The witches were costumed courtesans. Kill the other abominations.
The abominations are dead. Return to the civilian contract board in the barracks.
The abominations are dead.
Witch Ones Where

A matter of public safety:
The templars are so busy inventing enemies that we are left to deal with the ones under their noses. Blasted mages and templars leave us to keep people safe! We are gathering to stand against something unleashed and overlooked.
Join us in Darktown to clear the tunnels of whatever arcane filth has nested there. If we give them Darktown, where will they go next? The guards await all volunteers. Stand, citizens!
Join the guardsmen in Darktown to hunt abominations.
Go to the lair to clear it out.
The arcane horror is gone. Return to the civilian contract board in the barracks.
The arcane horror is gone.
Citizens Arcane

A matter of public safety:
Refugees have interrupted the inspection of incoming ships, and contaminated food has slipped through. Rivaini fruit crates infested with spider eggs are now spread throughout the city. The beasts are hatching everywhere!
By the authority of the guard, a bounty will be paid to anyone who cures the spider infestation. Bait their lairs in Lowtown and the Docks with Rivaini fruit. They seem to know the smell of home.
Find spider lairs in Lowtown and the Docks to draw out the infestation.
The locations of the lairs suggest a central nest on the map.
All of the spiders are gone. Return to the citizen contract board in the barracks.
The spiders have been cleared.
The coven went unchecked.
The trouble in Darktown went unchecked.

Unwanted competition helps no one. A bunch of foreign assassins are roaming the streets looking for some fool mage. Can't have these people killing without contracts. It’s chaos!
Get rid of these fools before they bring the guard down on us all.
Search Kirkwall for assassins hunting a mage.
Search Kirkwall for more assassins hunting Sketch.
All this chasing has revealed Sketch’s hiding place. Find him for a reward.
Return to the bounty board in the Lowtown Bazaar for an additional reward.
Sketchy on the Details

Troublemakers need a lesson! Boys stole a bunch of guard uniforms, and now they’re taking tolls. I pay through proper channels, not some git with a helm.
Kill the fake guards. Simple. Pays well.
Kill the fake guards hiding in Darktown.
The fake guards are dead.
The fake guards went unchecked.
Dirty Boys

I swear this is real! Profit is waiting.
Lyrium. All you could want just sitting there in caves that are supposed to be bare. It’s too good to be true! Except that it is true!
I can't get the sweet vision out of my head, but I'm not so foolish to go myself. Stake my claim, or prove me wrong! Either way, payment is yours.
Look for the rumored lyrium cache in the caves near the Deep Roads.
The lyrium cache was a trap. Kill the desire demons.
The demons are gone, and there’s no lyrium to be had.
The claims of lyrium went uninvestigated.
Delyrium, Delightful

We were digging. No harm in that! Maybe we end in a Hightown vault, maybe we don't. But Blind Rudy got turned round and we hit something other. Now we got a walking rock stomping around!
Payment made for anyone who passes that angry stone out of our tunnels before the guards get involved. We need to get back to work!
Destroy the golem wandering Darktown.
Find the Primary linked to the minor golems. Destroy enough of them and its location will appear on the map.
The golems were destroyed. Return to the odd job board in the Lowtown Bazaar.
The golems were destroyed
Golemite Explosion

Carta smugglers! Hate them all, especially the factions the Carta can't control! Seems like they could go through proper lines, but if they want to play mean, I'll play mean.
Payment promised for anyone who checks my caches. And if you find a Carta group trying to make coin on the side by thieving, deal with them. Where is the honor among thieves these days?
Find Kirkwall's smuggler caches and deal with the Carta thieves.
Go to the Beard Splitters' base to clear out the Carta offshoot.
The Carta Beard Splitters are gone. Return to the odd job board in the Lowtown Bazaar.
The Carta Beard Splitters are gone.
Just Check the Cache

It’s not fair! Some of us get by just fine on our own greed, but then some fools go and drag demons into it. I need a partner who feels the same.
Payment squared and real for anyone willing to face the demon behind the pickpockets running Lowtown. Kill one or two and she'll show her hand. I know it!
Search Lowtown for enthralled pickpockets.
The demon is on the move. Track her lair on the map and kill her.
The demon is gone. Return to the odd job board in the Lowtown Bazaar.
The demon is gone.
Sink or Shiv

Penitence pays, if you know who to badger.
Been bartering for absolution. Freelance work. The Chantry doesn't want to dole it out, but I need someone to pick up the donations.
Take care, though. Seems some people think I should actually be a sister. What harm if the people feel better? Besides, the sorts who are desperate for this forgiveness just want the appearance. Killers, mostly. Maker be praised if they are lost to this world.
Empty the fake donation boxes. Watch out for the unrepentant.
The fake donations were collected. Return them to the odd job board in the Lowtown Bazaar.
The fake donations were collected.
The fake donations went uncollected.
Shrift Work
Fenris is probably long gone from Kirkwall by now.
There wasn't enough time to resolve this.
You took care of the foreign assassins.
The mage-hunting assassins went unchecked.
Gamlen didn't find the Gem of Keroshek.
The fakes are dead. Return to the odd job board in the Lowtown Bazaar for a reward.
The golem went unchecked.
The Carta offshoot went unchecked.
The demon went unchecked.
The Splintered Order of the Vials
The Splintered Order of the Vials

The Black Vials are glass phylacteries that cage powerful revenants. Dark shapes swirl inside, obscuring slips of vellum that name the body the demon holds. The identity of the order that created the vials is a carefully guarded secret.

center>*****/center>
title>Binding the First Corpse Walker/title> Hunted to the north and held by your true name. Oswal Memnon, revenant and perversion of friend not met. Even in this foreign place, know that we hunt and hold. Andraste hold you, demon, and bind your rage for eternity.
Six thumbprints in blood mark the end of the text. One is smaller, adolescent.

center>*****/center>
title>Binding the Second Corpse Walker/title> Betrayed, we bind you by your true name, known too well. Mal Terynth, revenant and perversion, your crime cannot be spoken. Though some are lost and some turn away, the order remains. Andraste hold you, demon, and bind your rage for eternity.
Four thumbprints in blood mark the end of the text.

center>*****/center>
title>Binding the Third Corpse Walker/title> The order turns away, we bind your name as we curse it. Garis Eond, revenant and perversion of a trusted advisor. Alone we will continue, your sanction is irrelevant. Andraste hold you, demon, and bind your rage for eternity.
Three thumbprints in blood mark the end of the text.

center>*****/center>
title>Binding the Fourth Corpse Walker/title> Curse your true name that we tore from your unknowing kin. Sister Keryn, revenant, we endure, despite what you force us to become. Blood for blood, if it must be. Andraste hold you, demon, and bind your rage for eternity.
Three thumbprints in blood mark the end of the text.

center>*****/center>
title>Binding the Fifth Corpse Walker/title> Daiasis Ammond. Rot in your cage, and know that I will hunt those who hid your name, and each will die by the same wound. Andraste hold you, pretender, by the throat I cut.
There are two thumbprints, but one is smeared, as though forced.

center>*****/center>
Binding the Sixth Corpse Walker I am lost, rightly bound by my true name on her last breath. Randle Goodson, perversion, becomes what I most hated. There is no forgiveness for the wrongs beneath the rights. Andraste hold me, and forgive me, though I deserve neither.
One oily black thumbprint marks the end of the text.
Find the six Black Vials in and around Kirkwall.
All six Black Vials were found.
Some Black Vials remain hidden.
A manifest and receipt for a shipment delivered to the warehouses around the docks. Crates have gone missing for years for the loss of lesser documents, despite the efforts of top men.
An old crate was found in the warehouse.
The manifest went unused.
Ragged Manifest
A market stall key common to storage crates in the bazaar, many of which have outlasted their owners.
An old crate was found in the bazaar.
The key went unused.
Rusty Market Key

The last page of a notorious, out-of-print bodice-ripper popular among the transplanted Orlesians of Hightown. Wither Nug Storm tells of Lady Mary Sue Constance Trueroyal’s choice between her betrothed, Ser Rival Grouseman, and the young upstart Lieutenant Gerund Uberhart. How unfulfilling must it be for someone to have a copy and not know the gripping conclusion?
She chose a free life on the waves. And several cabin boys. The exploits of Mary Sue are suspect literature at best.
She apparently went unfulfilled.
Who She Chose
Stone, but not carved. Formed from a molten state and somehow made intricate enough to operate a lock. Possibly dwarven, and certainly very old.
The match for the ancient stone key was found.
The key went unused.
Ancient Stone Key
The Seal of House Talwain
The Talwains are known around the market in Hightown. Return their seal for a reward.
The seal of house Talwain was returned.
The seal went unreturned.
Sister Phylias often repeats a time-honored sermon about Brother Wentworth. She is sometimes outside the chantry.
Sister Phylias was eager to receive the finger.
No one got the finger. That may be fortunate.
Wentworth’s Sixth Finger
An old shawl embroidered with a family name, a Tevinter symbol of femininity, and the crest of the Blooming Rose.
The shawl of Dalesdottir is in the proper hands.
The shawl never found a home.
Shawl of Dalesdottir
This pommel, judging by the teeth marks, was lost in a violent exchange. Aside from the engraved name, it looks like standard city guard gear.
Eustice has her pommel back.
Eustice went without her pommel.
Eustice’s Pommel
A vellum map of the route taken by a famed explorer. Many claim a link to his legacy, including a well-known family in Hightown.
The route of Dervin de Bois is in family hands.
The route was not returned.
The Route of Dervin de Bois
A small cameo brooch of a young girl holding a goose. On the back is the Soliere family crest, former Lowtown nobles that have fallen on hard times.
The cameo was placed in family hands.
The Goosegirl went unclaimed.
Goosegirl Cameo
Two semi-precious blue gems set in silver that's weighty, ornate, and typical of the more colorful mages held in the Gallows.
Jamos has his lost eyes.
Jamos can't see shit.
The Eyes of Azure Jamos

Half finished, half reasoned, and likely dropped down a sewer in exactly the way a self-important fool might react if a templar looked in his general direction. “Bonwald” is doodled inside, along with a shopping list for the Lowtown Bazaar.
Bonwald has his shopping list. Tremble, oh Thedas.
Bonwald never reclaimed his list. He's dead, but that's unrelated.
Grimoire of the Apprentice
A particularly strong tincture of rosehip and goose shit. A folk remedy for an embarrassing rash, the label says its intended recipient was Dalian Shaw of Darktown.
Dalien Shaw has his redblossom special. The swelling is down.
The tincture went unused, although the smell still lingers.
Redblossom Special

A map with a generous interpretation of the reach of Orlais. Many similar documents were thrown from windows each time Kirkwall was liberated, much to the frustration of those in the Gallows tasked with record keeping.
The map is back in Kirkwall's records.
The map was not returned.
Map of Occupied Kirkwall
A relic of the Old Gods once worshipped throughout the North. There are nobles who seek to preserve these now heretical items, but it is more of a Hightown hobby than serious archival affair.
The seal is in the appreciative hands.
The seal went unclaimed. Pity. The Old Gods ain't getting any younger.
Seal of the Old God Dumat
A notorious apostate highwayman who apparently went a little too far in his efforts to escape custody. The family name is common in Lowtown.
The remains are where they should be.
The remains were not returned.
South-Song Gerralt's Corpse
An elven highwayman who apparently escaped a little too well. No doubt someone among the Dalish remembers him.
The remains are where they should be.
The remains were not returned.
Remains of the Outlaw Half-Braid Silsam
A blade for collecting herbs. Elven, dull, and has a name gauged across the intricate designs, a disregard of heritage common to those new to the alienage. The name is Faj.
The knife is where it should be.
The knife went unclaimed.
Ream-Rot Knife

A rare collaboration between human and elven vintners. The result is a taste that has been called appropriately tense. Occasionally requested in the Lowtown Bazaar, although elves rarely do so openly.
The bottle is where it should be.
The bottle went unclaimed. Or dissolved.
Bottled Scar 5:34 Exalted
A poor map of the alienage is scratched on the symbol's back for no apparent reason, although many city elves have converted to worshipping the Maker.
The symbol is where it should be.
Now where did this get to? Behind the armoire, probably.
Rusted Symbol of Andraste
A symbol of Elgar'nan, elven god of fatherhood and vengeance. Worship is rare in the alienage, due to a loss of elven culture, but some holdouts cling to their barely-remembered ways.
The seal is where it should be.
The seal went unclaimed.
Seal of the All-Father

A satirical tome about a deluded brother of the Chantry who sought peace between elves and humans. A condemnation of fanatics of both races, it is favored by radical elves choosing to live in Darktown.
The book found an appreciative owner.
The book went unclaimed and is now balancing a table somewhere.
Locks of the Golden Fool
It’s a hat. It’s Waxler's. Whoever takes time to stitch their name in a stylish chapeau will probably want it back. It smells of cheap ale.
The hat is where it’s at.
The hat ain't all that.
Waxler’s Hat
Trousers of a rather inflated variety, cut short to fit a dwarf or perhaps in case of flood. Fit for Hightown. Impeccable in quality.
The pantaloons have been bestowed.
The pantaloons were once more lost to the ages. In the laundry.
The One True Pantaloons
The scattered remains of an infamous dwarf, Arintal by name. Worked out of the Docks, mostly, before going missing.
The remains are where they should be.
The remains went unclaimed. The beard, however...
Remains of the Outlaw Bearded Beast
A stone toe, chipped from a great dwarven statue. May be of interest to a dwarf new to the surface and looking for pieces of home. These surfacers often drift to the Lowtown Bazaar.
The toe is where it should be.
The toe is gone. Weep!
The Paragon's Toe
A faintly glowing support ring for a cask used in the creation of suspect liquors only palatable to dwarves and usually regarded as poisons by the guard. That narrows the hoop's origins to Darktown.
The hoop is where it should be.
The hoop was not claimed.
Lyrium-Laced Bilge Hoop
A defense of strict caste structure of interest to dwarven traditionalists. They rarely slum outside Hightown if they visit Kirkwall at all.
The treatise is in good hands.
The treatise went unclaimed.
Caste Treatise and House Accounting
Possibly discarded for lack of ancient elven boots. There's a cobbler in Lowtown who might be interested.
The laces are where they should be.
The laces are lost once more.
Ancient Elven Laces
A quality shield that has suffered significant damage. The family crest is known in Hightown.
The shield is in good hands.
The pieces were never claimed.
Baubel's Broken Shield
A small decorative shield, possibly a child's toy. It has the Javvith seal, a family of crafters who have been in Lowtown for generations.
The scale is in good hands.
The scale went unclaimed and was likely discarded.
Heron's Scale
The remains of a missionary sister who sought to bring the Chant of Light to the dark places of Kirkwall. The Chantry archivists are always looking to catalogue their lost on the memorial wall.
The dark places of Kirkwall are still dark.
The remains went unclaimed but were hopefully discarded of in a respectful fashion and not left to languish in Gamlen's freezer like so many other things.
The Remains of Sister Plinth
A family crest, typical of Hightown. A large fang is embedded in the corner.
The crest is in good hands.
The crest was not claimed, even though it was like finding a nameplate with the owner's address right on the bloody thing.
The Crest of de Grosbois
Sailcloth bearing the sign of The Fifth Wind, a pirate vessel once active on the Waking Sea. A prize find for any shipspotter along the docks.
The swatch is in good hands.
Unclaimed. Likely fell to nature's call.
Swatch of the Jackyard
Huzzah! He's seen the light!
What? Why?
No! Whatever lies he means you to tell the grand cleric, I will not be part of it!
I beg you to reconsider.
This is Hawke's choice, not yours.
I will stand by Anders.
I'm sticking with my decision.
If you can't be honest with me, I can't help you.
Sebastian's right.
Anders did not receive a key to the Hawke Estate.
You do what you must. I told you I will take no part in this.
Thank you.

Hubert didn't get to the bottom of the Bone Pit cargo thefts.
Spiders still infest the Bone Pit mines.
The undead still stalk the Bone Pit mines.

The high dragon at the Bone Pit was left to its own devices.

Fenris never received the tome.
Isabela refused her gift.
Isabela did not accept the talisman.
I hope you haven't come to try to talk me into leaving again.
Kirkwall needs a steadying hand on its reins, now more than ever.
The viscount lies dead. I will not leave my people to bear the price of war between the templars and maleficarum.
Thank you for your assistance. Sebastian is eager, but perhaps not as steady as I need.
Orsino and the knight-commander grow more fractious by the day.
Who is Sebastian? Is he just a brother in the Chantry?
Tell me about Sebastian.
Now. He was a prince of Starkhaven until his family was murdered by a rival. But Sebastian was pledged here long before that.
It is occasionally useful to know a man of faith with martial training whose first loyalty is not to Meredith.
He is my eyes and ears in the city. He brings disturbing news of the growing unrest between the mages and templars.
It is not known whether Connor and his uncle escaped from Kirkwall.

Repentance
Accompany Sebastian to Lady Harimann's estate to learn why she hired Flint Company to murder his family.
Sebastian has something he would like to discuss with you at the chantry.
Strange things are happening at the Harimann estate. Find out what's behind them.

A group of desire demons tried to block the entrance to a ruin behind the Harimann estate. It appears they—or something they serve—are behind the Harimanns' downfall. Explore the ruin to find what they're protecting.
The desire demon that corrupted Lady Harimann is dead. Leave the ruin and return to the chantry.
The desire demon behind the attack on Sebastian's family was defeated. Talk to Sebastian at the chantry about what happened.
Keran got in over his head. Surely that doesn't merit death?
You cannot think the knight-commander is worse than blood mages.
This is why the Chantry first instituted the Circle. Mages must be protected from themselves.
Pray for her soul, child. The Maker may have mercy even now.
Emile belongs in the Circle, yes, but he is no danger to anyone.
Huon and Evelina were entirely innocent, then?
And you cannot seriously be blind to what just happened!
Somehow I'd imagined it would be more difficult to track down a blood mage.
It would take more than blood magic for that.
It is a difficult question for all of us.
Her Grace had no knowledge of this affair. I trust she will deal with it swiftly.
The shame he brought?
The man was a drunk. Surely you don't think Grand Cleric Elthina is funding zealots?
Keep an open mind, Hawke. Elthina isn't behind this.
When Qunari invade, they gather all the nobles just like this.
Those who convert to the qun live. Everyone else...
The chantry's overrun with people seeking refuge.
The lengths one will go for love.
Tal-Vashoth
Tal-Vashoth Officer
Tal-Vashoth Saarebas
Isabela did not get to deal with the man from her past.
Tal-Vashoth
Isabela was unable to retrieve her relic.
No wonder the Maker left his children.
Lothering has been destroyed, and you barely escaped with your family. The darkspawn horde is on your heels and right now survival is the only consideration.

You finally reached Kirkwall, though not with everyone. Your sister, Bethany, is dead. So too is Aveline's husband, the templar you encountered while escaping the darkspawn. As bad as things are, however, it seems that Kirkwall offers little respite. The city is flooded with Fereldan refugees and has closed its doors to outsiders. Leaving is not an option—there must be a way in!

You finally reached Kirkwall, though not with everyone. Your brother, Carver, is dead. So too is Aveline's husband, the templar you encountered while escaping the darkspawn. As bad as things are, however, it seems that Kirkwall offers little respite. The city is flooded with Fereldan refugees and has closed its doors to outsiders. Leaving is not an option—there must be a way in!
I must agree, Hawke. Grand Cleric Elthina would never do such a thing.
I'll speak to Her Grace another time. You will not always be here.
You can't keep me from her.
We can't abandon our friend in his hour of need.
This is wrong.
Is that a trick question?

After a year in Kirkwall, you're finally free to make your fortune. An opportunity to join a Deep Roads expedition has arisen—but according to Varric, you'll need to raise enough coin to convince his brother to make you a partner.

Against all odds, you've raised enough coin to become partners in Bartrand's expedition and supplied him with the needed map into the Deep Roads. He's ready to go whenever you are, but beware: it'll be a long trip.

The expedition struck into the Deep Roads... only to find its way blocked by a collapse in the main cavern. You and Varric will need to explore the dangerous side passages to find some way around. If there even is one.
After weeks of travel, the expedition finally found the lost dwarven thaig, full of wonders that even Varric and Bartrand weren't expecting. This mysterious place will need to be explored further.
Bartrand has betrayed you. He took the strange lyrium idol and locked you and Varric inside the crypt where you discovered it. If another way out isn't found you'll be trapped here forever.

In the last three years, you reclaimed your family's mansion in Hightown and become a citizen of note... enough so that Viscount Marlowe Dumar requested your help. Apparently, the Arishok asked to speak with you, and the viscount would like you to go to the Qunari Compound and help the city resolve the growing tension with its foreign visitors.

Viscount Dumar asked that you assist the Arishok with his requests, before tension between the city and the Qunari reaches a breaking point. He's hoping that you, as a prominent citizen of Kirkwall, will be able to serve your home by finding a solution to the coming crisis.

In the last three years, you've become a wealthy and respected citizen. The viscount asked you to aid the Arishok and help resolve the conflict with the stranded Qunari, but things only seem to be getting worse.

It seems Isabela knew more about the Qunari's situation in Kirkwall than she told you. She stole a holy relic from the Arishok and then lost it. Now she's stolen it again and seems to be gone for good. And the Qunari will not rest until they get it back.

Aveline appeared at your home with disturbing news: she's been tasked with arresting several elves that fled justice by taking refuge among the Qunari, and she needs you to go with her to their compound. Considering the tensions with the Qunari following the death of the viscount's son, this visit should be anything but peaceful.

The Arishok refused to hand over the elven fugitives to Aveline. What's more, he will not remain in the city a moment longer without taking action to eliminate what he sees as human greed and corruption. Kirkwall is under attack.
Isabela never got revenge on Castillon.

You are Kirkwall's Champion: the one who foiled the Qunari attack and saved the city's people. With the viscount dead, only Knight-Commander Meredith holds more power... which she uses to crush the Circle of Magi under her heel. You sided with First Enchanter Orsino against her after his speech in Hightown. Whether this will bring more trouble your way remains to be seen.

You are Kirkwall's Champion: the one who foiled the Qunari attack and saved the city's people. With the viscount dead, only Knight-Commander Meredith holds more power... which she uses to combat the rise of illegal magic. You sided with her after First Enchanter Orsino's speech in Hightown, but further problems seem almost certain.

To provoke a confrontation between the templars and mages, Anders destroyed Kirkwall's chantry... killing Grand Cleric Elthina and everyone in it. Knight-Commander Meredith blamed all mages for this disaster and invoked the Right of Annulment on the Circle. You sided with First Enchanter Orsino, but there is an army of templars in the city and you must reach the Gallows before every mage is killed.

To provoke a confrontation between the templars and mages, Anders destroyed Kirkwall's chantry... killing Grand Cleric Elthina and everyone in it. Knowing that the people would only blame the mages, Meredith had no choice but to invoke the Right of Annulment, which means the death of every mage in Kirkwall. You sided with the knight-commander and now must join the templars at the Gallows to restore order.

Knight-Commander Meredith invoked the Right of Annulment on Kirkwall's Circle, which means every mage in the city must die. Meredith's army of templars and city guardsmen now surrounds the Gallows. You must get as many mages out alive as you can.

Knight-Commander Meredith invoked the Right of Annulment on Kirkwall's Circle, which means every mage in the city must die. You stand with Meredith's army of templars and city guardsmen that now surrounds the Gallows. When the assault finally begins, you will face desperate mages that will do anything to survive. Even the templars have their doubts, now, but Meredith insists that this must be done.

Knight-Commander Meredith invoked the Right of Annulment on Kirkwall's Circle, which means every mage in the city must die. The assault on the Gallows is underway and First Enchanter Orsino is gone, having transformed himself with blood magic into a horrible abomination. Now there is only a mad rush for survival.

Knight-Commander Meredith invoked the Right of Annulment on Kirkwall's Circle, which means every mage in the city must die. It turns out Meredith wasn't wrong after all. First Enchanter Orsino used blood magic to transform himself into a terrible abomination and was slain. Order has been restored to Kirkwall.

You are Kirkwall's Champion: the one who foiled the Qunari attack and saved the city's people. With the viscount dead, only Knight-Commander Meredith holds more power... which she uses to crush the Circle of Magi under her heel. When First Enchanter Orsino spoke out in public against her, you refused to side with either of them. Whether this will just bring you more trouble remains to be seen.

I think his family deserves to be avenged.
I'm going to help him.
But I'm sure he'll be pleased to speak with someone who disagrees.
Thank you, Your Grace.
I should go.
Maker's blessing on you, child.
A pause that says you knew. But does Her Grace?
I doubt she would approve, and she will hear of it.
She wouldn't permit this.
It sounds like you've been bad. This will shock Her Grace, no doubt.
Naughty girl.
Anders wanted to look for evidence of a templar plot to use the Rite of Tranquility on all mages, but there wasn't time.
Anders wanted to create a potion to remove the spirit of Justice from inside him, but there wasn't enough time.
Is something troubling you?
Did you know someone used the authority of your name to instigate a crime against the Qunari?
Someone used your seal.
The path to righteousness is never as straight and narrow as we wish.
I truly hoped this would not go so far...
But do not trouble yourself. I will step in when it's time.
Sebastian! Stop this madness!
The raider captains held their clandestine meeting without interruption.
Maker take his soul. Or, ah, whoever he would want to take it.
Terrie's comrade was never rescued from the mercenaries.
The midnight meeting in Hightown has long since past.
None of the apostates sought by the Kirkwall templars were ever captured.
You don't have to go down this path. Are you certain, Merrill?
Then give up blood magic. Destroy the mirror. Before it's too late.
Over the years, Ser Conrad Vernhart's skill at capturing mages has become legendary. He's feared by apostates everywhere.
The debt of Keran's family was never repaid. Like many poor families, they've suffered a great deal over the years.
Some of Tarohne's forbidden tomes of knowledge are still unaccounted for. After so many years, some may be far from Kirkwall by now.
Oh, Merrill...
Marcia Arthurius never collected all the special ingredients she needed.
The elven apostates that broke out of the Gallows remain forever at large.
Clara's quest to find a cure for the werewolves of the Brecilian Forest failed. Dark tales of bestial attacks in southern Ferelden are told, even as far away as Kirkwall.
Years ago, a number of Amaranthine conspirators escaped from Kirkwall. They continue to cause problems for the Warden-Commander.
The lost Qunari patrol was never found.
The elite Qunari patrols outside of Kirkwall returned home unscathed. They killed many Kirkwall citizens and nobles before the Arishok was dealt with.
Blood mages are still at large in Kirkwall.
Meeran's job was never finished.
Athenril's job was disregarded.
Most Kirkwall nobles avoided the conflict between Knight-Commander Meredith and First Enchanter Orsino.
Nuncio's quest was abandoned long ago.
Yehven's sons have been left in the Deep Roads for too long. There is no longer any chance they have survived.

The rescue of the viscount’s son was left to a group of mercenaries.
Ghyslain de Carrac never found his wife.
Just point the way and we'll take care of it.
I thought we protect people.
You have family and they're alive. If you don't contact them, one day you will regret it.
Why does it seem like a bad idea to put these two together?
This is a worthy cause. If we can help, we should.
Maker, take your servant and hold him. Let him dwell by your side in the life hereafter.
Crawling through blight-infested tunnels, rescuing Wardens in peril. This is what I signed on for.

You arrived in Kirkwall, but found no refuge. The city is flooded with refugees and is closed to outsiders—and the help your mother hoped to get from your uncle, Gamlen, turned out to be a year of servitude to one of his contacts in exchange for entry. There seems to be little choice but to do as he suggests.
Whatever Anso wanted was lost, and his job was abandoned.
Why didn't your family's enemies hunt you down, as well?
Why are you still alive?
That's why I took the offensive. Thanks to you, those Flint Company assassins are no longer a danger.
I'm the last of my line. Unless I survive, my family will have no justice.
World Map
Any idea why they turned on you?
Why would they do that?
Money? Power? It's hard to say.
Lady Harimann was always jealous of my family for being royalty when hers were mere nobility.
But I can't imagine that pushing her into outright murder.

After spending a year working off your debt in Kirkwall, you're finally free to make your fortune. You heard about a rare expedition into the Deep Roads, but according to Bartrand—the dwarf leading it—they don't need additional hirelings. There must be some way to change his mind!

Against all odds, you've raised enough coin to become partners in Bartrand's expedition and supply him with the needed map into the Deep Roads. Bartrand's not ready to leave yet, so there's still time to resolve unfinished business in Kirkwall.

There's one more wrinkle in your effort to join Bartrand's expedition. You'll need to find a map into the Deep Roads, and there's only one way to get it: from Anders, a Grey Warden somewhere in Kirkwall. You'll need the map and the coin before the expedition can leave.

You found a way out of the crypt where Bartrand abandoned you, but you have not escaped harm completely. Bethany has become tainted with the darkspawn's corruption. Anders claims that there may be Grey Wardens nearby, and that they're the only chance Bethany has of surviving.

You found a way out of the crypt where Bartrand abandoned you, but you have not escaped harm completely. Carver has become tainted with the darkspawn's corruption. Anders claims that there may be Grey Wardens nearby, and that they're the only chance Carver has of surviving.

You've arrived on the surface at long last, and it turns out the journey wasn't fruitless. You have the treasure you discovered in the tomb, and Varric says it will bring you both a fortune. Now to return home with the good news.

You've arrived on the surface at long last, and despite the personal cost, it wasn't a fruitless effort. You have the treasure you discovered in the tomb, and Varric says it will bring you both a fortune. Now to return home to tell Mother the bad news.
Leave Area
Hanged Man.
Is this something I have to get used to when traveling with you?
Maker preserve their stupid, stupid souls.
And I just cleaned my armor...
Traveling with you is never dull, Hawke.
Now those fellows were just sad, weren't they?
Corpse
Thank you, Hawke. This is the right thing to do.
I hope, for all our sakes, she's mistaken.
Because her Grace cares for peace, not your mad theories!
Blind? Elthina sees things all too clearly.

The Arishok refused to hand over the elven fugitives and ordered the Qunari to take over Kirkwall. You escaped and were aided by Knight-Commander Meredith, who is forming a defense and has asked for your help. The Arishok's men are taking captured citizens to the Viscount's Keep, though you're not sure why. If the Qunari are going to be confronted, it will have to be there.
The viscount has not tried to involve the Chantry before.
Right. So do this or the city burns.
But if they are abusing that freedom, they must be dealt with.
Sebastian? Was that his name?
Who is he?
Sebastian Vael. He was affirmed here nearly a decade ago.
He had just been invested as a brother when we got the news about his family.
I'm afraid he reacted rashly—denied his vows and left the Chantry. If the Maker wills it, he will return to himself before it's too late.
So he's some kind of priest?
He's a brother?
He is an initiate of the faith.
As a man, he cannot serve as a mother would, but he has led the Chant here many times.
Before last week, I would have said he was the most faithful of our true believers.
He said someone murdered his family?
What happened?
Sebastian is the youngest son of the ruling family of Starkhaven.
They were overthrown recently. Violently. Sebastian is the only surviving member.
He's royalty?
Ruling family?
Prince Sebastian Vael... if he succeeds in his pledge to take back his lands.
He made a vow to the Maker to put worldly concerns behind him.
It is a sin to forswear himself for a mere title.
I'll make sure he doesn't do anything he regrets.
I'll try to restrain him.
Thank you, Hawke. I trust your discretion.
These people murdered his family. He should do what he likes to them.
He deserves his revenge.
Andraste tells us that revenge is a cycle that only faith will break.
It is the Maker's role to show people the error of their ways. Not ours.
Contrary to your belief, not everyone is out to persecute mages.

Leave Area

Now that the viscount is dead, Knight-Commander Meredith rules the city with an iron fist, one that the mages have struggled against in the years following the Qunari attack. First Enchanter Orsino asked you to come to the Gallows at once to help him face yet another crisis with Kirkwall's templars.

Now that the viscount is dead, Knight-Commander Meredith rules the city with an iron fist, one that the mages have struggled against in the years following the Qunari attack. She asked you to come to the Gallows at once to help her face yet another crisis with the Circle of Magi.

Knight-Commander Meredith invoked the Right of Annulment, which means every mage in the city must die. The Gallows has been assaulted and First Enchanter Orsino is dead, having used blood magic to transform into a terrible abomination. Now only Meredith remains between you and escape.

You helped Knight-Commander Meredith assault the Gallows after she invoked the Right of Annulment. You took down First Enchanter Orsino when he used blood magic to transform himself into a terrible abomination. But even after all that, Meredith turned on you. The other templars are standing back as you face her in a duel to the death.

That goes against everything the Order believes. The Rite of Tranquility is a last resort—
Talk to me when you've seen a friend with his mind in shreds, Choir Boy.
I've met Ser Alrik. He is certainly not the face I would want put on the templars.
Back off, man! Are you mad?
He's a madman! Stop him!
This is why we need a Circle. Andraste knew, magic is too powerful for one man's will to contain.

Hawke should do it. Kirkwall needs a viscount.
Have you asked if she even wants that?
Have you asked him? It would be Hawke's decision.
I watched my parents in Starkhaven. When times are good, the city rules itself. Years could pass and no one would notice who's prince.
But when there's famine, when there's war, people look to their leaders. Who does Kirkwall have beyond Hawke?
This is probably a conversation for the two of you to have.
You want me to be viscount?
Andraste said, the Maker is king in the heavens, but it is the kings of Thedas who must recreate His worldly glory.
I keep thinking about that. Who better serves the Maker: a brother of the faith, or a prince who can sway a whole city?
A brother of the faith.
There's no better way to influence people than standing in a big building and singing, don't you think?
The best way to serve the Maker is in his Chantry.
A prince.
A prince can bring the word of Andraste to everyone under his rule.
Princes can make people do things. Priests have to beg.
More people follow the word of their king than their priest.
We all have our part to play.
Every person does the Maker's work in their own way.
You'll never know what the right choice is. Might as well just make one.
You should do what's right for you.
Elthina is risking her life by not deserting her flock. Could I do the same?
It's been fifteen years since I lived in Starkhaven. The people there are only a memory to me.
Kirkwall, the Chantry—that's real. That's where I belong.
You're a man of faith, Sebastian. You would have hated politics.
You're doing the right thing.
Great. Now that that's out of the way, let's get a drink.
Well, I'm glad that's settled.
For the rest of your life, you'll wonder what would have happened if you'd gone back.
You'll regret this.
Starkhaven's loss.
I'm glad you're staying.
Don't do this.
I know you and Anders are... It's not my place to question. But please, be careful.
He's a dangerous man. And selfish. Whatever he promised, don't think he'll ever put you above his own needs.
I... I can't say you didn't factor into my decision. But if I'm to stay in the Chantry...
You mean the world to me, Hawke. I couldn't have gotten through this time without you.
Join me in the Chantry. Pledge yourself to the Maker! We can serve Him together with a chaste marriage in His eyes.
Elthina still won't listen. She's determined to ride this wave until it crashes on the rocks.
If Elthina won't leave Kirkwall, neither will I.
I can't abandon her when the Divine's own agent warned her away.
The grand cleric is lucky to have your loyalty.
You're very devoted.
She'd be luckier were I willing to hit her over the head and carry her away. This isn't her battle.
How much damage could a few dozen angry mages do, anyway?
How bad could it be?
Laughs That's the problem, isn't it? Far more than I ever could.
What about your people?
So you'll abandon Starkhaven?
They can wait. Starkhaven hardly benefits if Kirkwall falls.
And I thought maybe I was the one you wanted to protect.
You're not staying for me?

It's hard to look at these apostates and not see Anders.
Andraste says we're all children of the Maker and deserve the freedom to walk by His side or throw ourselves to the Void.
Still, I can't imagine she would support this chaos.
This is the right thing to do.
Andraste wouldn't want her Chantry to be a prison and torture-chamber. We must reclaim her mercy.
Oh, she'd probably be lighting fires and screaming freedom with the rest of them.
Laughs I always imagined her with a bit more dignity... but she was a strong defender of the oppressed.
Andraste would side with the victims.
You're right. I should not need you to remind me of such things.
I'm sorry about the grand cleric. But there's much more at stake.
My sympathies on Elthina.
She was a mother to me. To every brother and sister in the chantry. He never took a moment to get to know her.
But not every mage is Anders. We're here to help those who have suffered unduly at our hands.
We've made our decision. I can't go back on it now.
It's too late now.
Then I pray Andraste is watching from the Maker's side and understands that whatever happens, our intentions were good.
I've never known a woman like you. I wish... Never mind. We cannot afford distractions now.
I don't know that we can win this, Hawke, or even if we should. But I will not turn from you now.
You've been a good friend. It will be my honor to fight at your side.
We must show that the Chantry cannot condone tyranny among its templars. We'll worry about the mages after.
To victory, my friend, by any means necessary.
If Elthina had stood firm behind the knight-commander, this wouldn't have happened.
They will all pay for what Anders did.
There are times when even the best intentions lead to the Void.
That was a terrible way to die. The grand cleric deserved better.
I'm sorry about Elthina.
As did your mother, Hawke. We've both lost those dear to us to these maleficarum.
Let's skip the mushy stuff. We've got mages to kill.
I'm bad at long goodbyes.
Laughs And there's no one I'd rather do that with.
Their rebellion will stop here!
We will crush this revolt.
I would not speak ill of the dead, but I wish Elthina had understood that need.
These mages will not stop until they overthrow the Chantry. There was never peace to be made with them.
You're an amazing woman, Hawke. Had we met in different times... But let's not think on that now.
We must defeat these mages, whatever it takes. They shall face the righteousness of the Maker.
The Maker favors us in this fight. He must, for we defend against His enemies.
If we fall here, may we meet again at His side.
Though I walk through the mists on the edge of the Void, I shall not fear, for you are with me...
