Aveline's Office
Might be a good time to check back home. You'll be gone for a while, after all.
Gamlen mentioned a letter waiting at home. This might be a good time to get it.
I saw a woman in the alienage that was desperate for help. If we have time, maybe we could speak with her?
Since Bartrand's busy buying new undershorts, let's check into that elf I saw in the alienage. Couldn't hurt.
This might be a good time to look into that rumor in the alienage.
My sources mentioned a young woman outside the chantry in Hightown who was looking for help. Might be worth looking into.
This might be a good time to look into Varric's rumor about the woman outside the chantry.
Wasn't there a dwarven merchant looking for help? If we have time we could seek him out.
You know, there is that merchant I mentioned. More coin never hurts, right?
This might be a good time to look for Javaris, that merchant Varric mentioned.
Wasn't there something about a Chantry sister in Lowtown? You could kill some time checking that out.
We could always look into that Chantry sister slumming in Lowtown. We have the time, right?
This might be a good time to look into Varric's rumor about a Chantry sister fishing for help in Lowtown.
I need your help. Not like last time. This is about the Qunari and... it needs to be fixed fast.
You've settled in nicely.
I deserve it.
It's been hard work to get here.
It's just luck...and skill.
Indeed. Still, more coin never hurts, right? Say, if someone wanted to pass some work your way... ?
Things are busy, Aveline. What's your point?
What is it now?
Yes, good—use that tone on him! Get him out of my hair.
I'm listening, Aveline. What's the trouble?
You can always ask me.
So, how can I be of service this time?
Everybody needs something.
Someone's trying to be a guard. Poorly.
Remember Emeric? The templar? He wants your help and some sort of official sanction.
A templar. Emeric. You don't know him, but he knows you. He wants your help and some sort of official sanction.
Official sanction?
A thorn in my side inventing trouble and scaring people.
For his investigation. He's convinced that every random murder in the past few years is connected, and he won't be quiet.
You don't think it's worth investigating?
Why not check it out?
I have. He even convinced one of my lieutenants to raid the DuPuis mansion. Nothing there.
You wouldn't believe how much ass I had to kiss after that. Bloody hobbyist constable.
Sighs Why can't he spend his declining years building a boat or something?
What can I do that you can't?
And you want me to do what?
I would never say as much, but... he keeps asking for you. Maybe just showing up will calm him down.
He's in the Gallows. If it leads somewhere real, I'll take it off your plate.
Anything to shut him up.
I seem to recall he had some good leads.
He had a good start.
Then you won't mind chasing his threads. If it leads somewhere, I'll pick it up. Right now, he's just distracting my men.
I'll talk to him. Maybe it will lead to something.
Where is he?
If it does, I'll pick it up. Right now, he's just distracting my men.
Thanks, Hawke. I'll try not to make a habit of this.
Muzzle the geezer. Got it.
I'll quiet him down.
I would never say that. But if it leads somewhere genuine, I'll pick it up on your word.
If he shuts up, that's good too.
He's in the Gallows. Do what you can.
He's in the Gallows. Thanks, Hawke. I appreciate it.
Emeric. You've been bothering the captain.
Hello, Emeric. Aveline says you need my help again?
Hello, Emeric. The guard captain says you're still chasing disappearing acts.
Care to tell my why you're bothering the captain of the guard?
Aveline sent me.
My men raided that house. There was nothing, and I've heard no end because of it. You were reprimanded, I hope.
Seems like it should be easy to prove if there are bodies.
Are you sure he's wrong?
Kirkwall isn't the safest place. That doesn't mean everything terrible is related.
If you're going to be picky, the common thread in most of the trouble is you.
There's no sense to that. Can't be.
Someone's always trying to take over at night. But someone else will always pay for their removal.
These thugs are plaguing the streets. I don't see a problem in giving them the fight they want.
These streets should be safe at night. Care to help out with that?
I don't make my guards fight gangs in dark corners. But if you'd like to help...
The streets aren't safe at night. We should do something about that.
How can these nighttime streets be so dangerous? We should clear these idiot thugs out.
Someone's always trying to claim the streets. If you make them safe to travel at night, someone will reward you.
Kirkwall nights aren't safe—always some group of thugs around. Someone will usually pay for their removal, though.
There's always pretenders out at night. Sometimes you have to correct them. Good coin in it, too.
Idiot thugs and their gangs. Always around at night, but there's good coin in getting rid of them.
Bad people come out at night. It would be good to get rid of them.
What makes the gangs so angry at night? Someone should do something about them.
Never a shortage of idiots who think they can take the streets in the dark. But good reward in getting rid of them.
Always coin in getting rid of idiots. Especially thugs who target the streets just because it's dark.
Thugs in the dark. Bet someone would pay for clearing them out.
There's got to be someone who'll pay for clearing these idiots off the streets.

Follow me.
I'll take you there.
Ma serannas. Thank you.
I want to look around some more.

Wilderness
And they can't leave without it. All of this could have been avoided!
Maybe giving it back would solve Aveline's problem.
Return it, and the Qunari go?
It couldn't hurt!
Says you. I know it will save my skin.
Sighs Why can't this be as easy as you?
That mess is over a couple of elves. I need it to save my own skin.
There's more at stake. But... the Arishok waited this long. Ugh! I don't know.
Don't make us regret it.
This is important. Don't interrupt with your selfish prattle.
Get off your high horse. I have problems, too.
Scoffs What drink should I order? and Who's the father?
Oh, you little…
Hawke—the Arishok is sheltering two fugitives who have converted to the Qun. He must be convinced to release them.
He's already feared because of Petrice. If people start to think he can ignore the law... I need your help so this doesn't get out of hand.
I'm going to die!
There. Got your attention. Real problem.
Hold on. What's this about?
One at a time.
Remember the relic? The one Castillon is going to kill me over? A man called Wall-Eyed Sam has it.
I'm trying to keep the entire city from rioting against the Qunari!
Well, maybe it's connected.
What?
I'm just saying maybe it will help. It's important to someone, right?
This can't be! I'll wake up, and this will all be a terrible dream.
They'll never forgive me. If you weren't here, Hawke, they'd kill me.
I can't go back there, Hawke. You heard Fenarel. If I put one foot inside the camp, the others will attack us.
Everyone, shut up!
What is it now, you two?
Are there any good seats left?
Now you start being responsible? Shit.
Make some sense, both of you!
Just get to the point!
Or losing a friend.
I heard Arishok and die. What's this about?
Start over.
If you help me get it, Castillon won't kill me. Please.
The relic issue has to be resolved before we take on the Qunari.
We help Isabela first.
The Qunari situation is more critical, Isabela.
We deal with the Arishok.
Isn't it odd that someone would run to the Qunari?
Who are the fugitives?
They're elves accused of murder. Maybe they feel they've nothing to lose by fleeing the alienage.
And if their conversion is genuine?
I... don't know. But how many more will try it if I allow this? Justice must be respected.
You're expecting trouble?
What will happen?
After what happened to the viscount's son? Yes.
I'm hoping the Qunari aren't looking for a fight. I'm hoping they'll be reasonable. But we'll see.
This seems like a issue for you and your guards. Quite a few of them.
Why come to me, Aveline?
Sending a full patrol would just increase tension. But you're right: I am the captain. It's my responsibility.
But... I suspect the viscount was hoping I would bring this to you.
Then he should have come himself.
Perhaps, but it's understandable that he's not at his best. I'd like to help him, if I can.
You're sure this is the relic you're after?
Isabela, this is your relic?
Why has this come up so suddenly, Isabela?
And you just now heard this?
You trust her this much?
Probably not. I wouldn't.
They won't wait at the compound forever, Hawke. I really do hope this helps, because if it doesn't...
But... it could be over! I can't... I can't let it slip away again!
I have to go. With or without you.
Hawke, if it could help...
Very well. We'll deal with her problem, and appease the Arishok later.
Fine, we help Isabela first.
Not too much later. The mess at the compound will only get worse.
Buck up, big girl. It's a wonderful day.
It is over, Isabela. This is just more important, and more lives are at stake.
No, the city is paramount.
Right. Of course it's more important. Everything is.
Goodbye, Hawke. Go save the world if it means that much to you.
This has already cost too much.
Meet me at the Qunari Compound, Hawke. Finish up any other business first.
It's already a mess, and it's going to get worse.
She's gone. She took it. That bitch-born whore!
Well, now we get to deal with the Arishok and the fugitives ourselves. That's good.
That's enough. Let's go to the compound.
Come on. Aveline will be waiting at the Qunari Compound. We still have to deal with that mess.
Oh, no, no, no. If anyone kicks her ass, it's me.
Let us do this quickly. I have no wish to stay here.
There is an injustice here that must be stopped—one way or another.
Come, let us act while we still can.
This is no time to speak.
Let us do this quickly. I have no wish to stay here.
There is an injustice here that must be stopped—one way or another.
Come, let us act while we still can.
This is no time to speak.

The continued Qunari presence in the city is causing tensions to rise. The viscount's concern appears matched by the Arishok's annoyance. The root of the problem must be found.
With the streets now safe from the Kirkwall Killer, all attention is focusing on the growing Qunari problem. The viscount will send a letter noting any new concerns.

Tensions between the Qunari and the Kirkwall citizenry continue to rise, fueled by overzealous elements within the Chantry. The viscount hopes the matter has been settled, but there is still clear cause for concern.

First Enchanter Orsino is openly challenging Knight-Commander Meredith's reign. The situation is growing more violent. There is a letter waiting from the knight-commander that may offer more.
Under increasing templar pressure, more mages are turning to blood magic... with devastating consequences. Be alert for letters from both the knight-commander and first enchanter to stay involved.

The mages are close to open rebellion. Though Thrask is dead and his conspiracy stopped, the situation remains tense. Look for letters from both Meredith and Orsino, as the Champion will likely be called to defend Kirkwall once more.

All of the conspirators were killed. Return to Sergeant Joanna in Lowtown before nightfall.

Letter from Meeran

Hawke,
You were a pain in the ass to deal with, but a bloody talented one. If you get sick of being just another unemployed refugee in this shithole, maybe we can grab a drink. If there's any odd jobs my boys can't handle, I'll send them your way.
You're welcome, Meeran

Hawke,
Your year's up and you're free to go. Despite what you think, we had a good thing working together. I might pass along an opportunity or two, if you're willing to get your hands dirty. Stay safe.
Athenril

Varric's sources say that there's been a number of templar raids held in Lowtown's elven alienage. He can't verify why, however, or who's been giving the orders.
According to Varric, the templars have been actively hunting for a young man named Feynriel. His mother, Arianni, lives in Lowtown's elven alienage and has been seeking help.
According to Varric, a group of mages being transported from Starkhaven hasn't arrived at the Gallows. It's currently just a rumor, however, and cannot be followed up on at this time.
Act of Mercy
According to Varric's sources, someone's been asking questions about a missing templar. No search seems to be underway, however, and nothing can be done to follow up on this just yet.
Varric's sources say that a woman by the name of Macha has been desperately seeking a particular templar. She's been spotted outside of the chantry in Hightown during the day.
Enemies Among Us
Varric says a dwarven merchant named Javaris has been offering a lot of coin for muscle. Finding out exactly where Javaris is, however, seems to be a problem. He'll keep looking.

According to Varric, a dwarven merchant named Javaris has been offering good coin in exchange for help. He's already left the city, but Varric is certain he could be caught up to near either the Wounded Coast or Sundermount.
Blackpowder Promise
Varric has heard rumors that some in the Chantry have been making quiet inquiries around Lowtown about the Qunari. No one seems willing to talk about it, though.

Varric's contacts say that a Chantry sister has been flashing coin around Lowtown, fishing for help with some unnamed problem. Details are light, but it may have something to do with the Qunari. He recommends checking for her in Lowtown.
Shepherding Wolves

I shudder to think what the knight-commander will do when she learns of this blood mage's plot.
Did I mention that you look lovely today, Maren?
You tell me that every day. Twice, sometimes. It's never true.
I wouldn't say it if it weren't.
On the days I'm covered in halla dung? Not pretty, Chandan.
Keeper, a moment?
Of course, da'len.
Do you not think we should get another... halla master?

You've seen nothing of him?
Not since morning.
We'll watch for him, Ineria. Have no fear.
Do you think the varterral...?

You are such an idiot.
Radha went out days ago, and she never came back.
I said, that's enough!
Idiot.
The whole clan is on edge.

Keeper...
Andaran atish'an, Junar.
Should we not move on soon? The shemlen in the city have been sending caravans this way.
When it's time, da'len.
Where's the bow I gave you last week?
It's in my aravel.
Bring it here, I want a look at it.
Why?
I just do. Don't argue with your elders.
I haven't tossed my brand new bow into a puddle or set it on fire, Master Ilen. It's fine.

Working for Meeran held the templars off for a while, but... now we're on our own.
We've got nothing to stop the next person who tries to sell us out. This expedition was our last chance...
Don't worry, Bethany. I won't let any big bad templars come get you.
Just relax.
It's not a joke!
I can't spend my whole life looking over my shoulder for templars, Bethany.
The templars are your problem.
If the templars find me, the best I can hope is to be locked away for the rest of my life! If they don't kill me outright!
We need coin, status, something we can hide behind. As long as we're just refugees, we're no one.
Maybe Gamlen knows someone who can talk to Bartrand for us...
A bloody templar. Just what we need.
Why is a templar guarding her? Is this a setup?
Or getting too close to someone with a pet templar.
Better out there than here with the templar.
Can we help this woman? This could be Mother...
How could you? We would never—
Bone Pit Miner
Bone Pit Miner
Bone Pit Miner
Bone Pit Miner
Better to work our way into this expedition than sit around waiting to be thrown in the Gallows.
Bone Pit Miner
I'm just going to stand in this... shadow... over here.
Orana
I just keep waiting for the templars to knock on that door...
Do you think the templars will find us here? Maybe we'd be safer with the other refugees...
Let's not talk where there might be templars. When we get home.
Oh, good. We'll just be leaving, then... to go somewhere that isn't the Gallows.
No. No templars in this family.
Do we need to be here? Why do you keep talking to him?
It's the knight-captain. Don't.
Maybe we shouldn't be arguing with the nice templar. Smile and nod... smile and nod...
It's him—that templar from Arianni. I knew this was a bad idea.
Uh-oh. This one will be a harder nut to crack.
As just as his cause is, it scares me. I don't want to give the templars another reason to hunt us.
He's Tranquil. The templars... they did this to him...
Maybe Aveline can find us some work. She's got a position with the city guard now.
Sure, easy. But... maybe Aveline's got some bounties out. She joined the city guard, right?
I said I'm going. Besides, if we're so bloody afraid of templars, I should go and she should hide!
I'm not ending up like that. We're not ending up like that!
I didn't spend the year fighting to give up now.
I don't plan on hiding.
Right. Always got a plan. But I need to know what it is, too.
You can relax. After all, the templars dogging us are mine.
You're no mage. Why worry?
Did I sound that bad? Maker, I'm turning into Gamlen.
We've got to make him take us. Force him, somehow.
We need coin, status, something we can shove in that dwarf's face. And keep people off our backs.
Maybe Gamlen knows someone?
Shrine
My sister always has something up her sleeve. She'd better.
My brother always has something up his sleeve. He'd better.
What are you doing? We need whatever we can get!
What? I thought we were taking whatever we could get.
Of course he is. That's just bloody great.
We're scraping to bribe Bartrand, and you don't think having an estate would help?
This is the advantage we need!
Sure it would, but it won't be free. How much unwanted attention will warring with slavers get us?
So much for not attracting templar attention.
Shit! Here we go!
Oh, more attention. That's just grand.
Brother, not now.
Sister, not now.
Yes, how can you say that to the templar right in front of you?
It's the blasted knight-captain. Don't.
Probably for the best, Sister.
Probably for the best, Brother.
And your point is?
It sounds brutal... and effective.

What, you'd teach the templars their own faith? They seem pretty devout.
Better make this good. We're risking a lot if we anger the templars.
For him? We'll be hunted for sure now.
The templars will think the same. We're friends with a monster.

This will be Mother if we're not careful.

Best not to go to the Deep Roads while Mother's estate is in question.
I suppose we should deal with Mother's estate. It matters to her.
Smart to clear up the problems of your family before you get tied up with mine.
Let's put Flemeth's amulet where it needs to be. We shouldn't leave that unresolved.
We still need to get that amulet up Sundermount. Started it, better finish it.
Yes, don't you have an appointment up Sundermount with some amulet or other?
We should clear up the mess with Feynriel, like we promised.
Let's clear up the mess with that Feynriel boy. We shouldn't leave that unfinished.
Maybe you should tackle the mess with that Feynriel boy? Don't want to leave that just hanging behind you.
Still need to clear up the mess with that mage-boy, Feynriel.
Why don't we finish up with Javaris and the Qunari? Things could go very wrong while we're away.
We should deal with Javaris and the Qunari. Who knows what we'd find when we came back.
Ah, right. Best not to leave the mess with Javaris and the Qunari behind us.
Better finish up with Javaris and the Qunari. Don't want to leave that mess behind me.
We still need wrap up that mess for Thrask. I do not want to give a templar an excuse to come looking for us.
We still have that business with Thrask to take care of. Don't leave a templar waiting forever.
Better use your time wisely. Maybe finish up what that templar Thrask wanted you to do, hmm?
Better wrap things up with Thrask. Don't leave a templar wanting.
Better finish up with Sister Petrice. Doesn't she have a templar working for her?
We need to finish up with Sister Petrice. The one with the pet templar?
Right. Better finish up with that Sister Petrice and her pet templar.
Still have Petrice's mess to deal with. Started it, better finish it.
Better check on that letter asking for help before heading into the Deep Roads.
We need to wrap up that situation with Keran. It's not safe to leave templar business unfinished.
We should wrap up that situation with Keran. Can't leave templar business behind us.
I suppose you need to deal with that Keran fellow. Leaving a templar job half-finished will bite you in the ass.
Better wrap up that mess with that templar recruit, Keran. Can't have that dogging me in the Deep Roads.
The money from this trip could fix everything! You need us. We've fought darkspawn!
You make him understand! We're running from your bloody templars!
I'm in charge. You do what I say!
Shut up!
Right, Brother.
Right, Sister.
My brother can be hotheaded, but we do have the skills to benefit your expedition.
I know how you feel, but we'll earn no favors with your fist in his face.
This isn't helping.
My brother has a point. It's on his head, but it's still valid.
You're right, but settle down.
Oh, thanks for that.
Harimann Estate
My brother can be a fool, but he's right about this. We are what you need.
Then we do nothing, as always.
So what about it, Bartrand? We're just what you need.
Too many refugees disappear for you to threaten people who could help us!
You were no help.
I know. I just... how long do we work for scum who don't want us around?
It'll get harder if we're at each other's throats.
Show some support.
I know. It just... seems like you either die in this city, or you end up like the scum we're bargaining with.
Gamlen. He's got the head for this garbage. Maybe he can talk to Bartrand.
I wouldn't trust him with a silver, but dear uncle's at least as sleazy as Bartrand.
A bad idea, but the only one.
He got us into the city, more or less. If there's a chance he can push Bartrand...
He's helped us get this far.
He knows some people. After last week, we need all the coin and influence we can get.
You catch more flies with honey, but Gamlen's bullshit could work too.
Risky, but worth checking.
Find Sandal somewhere in the Deep Roads side passages.
And all I can think of is Uncle Gamlen.
Worth checking, I guess.
How's that for a compliment?

Directions to the Sharps' Base
We’ve got a new base and you lot best keep the law away. Directions to the Lowtown sneak below, but don’t come unless you’ve got good news or you’ll get an answer square between the eyes.
Ignacio Strand
She is my sister.
He is my brother.
So, do you still blame all of this on me?
Still hold a grudge?
Do you still expect me to? I'd like to think we've both changed.
I guess we'll have to wait and see, won't we?
It's good to see you. I hope the years have been kind.
I'm glad you're doing well.
I can't say that. The Blight is long over, but the threat never really goes away.
I don't know if you can understand that. Maybe someday.
Don't you have Archdemons to hunt or something?
Why are you down here?
There's a considerable gap between Blights, you know. Apparently, just long enough for people to forget.
We Wardens don't have that luxury, though.
Well, just like old times.
Still coming to the rescue after all these years? I have it under control, but thanks.
I know. When we got the news, the Wardens helped me hold a wake. I'm... glad you were with her. In her final moments.

Door
No, this can't be right.
The Champion was an apostate who came to Kirkwall to spread subversion against the Chantry.
The Champion and his apostate sister came to Kirkwall to spread subversion against the Chantry.
But you claim this wasn't the case.
The Champion just happened to have dealings with the Qunari, joined forces with a known raider, a blood mage, a rebel Warden… and for what? Coin?
Maybe it's not as simple as you imagine, Seeker.
Simple? Do I need to remind you what your friends did?
Do I need to tell you how many lives have been lost, how many more will be lost?
You cannot sit there and tell me he is innocent!
You cannot sit there and tell me she is innocent!
I don't know if innocent is the right word, exactly…
He must have known! Somehow the Champion knew what was down there. That’s why he wanted to join your expedition.
She must have known! Somehow the Champion knew what was down there. That’s why she wanted to join your expedition.
No. None of us knew. If we had...
He wouldn't have let his sister step foot into that blighted hole.
She wouldn't have let her sister step foot into that blighted hole.
He wouldn't have let his brother step foot into that blighted hole.
She wouldn't have let her brother step foot into that blighted hole.
This would all have turned out very differently.
Is that so? Then tell me your version of what happened on this expedition.
Well, we entered the Deep Roads as planned, but we didn't get very far…
So the Champion’s sister was in the Circle.
So the Champion’s brother was a templar.
So the Champion’s sister was a Grey Warden.
So the Champion’s brother was a Grey Warden.
So the Champion was responsible for his sister’s death.
So the Champion was responsible for her sister’s death.
So the Champion was responsible for his brother's death.
So the Champion was responsible for her brother's death.
Yes, but that’s not the connection you're looking for.
Isn't it? Driven from their home, a sister taken against her will?
Isn't it? How else did an apostate remain invisible for so long without help from within the templars?
Isn't it? The involvement of the Grey Wardens makes perfect sense.
Isn't it? Guilt makes for the perfect motivation.
And the Champions’ companions? Merrill, Aveline, Isabela... that Warden, Anders.
And the Champions’ companions? Merrill, Aveline... that Warden, Anders.
Don't remind me. I introduced them.
We thought they all came from Ferelden together, but now it makes sense. Motive and opportunity.
It's still not what you think.
Then I need to hear more.
Unless you've already decided. I can always go if you don't need me anymore…
Tell me what came next.
Don't be so nervous.
Don't be so nervous.
This should be fun.
Don't be so nervous.
Gamlen's boots smell worse than usual. Sniff Ugh! Mabari's been marking his territory again.
Looks like the dog's trying to tunnel his way out of this hovel. Can't blame him.
I can't have Mother living in this hole. We've got to get out of here.
What is that stain?
I feel itchy just looking at that thing.
We should rent this room out.
I think this is the same cheese that was here a year ago.
One scrubbing brush, never used.
Sighs The house won't clean itself, Uncle.
Didn't Fenris say all Tevinter wine is made from the blood and tears of slaves?
I hope he was exaggerating.
Fenris said Danarius left this at the mansion.
If you're telling the truth.
If you are, then… what happened at the Gallows may be far different than we assumed. I need to hear it.
Let’s say I tell you. Then what?
Are you hunting for an infamous apostate? Is that what this is all about? Or is it revenge?
Is the Chantry out for revenge? Is that what this is all about?
No. It's not that.
Then what about me? If what I tell you isn't what you want to hear, will you still let me go?
Tell me what really happened.
Are you sure about this? The Champion was asked to go to the Qunari?
I suppose you think he planned the entire thing?
I suppose you think she planned the entire thing?
Considering what it led to…
Come on, Seeker. I'm not going to sell Hawke short, but nobody could have foreseen the way that would go down.
Or do you still think I'm lying to protect my friend?
There are elements of your story that… make sense. And you couldn't have known about them otherwise.
Well, that’s a relief.
But that doesn't mean you're telling me everything.
I want this story to be told. You're not the first to get it all wrong.
I think I owe Hawke that much.
Then Meredith turned on the Champion. She was to blame.
Then Meredith provoked the Circle. She was to blame.
Or that damned idol was. Or Anders. Take your pick.
Even so, had the Champion not been there…
Then, I suppose, Meredith would be ruling the city still.
It might never have even gone that far.
Is that what this is all about?
You take the book.
I wonder what Bethany would say about all this.
Never thought I'd miss you putting frogs in my bed, Sister.
Wish you were still here.
I'm keeping your sword polished and sharp for you, Brother.
It's insane, but I almost miss his whining.
I've accumulated a lot of junk over the years.
Isabela seemed disappointed that she didn't find anything worth gossiping about. Snoop.
If I catch Sandal rifling through my personal items one more time...
Everything that's left of my life in Lothering...
I could've left the amulet in there and forgotten all about it. What would the witch have done then?
Lots of old things from Lothering in there.
Idunna
Our appreciation for attending the vows of Aveline and Donnic Hendyr. So many guards, and not one on duty. Nice.
Borrowed one of your dresses. Again, Isabela? I have no idea how she manages to fit into them.
Another invitation requesting the presence of the Champion? How many noble parties are there each week?
Meredith's a loony. Who sent this?
I'm glad Bethany always writes.
Ah, Carver. Still as resentful as ever.
Sorry. I was expecting treasure, not spiders. Get well soon. Love, Isabela.
Why do I let her drag me into these things?
I came in and watered your plants! Lots of love, Merrill. That girl's way too nice.
I came in and watered your plants! Your friend, Merrill. Well, that was nice of her.
I'm proud of you. Love, Mother.
Anders's manifesto? Sighs This thing turns up everywhere.
So much has happened since we got here. I'm glad I've got it all written down.
Had breakfast. Visited privy. Took Mother to haberdasher. Huh. Must've been a slow day.
Flemeth.
I thought that might interest you.
You expect me to believe a myth swooped out of the Wilds to save the Champion?
Oh, come now, Seeker. Do I need to recite the tale of the Warden as well?
No. Perhaps I shouldn't be surprised to hear of her involvement.
I liked my version better, too.
What else aren't you telling me, then? Did she send someone with the Champion?
In a manner of speaking.
So it’s true. Continue. But if you tell me they all flew to Kirkwall on a dragon…
Nothing so fanciful, I assure you.
Bullshit. That's not what really happened!
Does that not match the story you've heard, Seeker?
I'm not interested in stories. I came to hear the truth.
What makes you think I know the truth?
Don't lie to me! You knew him even before he became the Champion!
Even if I did, I don't know where he is now.
Don't lie to me! You knew her even before she became the Champion!
Even if I did, I don't know where she is now.
Do you have any idea what's at stake here?
Let me guess: your precious Chantry's fallen to pieces and put the entire world on the brink of war?
And you need the one person who could help you put it back together.
The Champion was at the heart of it when it all began.
If you can't point me to him, tell me everything you know.
If you can't point me to her, tell me everything you know.
You aren't worried I'll just make it up as I go?
Not at all.
You'll need to hear the whole story.
The Champion and her apostate sister came to Kirkwall to spread subversion against the Chantry.
The Champion just happened to have dealings with the Qunari, joined forces with a blood mage, a rebel Warden… and for what? Coin?
Crude drawings in the margins? Sighs Isabela, grow up.
I see Varric's taken it upon himself to add certain embellishments to my journal.
What's this? Oh, Anders's manifesto. Again.
I wonder how much coin I'd make selling my memoirs.
I never have time to write in my journal these days.
Who opened this? Has Sandal been reading my journal? Can Sandal even read?
That dog! Well, maybe chew marks add character to the piece.
Paw prints? I told him to stay off the bed!
Merrill's been jumping on the bed again.
Are those...? A mage and a grown man, and Anders can't pick up his own dirty socks?
I wish Orana would sleep on a real bed.
Fenris hates that statue. Says it reminds him of the Old God relics they had in Tevinter.
Ah... this statue. Wait. Where did I get this statue?
Its eyes follow me around the room. Creepy.
Is that...? Isabela! Who carves that into a stairwell!
All right, so she said to look at the crest sideways, then cover the... Sweet Maker, Isabela! I can't unsee that!
Ah, it's good to be important.
Never thought I'd have my own family crest.
Didn't I see this crest hanging somewhere in the Viscount's Keep?
Can't believe the King of Ferelden eats fifteen pounds of cheese a week. Some Grey Warden appetite!
Sandal sure eats a lot of cheese.
Where do these cheese wheels come from?
Starkhaven Aged Grating Cheese. Did Bodahn buy this?
This looks just like the cheese on the Chanter's Board. I'm harboring a fugitive fromage!
Wish Bodahn would clean the fireplace. Says it reminds him of a mineshaft.
Hey, look! A partially burned page from Anders's manifesto.
Orana's a patient music teacher, but Merrill should really just stick to magic.
Anders may have talents, but playing the lute isn't one of them.
One of the few things Orana owns.
Orana plays the lute beautifully. Must have been one of her duties as a slave.
Ah, the complaints from the neighbors about a Fereldan moving into Hightown. Thanks for filing those, Aveline.
Ah, and another page from Anders's manifesto.
Uh, I think I'll let Sandal empty that.
I think Merrill named this falcon sculpture Finnegan.
No, wait... that's wrong. Finnegan's on the north face. This one's Messere Pointy-Face.
Maker's breath! Put some clothes on, man!
Nice view. I see the Arenbergs have made up.
I wonder where Varric is today. Telling stories about my exploits to anyone who will listen, most likely.
I should get some curtains.
Handprints? Was someone swinging on the chandelier? Merrill...
Handprints? Was someone swinging on the chandelier? Sandal...
Best keep Isabela's books on the top shelf. Don't want to scar Sandal.
The complete People's Laws of Kirkwall. A friendly reminder from Aveline.
A Hundred and One Uses for a Phallic Tuber. Thanks, Isabela, that's a hundred too many.
Fenris's reading has improved. I should pick out a new book for him to work on.
Hard in Hightown: Siege Harder. What does that even mean? Varric must be stopped.
Leather to Feather: Crossroads of Form. I don't even know where to start.
Another copy of Anders's manifestos? Has he been stuffing them into all the books?
The Pursuit of Knowledge, by Brother Genitivi. Varric recommended this book, didn't he?
It's been years, and it's still difficult going into Mother's room.
That's Mother's room. I shouldn't intrude.
I can't bring myself to change anything about Mother's room.
The only thing Merrill's moved in. Maybe she doesn't feel that this is her home yet.
I'll have to remember to water that thing.
Death was too light a punishment, Quentin.
I still expect Mother to greet me at the door sometimes.
I'm Champion now, Mother. I wish you could've lived to see it.
I'm sorry, Mother.
A gift from Aveline. She certainly knows her spirits.

A Scribbled Note

It's close, now. My long wait is almost over.
Am I doing the right thing? It all seemed so clear to me, but now... what have I become? When did this happen? Someone will eventually try to stop me. I've left too many clues for them not to. When they come, should I try to stop them? Maybe the Maker took her from me because I deserved to lose her.
No. It's too late for me to stop, now. The Maker will need to stop me if he thinks I need to be stopped.
No one else.
If we hurry, there might be a trail we can follow.
There's another!
More blood. I'm on the right path.
That bastard better not have touched her.
I'm getting closer.
Where is he taking her?
There. I hope I'm not too late.
There! The foundry! They must have gone inside!
Mother must be here somewhere. We need to look around.
There. More blood. They are here, somewhere.
Where is she?
I have a bad feeling about this.
She has to be here. She has to be.
She must be down here somewhere.
Some kind of magical barrier. There must be a way past it.
Mother!
Alessa.
What... is this?
The woman in the painting... she almost looks like Mother.
I need to find her. Now.
These books... all magic involving dead things. Necromancy.
Why would he have these? What's he planning?
Maker's breath, that smell...
Does he... live here?
I'd wrap up any other business before we go. It's already a mess, and could get worse.
Let's go.
I'm ready.
I still have things I need to do.
Not yet.
Don't forget—as soon as you're finished wrapping up your business, we'll need to go to the Qunari Compound together.

Time to wrap up any business you have in the city, my friend. We'll be gone for several weeks at least.

A Letter from Meredith

Dear Champion,
A title is a poor reward for all that you did for this city against the Qunari. Would that I could give you what you truly deserve. In the meantime, accept this gift, and know that I will always consider you a champion of our faith as much as a defender of our city.
Warm regards,
Knight-Commander Meredith

Champion,
You deserve your new title, despite what Knight-Commander Meredith might prefer. You and I both know what would have happened had you not been there to face the Qunari. I'm sure you've received no shortage of accolades from the powers that be in this city, but for what it's worth, I'm sending a gift from the Circle of Magi, too. Use it well.
Regards,
First Enchanter Orsino

The witch kept her word.
They sailed north across the Waking Sea, lashed by terrible storms.
And then they saw it: Kirkwall, the City of Chains.
That's when I first met the Champion.
Hey!
How do you do? Varric Tethras, at your service.
We should talk privately in the Hanged Man.
You owe us, Isabela.
Captain Isabela.
Me and my boys will get our money's worth, bitch.
Someone from my past has been pestering me. I've arranged for a duel, but I don't trust him to play fair.
I think I could manage watching your back.
Chuckles I'll bet.
So, you want to know about the Champion?
What makes you think I know the truth?

You knew him even before he became the Champion.
The entire world on the brink of war...
